results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.
results.name: Sunday Night Tennis @ Crotona Park

results.description:
Let's take our practice outside this Sunday in Fort Lee Historic Park!  Our lovely scenic lawn is waiting for us! Bring your mat or a beach towel and some water if the weather is hot.  I can bring some extra mats if you let me know in advance. Also, if you need a ride from Shala Zeni, message me or let me know in the comments and be at the Shala at 5:40pm please (if I don't hear specifically, I'll assume you are meeting us at the park). 

We'll meet at 6PM at the Fort Lee Historic Park parking lot and will walk from there to a hidden lawn at the Southern-most point of the park with scenic overlook of the GW bridge, Manhattan skyline & Edgewater marina.  

DIRECTIONS (by car, walking, bike or public transportation): CLICK HERE or see picture below.  Meeting point is at the top of the ramp inside the park (where the star is on the picture).  

Pricing: $10 per person.
results.name: Sunday Sunset Yoga in Fort Lee Historic Park (Outdoors)

group.name: Outdoor Yoga, Fort Lee NJ Studio Yoga, Hikes & Retreats

results.description:
Welcome to the Brooklyn Ark’s main weekly event—our Sunday Gathering (6:30-8:30pm at 48 Wall Street—5th Floor). If you are looking for a church, synagogue, or space to wrestle with big questions, this is your place. We invite you to plug into the Brooklyn Ark Community this Sunday, and experience the authentic community and intelligent Bible teaching you've been looking for. 

Community

The Brooklyn Ark is made up of people that are getting to know and care about each other. We are making the Big City smaller - one relationship at a time.

Culture

The Brooklyn Ark deeply supports the creative expression of truth through music, poetry & visual arts.  You will discover that we cultivate an art-friendly atmosphere.

Faith

We curiously read and discuss the Bible (Hebrew & Greek Scriptures), asking questions, seeking out answers, and trying to find practical application for our lives. 

Learn more about the Brooklyn Ark: http://www.brooklynark.com/
results.how_to_find_us: Head up to the 5th Floor.
results.name: Weekly Sunday Gathering: Making the Big City Smaller One Relationship at a Time

venue.name: The Cabana Yacht

results.description:
Celebrate "No Work Monday" at our annual Labor Day 'Tip Off' Yacht Cruise!   

Mix, mingle, drink & dance the night away with 300 singles from multi-Meetup groups while enjoying a panoramic view of NYC skyline on a 100 foot long, 2-deck private yacht.

What's included:

• Light Appetizers

• DJ

• Ice-Breakers

• Cash bar

• Prizes

• 300 singles (20s, 30s, 40s)

*We already have 250+ members prepaid for this cruise and only 50 tickets left!  This will SELL OUT quickly so get your tickets today!

*$25 w/ discount code "5", price goes up to $50 as event gets closer. MUST PREPAY HERE (No tix sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Sep-06-2015_at_0700PM

• The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels. The main level is air-conditioned and enclosed and there is an outside deck on the second level. 

• Boarding starts at 6:45pm.  The boat will depart at 7pm - please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around. By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual".  It is intended for singles 21-45 only. This is not an ethnic specific event. 

• You must get your ticket in advance.  RSVPing without pre-payment will not get you into the event.  We're expecting a sell out.  Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

• # of RSVP’s reflect only a portion of those attending.  20+ groups are co-organizing & 300 members will be attending.  Prepay Only - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Sep-06-2015_at_0700PM
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.description:
Labor Day Weekend Singles Boat Party


Date: Sunday, Sept 6, 2015 at 7:00 PM - 11:00 PM


Location: The Cabana Yacht, at The New York Skyport Marina, at 2430 FDR Dr, New York, NY, 10010

Recommended Ages: Women 21 - 45, Men 23 - 45

Description: Join us aboard the 100-foot, two-level party yacht The Cabana, as we cruise around Manhattan, take a look at amazing views of the NYC skyline, statue of liberty, and more!


What to expect:


• Over 200 singles expected!


• DJ extraordinaire TRST will be spinnin' dance music of the past-present.


• We’ll have complimentary appetizers

• Fun ice breakers, prizes

• Two levels & two cash bars.

Status: Almost Sold Out


Cost: Only $30 with RSVP / $50 without RSVP if space is available.

Note, this is not an Asian-only event, but we have a large Asian  following so you can expect to see lots of Asian singles in attendance.

venue.address_1: 2430 FDR Dr, East Service Road (at E. 23rd St & FDR Dr - New York Skyport Marina)
venue.name: The Cabana Yacht

results.description:
Celebrate "No Work Monday" at our annual Labor Day 'Tip Off' Yacht Cruise!   

Mix, mingle, drink & dance the night away with 300 singles from multi-Meetup groups while enjoying a panoramic view of NYC skyline on a 100 foot long, 2-deck private yacht.

What's included:

• Light Appetizers

• DJ

• Ice-Breakers

• Cash bar

• Prizes

• 300 singles (20s, 30s, 40s)

*We already have 250+ members prepaid for this cruise and only 50 tickets left!  This will SELL OUT quickly so get your tickets today!

*$25 w/ discount code "5", price goes up to $50 as event gets closer. MUST PREPAY HERE (No tix sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Sep-06-2015_at_0700PM

• The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels. The main level is air-conditioned and enclosed and there is an outside deck on the second level. 

• Boarding starts at 6:45pm.  The boat will depart at 7pm - please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around. By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual".  It is intended for singles 21-45 only. This is not an ethnic specific event. 

• You must get your ticket in advance.  RSVPing without pre-payment will not get you into the event.  We're expecting a sell out.  Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

• # of RSVP’s reflect only a portion of those attending.  20+ groups are co-organizing & 300 members will be attending.  Prepay Only - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Sep-06-2015_at_0700PM

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around. By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual".  It is intended for singles 21-45 only. This is not an ethnic specific event. 

• You must get your ticket in advance.  RSVPing without pre-payment will not get you into the event.  We're expecting a sell out.  Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

• # of RSVP’s reflect only a portion of those attending.  20+ groups are co-organizing & 300 members will be attending.  Prepay Only - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Sep-06-2015_at_0700PM

Soup Kitchen

Father Daniel Berrigan, S.J. wrote: Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved person, the look on his face when the bread finally arrives. RSVP please, so we can provide a complete meal!

results.description:
Sunday Evening at Heights Meditation is a great way to either end your week or begin your week (or both!) with others similarly-minded, those seeking clarity of mind and open-heartedness in their everyday lives.

The Sunday evening meeting normally begins with some chant as a means to center the self and lighten up. We like to think of it as a kind of spiritual singalong, and who doesn't like a singalong? We use several easy-to-learn and different Sanskrit texts and leave it to members to choose a chant they'd like the group to use on a particular evening. If you have never chanted before, come along and try out this wonderful spiritual tool. It doesn't matter if it seems strange to you--the point is precisely to buck oneself out of a sense of 'ordinary' life--or if you think you are completely atonal. You will probably derive a lot of benefit from doing chant, and it can lastingly help you forward in life.

After the chanting ends, we immediately go into silent meditation for 20-25 minutes. Whereas chant tends to focus and energize the body and mind, silent meditation tends to quiet and calm the mind. It's a perfect counterpoint to the chanting.

As you can see, then, the Sunday evening meetings are a kind of dual spiritual exercise: of energizing and focusing the mind (chant) and then relaxing and calming it (meditation).

Come along to this or our other meetings if you feel you'd like to live a happier, calmer life and be able to live fearlessly through the cares and worries of modern life. If you can find a way to slow down and live more mindfully, you are well on the way to being an agent of joy and serenity in your own life and the lives of those living around you.
results.how_to_find_us: A or 1 Trains to 190th Street, south entrance to the church. Look for signs posted on the doors!

results.description:
***Pleas read entire description***
 This first NY Sound Alchemy Meet-Up will be a "one-off" meet-up at my home so as to gauge how to best coordinate the next meet-ups in public spaces.

This first one will be small, at my home, in my lovely mature back yard and will definitely be a warmer more intimate setting compared to what future NYSA meet-ups may be.

Sound Healing is effective because it influences our emotional bodies as well as our physical bodies. Different sound vibrations interact with our physical and energetic bodies in beneficial ways:

Activates Higher States of Consciousness
Unlocks Blocked Emotions
Relieves Anxiety and Stress
Induces Complete Relaxation
Promotes Deep Meditation
Heightens Clarity
Improves Ability to Concentrate
Relieves Insomnia
Decreases Depression
Normalizes Blood Pressure
Relieves Physical Pain
Release Emotional Trauma

Our 1st "sound-bath/sound-scape" will take place in my little slice of heaven in Little Neck, Queens. Location is 2 short blocks from Little Neck LIRR station. Ample street parking.
https://www.google.com/maps/place/Little+Neck/@40.77504,-73.74065,15z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x0:0x22d1062152138479

There will be a short intention setting, perhaps some stretching and or light asana before we set off on our sound odyssey.   

Traditional sage smudging, communal sacred alter for you to clear and charge your cherished items and/or accessories, & an activation of your 6 senses will take place. 

RSVP's are considered ONLY if they have a profile picture & answer the group question.

PLEASE ARRIVE BY 6:30 AS WE WILL BEGIN PROMPTLY AT 7PM. You should come in comfortable clothes or with enough time to change into them.  

Please bring: a great outlook, positive will, yoga mat &/or blanket, a refillable cup or mug.

Complimentary ClearlyFiltered water & organic cacao beans
 http://www.clearlyfiltered.com/

**Event is always FREE, yet, monetary blessings, exchanges and gifts are always well received, appreciated, and loved! 

***I will provide exact address 24 hrs before event to confirmed RSVP'd members. 

Meet-Up RSVP for this first meet-up is not complete until you are confirmed by host via email.

Thank you all very much, I look forward to meeting you all soon.
results.name: Let's meet for a 1 hour Sound-bath meditation and 1st official NYSA Meet&Greet.

results.description:
Amazing Crowd last sunday, were gonna do this again. We had a huge table and im happy everyone got to meet each other. Great comics as usual. I want to thank everyone who came out for this, it was our first time at Stand UP New York Pro Headliner show, What a great meetup I met some of the most fun and amazing people the comics was a full top Comedy Central line up too. Were going to do this again pretty much every sunday from now on, and looks like they fixed their credit card machine. This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up, as you know I dont charge for this meetup, so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

the lineup will be updated during the week so get your RSVPs in.
Nick Griffin, Gina Brillon, Sam morril, Greer Barnes, Greg Warren, Godfrey, Jon Laster, and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs.

Show starts at 8pm sharp so please be on time! We can also do 10pm so if you all would prefer that for the future let me know

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.
results.how_to_find_us: Next to the Chase Bank; next to the sound garden. One flight walk up to 2nd Floor. Parking on street or in parking lot behing the buiding. No meters on Sunday.

results.description:
Hello everyone,

Let's close out this beautiful Summer with Brasil Loves Cuba, a one-of-a-kind night of non-stop live authentic brazilian forró & son cubano performances.

We are happy to welcome the amazing Funky Guajiro aka Nu D'lux, masters of Son Cubano and Mr. Chino Pons as a very special guest singer. It will be the first time these two artists will be together on the same stage.

Davi Vieira (from the movie Rio) will be Zabumbeando and singing his unique blend of música nordestina. Joining Davi, we'll have special Forró performers straight from Brazil: Felipe Hostins, Srta V and Mr. Del Feliz. We are also proud to welcome local NYC artists Erika "do triângulo" Espinal and Nadine Coelho. These talented Forrozeiros will perform all of the Luiz Gonzaga style xotes, baiões and arrasta-pés you can think of.

The super friendly and very talented Marizete Sambazina presents her Gafieira Social Hangout class & performance right at the top of the evening.

DJ Agachadinho spins:

♫ Seu Jorge ♫ Trio Virgulino ♫ Pete Rodriguez ♫ Elza Soares ♫ Sonora Carruseles ♫ Gilberto Gil ♫ Kaoma ♫ Beth Carvalho ♫ Bomba Estereo ♫ Martinho Da Vila ♫ Hector Lavoe ♫
Many other surprises are in store this evening including a super special performance by Brazilian and Latin dance pro Cookie.


And you don’t want to miss the musical grand finale wrapping up this unforgettable Labor Day Weekend Celebration… ♫ Brasil ♥ Cuba ♫ New York City ♫
Sunday night Sep 6th - Labor Day eve
(right after Brazilian Day festival)

Appearances by:
♫ Funky Guajiro and Chino Pons
♫ Davi Vieira with Felipe Hostins + Erika Espinal + Srta V + Nadine Coelho + Maya solovey
♫ Forró Happy with Del Feliz
♫ DJ Agachadinho
♫ Marizete Sambazina’s Gafieira Social Hangout
♫ Balança Biscoito performance by Cookie
♫ More guest performers to be announced...

Where: Salon Millesime in The Carlton Hotel
Madison Avenue between 28th and 29th Streets
Flatiron District

Advance discounted tickets on sale now

$10 early bird very limited promo :: sold out
$15 Half Price Promo tkts :: available now

link: https://buy.flint.com/pYype358

$20 third tier tkts - soon
$25 fourth tier tkts
$30 fifth tier tkts (day of event if available)

Please note that his is our biggest event of the year. We have sold out annually since 2011. We highly recommend purchasing your tickets in advance as space is limited.

For groups, birthdays and table reservations please email us at [masked] - We have a few specials available.

See you all there for a fantastic night!

Thank you,
Sambazina
Forroteria

This evening is Competitive Play (Intermediate/Advance). Perfect for those who want to step-up their game. 

(Use your own judgement of skill level before signing up for Sunday) 


Having less experienced players in the more intense Sunday night setting is both unsafe and unfair to the other attendees. 

Players are expected to be able to handle free pass, pass accurately, and most important "BUMP SET SPIKE" with every effort not to just return the ball on the other side. Regular volleyball rules will be more closely enforced


Please RSVP only if you are 100% sure you can make it.  When you RSVP, you are holding a spot for a meetup that has high demand.  No refunds will be issued if you decide to cancel.  

If you must cancel, allow your spot to be given to someone on the wait list.


RULES:

-Carrying will be called

-Doubles will be called if too obvious

- NO REDOS on ANY ceiling obstacles

-No top Net touches (Bottom Net is okay)

-No going under the net on the opposite side of the court. (Safety)

Davi Vieira (from the movie Rio) will be Zabumbeando and singing his unique blend of música nordestina. Joining Davi, we'll have special Forró performers straight from Brazil: Felipe Hostins, Srta V and Mr. Del Feliz. We are also proud to welcome local NYC artists Erika "do triângulo" Espinal and Nadine Coelho. These talented Forrozeiros will perform all of the Luiz Gonzaga style xotes, baiões and arrasta-pés you can think of.

The super friendly and very talented Marizete Sambazina presents her Gafieira Social Hangout class & performance right at the top of the evening.

DJ Agachadinho spins:

♫ Seu Jorge ♫ Trio Virgulino ♫ Pete Rodriguez ♫ Elza Soares ♫ Sonora Carruseles ♫ Gilberto Gil ♫ Kaoma ♫ Beth Carvalho ♫ Bomba Estereo ♫ Martinho Da Vila ♫ Hector Lavoe ♫
Many other surprises are in store this evening including a super special performance by Brazilian and Latin dance pro Cookie.


And you don’t want to miss the musical grand finale wrapping up this unforgettable Labor Day Weekend Celebration… ♫ Brasil ♥ Cuba ♫ New York City ♫
Sunday night Sep 6th - Labor Day eve
(right after Brazilian Day festival)

Appearances by:
♫ Funky Guajiro and Chino Pons
♫ Davi Vieira with Felipe Hostins + Erika Espinal + Srta V + Nadine Coelho + Maya solovey
♫ Forró Happy with Del Feliz
♫ DJ Agachadinho
♫ Marizete Sambazina’s Gafieira Social Hangout
♫ Balança Biscoito performance by Cookie
♫ More guest performers to be announced...

Where: Salon Millesime in The Carlton Hotel
Madison Avenue between 28th and 29th Streets
Flatiron District

See you all there for a fantastic night!

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after ,,,, not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

+++

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. Don't be late , we start on time : )

results.description:
This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Spice.

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

results.description:
Host:   Mike Clancy  [masked]

Meet at the main parking lot adjacent to the Bear Mtn. Inn.  It's normally $8 to park but we may be entering before the attendant starts. 

We will be ascending the Major Welch Trail and then relax at the Perkins Memorial Tower to take in the views.  We'll then descend on the AT.  People who have done the Breakneck Bypass Loop will find the ascent on Major Welch to be comparatively strenuous, but the descent on the AT to be much more pleasant.

Distance: about 4 miles

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: 2+ hours

Map:  http://www.visitbearmountain.com/files/603/BearMountainTrailMap.pdf

This hike offers  outstanding views up and down the Hudson River and the Bear Mountain Bridge.

*** possible parking fee *** It would be $8 if there's still an attendant at that hour, but that's doubtful

Please don't be late - we start on time.  We will meet in the main lot close to the Bear Mountain Inn.

+


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

results.description:
Time for another Palisades trail run! This run will start at the bus station, go over the bridge, up the Palisades Long Path and back.

I’ll be running at a 10 minute/mile pace and turning around at the Park Headquarters (19 miles round-trip from the bus station). Every pace and distance is welcome, but be prepared to run on your own if you can't find someone who matches yours. Other notable turn-around points include the State Line Cafe (25 miles round-trip), Alpine Lookout (16 miles round-trip), and the Greenbrook Sanctuary (13 miles round-trip). 

Note that if you turn around before the Park Headquarters, you might be looking at up to 13 miles between water sources. Please make sure you plan your hydration accordingly!


If you would like to meet up with us on the New Jersey side, find us at the trail start just over the pedestrian bridge at 9:00am. Please indicate this in your RSVP.


Here’s a map of the trail. The Long Path is marked “A” on the map and is marked with aqua blazes. Please familiarize yourself with the trail map before coming to the run.

Here's a list of landmarks along with their distance from the start on the NJ side.


I’ve also made a Google Map that shows the trail along with several points of interest, including restrooms and places to get water. This map is approximate - do not rely on it for navigation!

As always, please view the group's About page and make sure you understand your responsibilities as an event participant.

results.description:
16 miles on trail in New Rochelle. This a "dry run" or preview of the Paine to Pain trail half marathon. This a great race, we encourage everyone to register for the actual race, which takes place Oct, 4th. If you do, please list Brooklyn Trail Runners as your team.

Trail Details: The trail head is approximately 1.5 miles from the station. So, a half marathon on trail and 3 miles back and forth to the station. There is a water stop and bathroom at mile 7. This a mild trail run.


Where: Meet at the New Rochelle Metro North Train Station.

When:  9:11 am.

Via public transit: Take the 8:36 am Metro North (New Haven Line) train from Grand Central to New Rochelle. Travel time 35 minutes.

If you are driving: Put 24 Station Plaza North, New Rochelle, NY 10801 in your GPS.

As always, we encourage all speeds to join, no matter how fast or slow. This is about running trails and having fun! If you can’t run 16 miles and can only run 9, no worries!

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No Permit but field is usually available for us at this time.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Francisco)

(Co-Leader- Ray Ray)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Section 2: For New Members and First Timers of Exploring NYC History and Neighorhoods.  Note if you have been on prior tours with this group please RSVP for the other concurrent tour!  Thanks!

My annual Labor Day-themed guided walk and tour will honor the hard working women and men who worked (and still work) in the garment trades in New York City.  For nearly a century, New York City was the clothing-making capital of the world!  NY is still a design capital and some clothing is still made here.  Starting in the Lower East Side of Manhattan we'll honor the early days of the garment workers who worked in small sweatshops along with the immigrants who sold clothing and other items in the streets from pushcarts, like my grandfather and great-grandfather.  


We'll trace the history of industry in New York City with a focus on the garment industry and how it moved to midtown and how New York changed from a manufacturing center to a design and marketing capital. After a stop at the building that was the site of the immensely tragic Triangle Shirtwaist Factory Fire in 1911, we'll head up to the midtown Fashion District which has an extraordinary history on its own - past, present and future! 

Along the route we'll traverse the neighborhoods of the Lower East Side, SOHO, NOHO, a bit of Greenwich Village and Union Square. While in the Lower East Side we can make a stop at Russ and Daughters (since 1914) for those who wish to nosh on the way.

At the end of our walk we'll have an option picnic lunch in Bryant Park at 42nd Street & 6th Avenue - bring your own or $ to purchase at one of the local sandwich/salad shops - including 'wichcraft inside the park. 

Note - this is a long walk of at least 4 miles so please bring snacks and water. Optional picnic lunch afterwards when we end by Bryant Park.  We will take the subway at one point so please have a usable metrocard. Please note that we will not be visiting the Tenement Museum which would be a whole separate experience. The visitor center and museum store should be open. We will congregate outside.  Note that subways will be on a Sunday/holiday schedule so please allow sufficient time to travel.


Restrooms in the Visitor Center and one block away is Irving Farm at 88 Orchard St. (tea, coffee, sandwiches, pastries); and the Roasting Plant at 81 Orchard.

Cheers!

Hank

[masked]

[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: F to Delancey Street, D train to Grand or the J/Z to Essex Street.  The Museum Store is at teh corner of Orchard and Delancey Streets.
results.name: For Newbies! Celebrate Labor Day with a History of the Garment/Fashion Industry!

venue.name: Green Space East of the Picnic House

results.description:
If you are around this MONDAY of Labor Day weekend, come take a 45 minute breather in Prospect Park.   

The first 10 minutes will be a little about meditation/getting comfortable, then 25-30 minutes of guided meditation using the breath, sound and mantra meditation and voila, the remainder for comments, questions and community.


We'll be at the green space east of the picnic house-- on the long meadow! https://www.prospectpark.org/visit-the-park/park-map/.  With your back to the picnic house, walk down the path towards the sun. Then LOOK FOR THE FADED RED BLANKET. 

Remember to wear something comfortable and bring a chair, cushion and/or mat to sit on... bring anything really that will allow you to sit ease-fully for 45 minutes. $5 suggested donation. 

Jess

results.description:
We'll meet at the "BBQ" entrance of Morningside Park, where an info table will be set up—including Bernie's voice at the table courtesy of a little iPad a/v rig—ever see someone's face the first time they hear Bernie giving hell? A joy to behold!

We can also walk through beautiful Morningside Park passing out leaflets and registering voters. It would be great to have a LOT of volunteers in Bernie shirts for this event, to make for a really visible presence on the busiest day of the year at this location.

If you can print some flyers to bring along, it would be a great help! Download pamphlets or flyers at www.nyc4bernie.com. Banners, buttons—bring any kind of swag you have on hand.

This is going to be a FUN day!
results.name: Morningside Park Labor Day BBQ BernieWalk!

venue.address_1: Long Beach Blvd and Shore Rd,
venue.name: Skudin Surf School at Long Beach

results.description:
Before summer ends, let's go to Skudin Surfing School at Long Beach one more time to learn surfing. This will be the LAST surfing lesson trip of this season.

For the longest time you've been promising yourself, "This is the year I'm going to learn how to surf!" Well here you are about to make that dream come true! Our Long Beach Surf School is located between Long Beach Blvd and Riverside Blvd in Long Beach, NY.  Our family has been teaching surfing in Long Beach since the 70′s with its perfect sand bars and conditions it’s our premier spot.  Long Beach, NY has one of the most beautiful beaches in the country with its brand new 2.5 mile boardwalk its a great trip to take and enjoy all that this community has to offer.  Only a 50 minute LIRR train ride from Penn Station and easy drive from New York City.  With its own parking lot its an easy walk to the beach and is perfect for bringing the family or coming solo to learn how to surf.

Date: September 7th Monday (Labor Day holiday) departs at 11:00 AM in midtown west Manhattan, and 11:45 AM in Flushing; Please arrive 15 minutes earlier than departing time. We will depart sharp on time. (Event Time: 1:30 PM- 3:00 PM)

Depart 11:00 AM: (Garden City Deli) Corner of 43rd St and 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Depart 11:45 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel) [masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map).

Return: Depart from Long Beach  at 5:00 PM after a quick bite, and get back to Flushing at around 6:00 PM & Manhattan 7:00 PM.

Cost: Early Birds $79 (Save $21 off Retail Value $100 including transport) for first 8 spots or RSVPed 10 days in advance; Regular $89 afterward. Tickets without transport will be added later ($10 less than those with transport).

Additional Cost: Beach Pass $8; bring $8 cash & ask for Skudin School for the special price (Regular $12)

Purchase Ticket Here: http://sep2015surfinglb.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) YOUR SPOT IS NOT CONFIRMED UNTIL YOUR PAYMENT IS RECEIVED.

Includes: 1.5 hours lesson, boards & wet suits (if necessary); fresh shower available. Luxury van transport from midtown Manhattan & Flushing.

What to bring: Bottle of water, sunblock, swim wear, towel, sandals, clothes to change, and attitude to learn.

Maximum: 15 (All 15 surf boards reserved for our group)

Additional Info: 3 to 1 student to instructor ratio (5 instructors)

Refund Policy:
* $10 processing fee if cancelled on or before 2 weeks prior to the event date;
* 50% refund if cancelled on or before 1 week prior to the event date;
* No refund for cancellation or no show afterward; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $10 processing fee.


After lesson, we can have late lunch or drinks together.

DIRECTIONS

LIRR Long Beach Branch
Arrive at Long Beach Station, walk south toward the beach, turn right and walk 3 blocks to Long Beach Blvd Beach

GPS
Long Beach Blvd and Shore Rd, Long Beach, NY 11561 (Map)

Click the link to Skudin Surf School

High Yelp Rating Yelp Rating

By RSVP'ing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms to the Waiver & Release of Liability set forth by NYC Active Young Singles.

Purchase Ticket Here: http://sep2015surfinglb.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) YOUR SPOT IS NOT CONFIRMED UNTIL YOUR PAYMENT IS RECEIVED.

Includes: 1.5 hours lesson, boards & wet suits (if necessary); fresh shower available. Luxury van transport from midtown Manhattan & Flushing.

What to bring: Bottle of water, sunblock, swim wear, towel, sandals, clothes to change, and attitude to learn.

Maximum: 15 (All 15 surf boards reserved for our group)

Additional Info: 3 to 1 student to instructor ratio (5 instructors)

Refund Policy:
* $10 processing fee if cancelled on or before 2 weeks prior to the event date;
* 50% refund if cancelled on or before 1 week prior to the event date;
* No refund for cancellation or no show afterward; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $10 processing fee.

After lesson, we can have late lunch or drinks together.

results.description:
AND NOW FOR SOMETHING COMPLETELY DIFFERENT

Labor Day is the unofficial end of the summer and a big day to continue the grilling season, so let's have a barbecue to celebrate both! And since this is a tennis group, and since the only way yet discovered by humankind to improve a barbecue is to mix it with tennis, let's play tennis too!

Cooking, eating, drinking, hanging out, making empty boasts, and fighting duels to the death over the proper use and application of ketchup — not to mention forming hundreds or even thousands of excellent new friendships — generally commence around noon or so and continue indefinitely, with tennis and everything else woven in (and out) as everyone pleases.

The rules are simple for this Free event

RSVP

Bring as many guests as you'd like (if you friends don't play tennis, they can still enjoy a good day at the park with the grill)

Also bring some kind of food, drink or picnic supplies.

Tell us what you're bringing in your comment field so we can all coordinate.

Join us in the shade on the field directly north of the tennis courts (as in right next to them) and have fun!!!

Needless to say, we'll also have the usual full day of tennis, so if you want to play (and burn off all that food and drink we'll all be scarfing down!) just sign up for those sessions as usual once they're posted and announced.

So what are you waiting for? RSVP already before it's too late and you spend the rest of your life wondering why on earth you did something totally lame on Labor Day instead of playing tennis, hanging out with friends, and eating way too much awesome food and drinking way too much awesome drink!

Of course, it would be slightly inconvenient if we wound up with twenty tanker trucks full of turkey burgers and no buns to put them on, so please do remember to use the comment field either when you RSVP or at any time down the line to let everyone know what you'll be bringing — that way we can all coordinate.

And again, please remember to sign up for whichever of the day's tennis sessions you'd like to play in once they're posted as well as for the cookout — hitting and playing will probably be a little more fluid than usual, but people who have signed up will of course get precedence when it comes to court time.

We look forward to seeing you all on the courts — and at the grill!

UPCOMING MEETUPS

And in the mean time, sign up for the 8am, 10am, 12 noon, 2pm or 4pm Social Tennis Meetups, which we'll update always be updating.

SOCIAL TENNIS MEETUPS

These meetups are for people who have at least some experience playing tennis and can sustain rallies for at least a few balls.

If you've never played tennis before, though, or if you need a little more work before you can reach that minimum level, don't despair, just check out our excellent and extremely affordable group tennis lessons. Tennis is a fantastic sport that can last a lifetime, so it's worth learning how to play it right so you can get the most out of your court time and minimize your risk of injuries.

So come join us on the courts!

GROUP TENNIS LESSONS — AT FORT WASHINGTON PARK


In addition to our regular social sessions meant for hitting and playing, we're extremely pleased to offer group lesson meetups with our friend Robert Fernandez Bucheli a USPTA-certified tennis pro licensed by the New York City Parks and Recreation Department.

These lessons are a fantastic opportunities to improve your game and get even more out of your time on the courts in the future.  Classes for beginners are at 11 am and 12 noon.  Classes for intermediates is at 1 pm.  Private sessions are available and also limited, sign up quickly.  Visit the website directly to view more.  You can create a Free account and enroll directly at TennisWorldNYC.com


Sign up for group lessons or the tennis socials, either way you win!

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Prebyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge (stay to the right at the fork) which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

WEATHER AND POSTPONEMENTS OR CANCELLATIONS

Here's the National Weather Service's   Detailed 7-Day Forecast.

If bad weather forces us to postpone cancel the BBQ, we'll let you know by email as early as possible, but if we all get together and just sacrifice enough goats, that surely that won't happen.

FINALLY…

If you have any questions about the group or the BBQ, whether you're new or you've been a member for years, please don't hesitate to drop us a line!

Best regards,

Terry
Organizer, NYC Tennis

venue.address_1: Corner of Dyckman St. and Payson Ave
venue.name: Inwood Park

results.description:
A short (two and a half hours +/-) nature hike through Manhattan's last, and only second growth forest (some trees over 3 feet wide!) Learn about the ecology and geology of the area and what birds and mammals are in the park. Hear stories of mastodons, native Americans and George Washington!

(When I last scheduled this in August I was delayed soooo long on the N train due to an ill passenger I was so late and had to cancel :( I hope for no problems this time!!!)


It's a fairly short walk, two miles up and down hills on old paved trails. Dress appropriately for the weather and bring a bottle of water if you like. I'd suggest bringing bug spray if you have. It will be sunny and hot on Labor Day (high -80s) a hat is always good :)


Running shoes or light hiking boots are fine.

Meet at the corner of Dyckman St. and Payson Ave - right by the playground(we'll enter the park on Payson Ave.). Payson Ave is a few blocks west of Broadway.

A train to Dyckman St. stop.

We will begin at 11:30am

*The walk ends at the north end of the park - you can walk east on 218th St. to catch a bus on Broadway or the 1 at 215th St., or pass by the ballfields and head east on Isham to catch the A at 207th.*

$3 fee to cover meetup costs.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

results.description:
Between the World and Me by Ta-Nehisi Coates: it’s the #1 New York Times Bestseller that everyone’s talking about. Here is your chance to get in on the discussion!

Written in the form of a letter to his 14-year-old son, Coates’s individual life story becomes a way to comprehend the broader magnitude of racism and the events in the news, much in the same way as he reminds his son, "Slavery is not an indefinable mass of flesh. It is a particular, specific enslaved woman, whose mind is active as your own; whose range of feeling is as vast as your own; who prefers the way the light falls in one particular spot in the woods. . . . "

There’s plenty of time to read this slim volume before Labor Day. But plan on purchasing it—there are 486 holds on the NY Public Library’s 347 copies! Consider also the compelling audiobook version, read by the author. (It’s 3.5 hours long.)

What to bring:


• Your copy of the book (if you have one).

• Any questions or points of discussion you would like to raise.

• A vegan dish to share (with serving utensil!)—no meat, poultry, fish, eggs, dairy or honey.

Our plan: 

We'll assemble between 1:00-1:30pm. We’ll eat at 1:30pm. Plates, cups and utensils will be provided. We'll provide sheets to sit on and there are bathrooms nearby. Around 2:00pm, we’ll have some facilitated discussions of the book, breaking into smaller groups as needed.

Getting there: 

We’ll be gathering on the lawn under the trees of breezy Pier 64 near W 24th Street in Chelsea.

https://www.google.com/maps/place/Pier+64/@40.7509063,-74.0099472,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x89c259c8fa77411b:0xb4c90a83d08bce16

We’ll be under the pin on the map linked above. Pier 64 is marked as such, but it’s not obvious. If you’re not surrounded by water on both sides, you haven’t gone out far enough. It’s the pier just south of The Frying Pan, a red boat-turned-restaurant.


You can take the C/E/1/F trains to 23rd St. From there you can walk or catch the M23 bus. In addition to trains running on a Sunday schedule, there will be heavy construction on many lines, so check http://www.mta.info.


Allow plenty of extra time!

Accessibility: 

The closest bus is the M23. The M12 and M14D are also options. Closest accessible subway stations are the A/C/E at 14th St. and 34th St. (You can use the address W 24th St & 12th Ave, New York, NY 10011 for trip planning.) There is a low curb surrounding the lawn.

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

results.description:
Join us for a special networking Meet Up at Adorama featuring presentations by NYC-based photojournalists Craig Ruttle and Chad Rachman! There will be Adorama and AdoramaPix gift cards being raffled off and all those attending our event will get a 10% discount on a variety of items throughout the store. (Certain restrictions apply.) 

Watch it live online ➟ PhotoBrigade.com/LIVE! 

Craig Ruttle has been working as a staff and freelance photojournalist for over three decades, covering local, national and international events and stories. Currently based in New York, he focuses on issues reporting and political news, also traveling throughout the United States and beyond to reflect on the events that shape our lives. Working not only as a photographer, but as a photo editor and Assistant Director of Photographer at the Cincinnati Enquirer, and as freelance photo editor at Newsweek, Mr. Ruttle has a broad understanding of the needs of today's photojournalist as well as the editors he works with. Starting a career at a time when the working medium was mostly black and white film, he embraced digital technologies in the late 1990's and guided other staff photographers (while staying in contact with camera providers and manufacturers) as the transition from film to digital imaging took place. Assignments have taken him from the small towns of New York State and the Midwest, to coverage of a shattering earthquake in Haiti, a tsunami in South Asia and a still evolving refugee migration along the Syrian border in Turkey. Craig currently works with The Associated Press, Newsday, various other newspapers, magazines, and websites, along with an affiliation as a stock contributor to Redux Pictures, working to create self-assigned, expanded stories that transcend daily news coverage. ➟ CraigRuttle.com

Chad Rachman is a staff photographer for the New York Post and for Getty Images. His work in photojournalism has covered groups such as U2, the US Women’s Soccer eeam, and the US Coast Guard as well as major cultural events like New York Comic Con. Keep up with his latest work at www.chadrachman.com

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography: The Photo Brigade is an amazing blog and resource for freelance photographers that showcase the amazing work of their talented network of photographers through features, guest posts, gear reviews, and podcasts, on the business of photography.

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/PhotoBrigade_HEAD%5B1%5D.jpg?itok=bKADUApv
results.name: SEMINAR: Photo Brigade Meet Up

results.description:
Free. Manhattan. Monday, September 7th @ 2:30PM

Gotham Yacht Club is looking for fun sailors and non-sailors to join us this weekend for what perhaps may be the last trip of the season!

We take trips around the Manhattan area in a 50-foot Beneteau. We usually sail the Hudson--the Statue of Liberty to the George Washington Bridge--but also go to Martha's Vineyard, the Hamptons and the Jersey Shore.

We like to fill the boat up with about 20-30 people. No sailing experience is required, but preference is given to experienced sailors since the trips can’t happen without them.  As space is limited on the boat, simply RSVP’ing “Yes” to an event does not guarantee a spot on the boat.  If a spot is available, you will be contacted directly with event details.

Sailors can take their first trip to get acquainted and enjoy the party.  From then on, sailors can choose to (1) work the morning shift and help out with the launch or (2) work the evening shift and help out with the return.  Generally, sailors spend less than a third of the trip working and can take the rest of the time to relax and socialize.

The current crew is made up of young, educated Manhattan professionals. We are looking to meet new people who will enjoy the atmosphere and company of everyone on the boat. 

If you and/or your friends are interested, please copy, paste, and fill out the questionnaire below in an email and send to [masked]. Please include your current email address so that we can contact you directly.  Since boat trips fill up in advance and we receive many applicants, we may not get back to you immediately.  

We look forward to seeing you on the water!

EVERY APPLICANT (REVELERS, SUNBATHERS, ETC.)

Q) Please provide a link to your page on Facebook or other social networking site. Please attach a picture if you don’t have a page on a social networking site.

Q) How old are you?

Q) Where did you attend school?

Q) Will you please tell us a little bit about yourself?

FOR SAILOR APPLICANTS

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on, but not captained, a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on but not captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) Will you tell us a little bit about your sailing experience?


Please copy and paste all questions and answers and send in an email to [masked].

Thank you!


FAQ


Q: Do you have to pay to attend a boat party?


A: No, all boat parties are absolutely free.  You may want to bring food and drinks, which are on a potluck basis.


Q: The specific location is not listed.  Where do we meet for the boat party?


A: Unfortunately, we cannot fit everyone who RSVPs to a MeetUp event onto the boat.  There are some crew members and attendees who are not part of the MeetUp group, so there may be less space than it appears.  In order to avoid miscommunication and needing to leave people on the dock, specific details (including meeting location) are sent to members individually.  If you do not receive an invitation via email, you will not be able to attend that week’s boat party.


Q: How often are the boat parties?


A: Boat parties are generally every weekend, either on a Saturday or Sunday. They generally last all afternoon into the early evening. 


Q: Do I have to fill out the questionnaire?


A: Yes! Please fill out the questionnaire as thoroughly as possible.  If you are uncomfortable posting any of the information on your profile, please email your responses to [masked].  Without a complete application, you will not be considered to receive an invitation.  The trips last several hours, so we will have 20-30 people in a confined space for an extended period of time. Therefore, we need to have an idea of who we are inviting on the boat and ensure that we have a proper crew.  Please fill out the questionnaire if you are interested in sailing with Gotham Yacht Club.

results.description:
Three distinct neighborhoods in Manhattan with unique beats yet connected in proximity and creativity. Come explore SoHo’s architectural treasures and learn of its art, shopping, culture and more. We will also experience how Italians have shaped  the most iconic Italian enclave in the U.S. We then later finish exploring sections on the largest Chinatown in North America.

Itinerary: 
• SoHo’s Cast-Iron District 
• Richard Haas Mural on Spring St. 
• Haughwout Building 
• The Italian American Museum 
• Church of the Most Precious Blood 
• Mahayana Buddhist Temple 
• Columbus Park 
• And More

Experience a cultural patrimony that will connect you to sections of New York and also the world.


Reservations: 
Required. You must RSVP. Please, if you RSVP and later realize you will not be able to attend change your reservation ASAP.


Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins in front of the Apple Store in SoHo on 103 Prince St. map here (Prince St. side). Tour concludes at Columbus Park map here.


Cost: 
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You are not charged. At the end of the tour you can put a value to the information presented in the form of a gratuity.


Some of the Sights we will experience:

I look forward to meeting you and showing you a great time in a great section of New York!

results.description:
Spend your Labor Day in the one-time neighborhood of the very rich!

“The Gilded Age”: Mark Twain coined the term for the era of newly minted millionaires created by the Civil War. Join us on our hunt for the last vestiges of this age of railroad  tycoons, costume balls, and conspicuous  consumption during the years[masked], when huge fortunes were spent lavishly on the Queen of Avenues.  More than most of our tours, this one focuses on memorable women: notorious Madame Restell;  society suffragist  Alva Belmont; “Dollar Princess” Consuelo Vanderbilt, mistress-turned-art-collector Arabella Huntington,  and shrewd Mary Mason Jones, the pioneering builder that anticipated the amazing growth of Fifth Avenue with only“Dagger John” Hughes preceding her, in his vision of a brand-new Gothic cathedral to give all the wealthy Protestant churches in New York a run for their money. Learn how Roosevelts and Rockefellers, orphans and art smugglers all made their mark in this most envied location of a gilded and gossip-laden bygone era.

Where to meet: in the courtyard of the New York Palace Hotel, at 455 Madison Avenue, between 50 and 51 streets, directly in back of St. Patrick's Cathedral. Take the 6 train to "51 Street" or E to "5 Avenue/53 Street".

When to meet: 4:45pm for a 5pm start. I will be holding a sign that says "Gilded Fifth Avenue".

Fee: $20 cash, $15 for seniors 65 + with proof of age; exact change appreciated! Please bring bills, not coins.  Sorry, please do not bring dogs or minor children age 17 or below on the tours.  No audio taping or video taping allowed. 

The tour will be approximately 2.5 hours long. For sunny days, be sure to bring a hat and a bottle of water. Check the weather reports on the day of the tour; if there is a chance of rain, please bring your own umbrella.  While Friendly Native tours usually do take place on the date and at the time they are scheduled, on occasion they will be postponed in cases of high temperatures or high probability of rain,  and an email sent out to that effect to all who have registered for the event. 

The nearest restrooms to this location are inside the New York Palace Hotel. Enter from Madison Avenue, and take the staircase on the left. Please be sure to "take care of things" before the start of the tour!

results.description: Meet up for Drop in Soccer at Meisel Park in Springfield 278 Meisel Avenue - Springfield, NJ 07081. We usually play in the back field (you have to go over a bridge to find the field) unless there's a kids game in process, if that happens, we will play in another field. Warm ups start after 5:30 pm and the game starts around 6:00pm.  Weather permitting!

results.description:
We're hosting a big labor day event for those who don't have any plans for this monday and just want to enjoy a great time with friends and play all the latest fighting games to date.

we are willing to host a large tournament for your favorite fighting game for which we have plenty of time to host considering were starting at 2pm. PLEASE KEEP IN MIND THAT THE TIME MIGHT CHANGE LATER ON FOR THAT DAY. WE WILL KEEP YOU POSTED.

SMASH 4 (WII-U)

ULTRA SF IV (XBOX360)

ULTIMATE MARVEL VS CAPCOM 3 (XBOX360)

MORTAL KOMBAT X (PS4)

BLAZBLUE CP-EX (PS3)

GG X'RD (PS3)

Please be advised that this is a B.Y.O.C event, we do not have supplies to lend out.

Venue Fee:

18-20 - $10 (WIth 1 Free Soda)

21+ - $5

Tournament Fee: $5 For all games Double Elimination Tourney Starts when enough people sign up.

(please keep in mind if its not that many people who show up it will be round robin style) Tourneys start on time because we must leave no later then 11:30pm.

Also if you wanna check out featured trading card games at our events, PAG members will be available to teach and play the following games

Vs. System 2 PCG

UFS: The Universal Fighting System

results.description: Do you have a special musical talent that you want to show the world? Do you have an instrument sitting in your basement that you've been wanting to dust off and jam with others? Or even if you don't and just want to come and listen to some talented musicians jam it out with our own Rock n Joe rockers, come and join us every Monday night!
results.name: Jam out with local Rockers!

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once (without participating) for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

  Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

   People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great coffee and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

   I've been asked to post this:

Dear Members:  This is the first you have heard from me. I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey
results.how_to_find_us: The electronic billboard at the studio will show the up-to-date room.

results.description: Monday cancelled. Tomorrow's meeting is OK. I always learn something new at the group, like an advanced feature, or a glitch/bug to beware of. The Microsoft Conference Center, is free of charge, at 41st Street and 8th Avenue, (NorthEast corner... i.e. not in Port Authority). To RSVP, please send an email to: LindaEwen at nyc dot rr dot com, with your first and last name. We plan on meeting on the 1st Monday of every month, but occasionally there are changes. You should receive an email, if there's a change. I suggest you print out any email response you receive, even though it's not required. The Conference Center's security department, requires your first and last name, so please include your full name, within the body of your email. A photo ID is mandatory. Sometimes, the map on this meetup link above, is incorrect, so please write down the address. If you don't get an email back from anyone, within a day or two, please send a 2nd request.It's OK, to be half an hour early and use the free coffee machine. Try to go early, if it's your first time, in case you are not registered properly. If you arrive, and the the security personnel informs you of a registration problem, don't be alarmed, they will assist you. Please be patient, (no seating limitation). For those who sent their first email request, on the day of the event, this process may take half an hour, and the cut off time for confirmation is 7:00 PM. If you would like to use meetup to remind yourself, find the duplicate listing of this event at http://www.meetup.com/Spreadsheets/events/calendar/
results.name: Monday cancelled. Tuesday meeting is OK!

results.description:
Every Labor Day we host one of our biggest and best-attended events of the year, our Annual BBQ Social.  

We take over the Terrace and the Terrace Room and enjoy an ab-fab spread of cookout favorites and new treats.  We provide the basics, such as the hot dogs, burgers, Veggie burgers, tableware, paper products, and your basic beverages.

YOU provide the side dishes and desserts.  Each person is asked to bring 6-8 servings of a backyard-worthy picnic foods, like potato salad, macaroni salad, tossed salad, fresh fruit, brownies, doughnuts, etc.  

NOTE:  The Fellowship is planning a massive remodel project, and therefore we do not have access to a working stove or oven.  That means if you are planning to bring something that needs to be heated we MUST HAVE advance notice so we can have steam trays ready.  

If you send us a message when you RSVP and let us know what you're bringing, we can post it here so that others know what to expect, and so that we can add "diversity" to the menu.  

Menu (will continue to grow as RSVP's come in):

• Hamburgers/Cheeseburgers

• Hot Dogs

• Veggie Burgers

• Homemade Mango Iced Tea

We could also use some help with setting up tables and chairs, and to help with clean up.  It isn't difficult, but goes MUCH faster with more hands on hand.  

Open Talk will take place from 7:00 until 8:00 PM.  We will time the barbie to serve the first guests at 8:00 PM.  If you have any questions, or if you can volunteer, please contact John, Mickey, Sherri or Andy.
results.name: Annual Labor Day BBQ Social

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book Master of the Rose Cross: a Collection of Essays By and About Harvey Spencer Lewis

The topic for this week's discussion is Aum, Om, Amen.

You can download the chapter free here!

About the Book

Harvey Spencer Lewis was born in New Jersey on November 25, 1883, of Welsh heritage and Methodist parents. He received an excellent education and a fine upbringing. From a very early age, he underwent mystical experiences which already indicated his exceptional destiny. For several years, he was the president of the New York Institute for Psychical Research, and was considered an authority in this field. In 1909, he made contact with the European leaders of the Rosicrucian Order. Having given proof of his integrity and of his knowledge in philosophical and esoteric matters, he was initiated in Toulouse, where he officially received the mission of reactivating the Order in America. Despite encountering numerous obstacles and difficulties, he carried out his mission well, and in conformity with the instructions that were given him by the Rosicrucians of France, he began to put into writing the Rosicrucian teachings. In order to demonstrate the traditional and authentic foundations of the Order, he made it known under the name, "The Ancient and Mystical Order of the Rose Cross." In 1915 he was named Imperator, that is, the international leader. After having dedicated his entire life to the service of the Order, Harvey Spencer Lewis passed through transition on August 2, 1939.

This work, which is dedicated to him, is presented so that you can discover his thoughts through his essays. Though written in the past century, their message is always fresh. They demonstrate the modern spirit and avant-garde nature of this great philosopher and humanist.

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Master of the Rose Cross: Aum, Om, and Amen

Please bring an open Spirit, curiosity, enthusiasm and a belief in the possibility of many Univeses, star systems and Spirit beings and ancestors..

Developing your Intuition accelerates your success  in all areas of your life. Some people may choose to become professional Psychics and Mediums. Others will use their gifts to enhance business, career,relationships and learning about their life path and the universe we all live in

This is created for your development and for people share a passion for this work. Psychic and Mediumship Circles are most dynamic and powerful when people come on a continuous basis. 5 sequential weeks are a required starting point to see your development take off!!!!
