results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

Add some variety to your running -- do some speed work on the track! Think you're slow? This is the best way to get faster. Nobody is too slow to try a track workout. This is how you will improve.

We encourage runners of all ability levels to join. You are not too slow! If you are a even a little bit intimidated by the thought of running laps at the track we want to challenge you to come join us and find out just how awesome it actually is. You will feel great (and exhausted) at the end of the workout. Guaranteed!


The East River Park Track is just across the FDR highway at the end of 6th street. Just walk across the pedestrian overpass and the track will be right there.


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. We pile all our stuff together and are (relatively) nearby for the duration of the workout. We have never had a problem with theft, but that doesn't mean it won't happen.


After the workout join us for beer at ABC Beer Co. at Ave C between 6th and 7th.

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 10 pgs (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation


3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work


- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified


(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there,

Dan

347 - 743 - 1854
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
A LINE WILL FORM BEFORE THE EVENT; PLEASE ARRIVE AT 7:00PM TO SOCIALIZE IN LINE BEFORE DOORS OPEN. Seats go quickly (leaving standing room only!) and if you are late, it will be difficult for us to save you a seat. 

BETRAYAL: Competitors prepare a five minute story about violations of trust. Blurted secrets, cheated lovers and broken promises. Knowing when to snitch and knowing where to hide when the truth comes out. True friends stab you in the front...

(see below for important ticket info)


WHAT IS THE MOTH?

“It is brilliant and quietly addictive” – The London Guardian

“New York’s hottest and hippest literary ticket” – The Wall Street Journal

The Moth is an acclaimed not-for-profit organization dedicated to the art and craft of storytelling. It is a celebration of both the raconteur, who breathes fire into true tales of ordinary life, and the storytelling novice, who has lived through something extraordinary and yearns to share it. At the center of each performance is, of course, the story – and The Moth’s directors work with each storyteller to find, shape and present it.

Since its launch in 1997, The Moth has presented thousands of stories, told live and without notes, to standing-room-only crowds worldwide.

Moth shows are renowned for the great range of human experience they showcase. Each show starts with a theme, and the storytellers explore it, often in unexpected ways. Since each story is true and every voice authentic, the shows dance between documentary and theater, creating a unique, intimate, and often enlightening experience for the audience.

Moth stories dissolve socio-economic barriers, expose vulnerabilities, and quietly suggest ways to overcome challenges and see with new eyes.

A LINE WILL FORM BEFORE THE EVENT; PLEASE ARRIVE AT 7:00PM TO SOCIALIZE IN LINE BEFORE DOORS OPEN. Seats go quickly (leaving standing room only!) and if you are late, it will be difficult for us to save you a seat.
results.name: The Moth StorySLAM: Betrayal (SOLD OUT!)

• Description :Let's meet and have a great time dancing in One of NYC's Top Dance Parties as featured in Timeout New York Magazine, celebrating their 6th year @ Taj Lounge!
Great dinner and dancing experience, live music, performers and guest DJ's. 

• RSVP: To enjoy the reduced admission , Mention the code that you will see in the comment section, it is different every week !!

• Price: $10 if you RSVP on the meet up. 

• Time:  8 pm- 2am ( Salsa Lesson at 7.00pm)


• Address: Taj Lounge, 48 W 21st St, New York

• What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

• Do I need a partner ?: No, you don’t need to bring a partner. We rotate during the group class, It will give you the opportunity to dance and meet different people.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON Manhattan

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and meditation after class.

Baladi Beat Belly Dance resumes its weekly dance class in Jersey City with Tarik Sultan.

In this class you will learn how to dance like a natural and unlock your inner beauty! You will learn how to respond to the music in a way that allows you to express your emotions through movement. Other added benifits: Increase your muscle tone, stamina, coordination, posture. Releive stress and tension all while have fun and looking great!

All classes begin with a warm up consisting of the core movements, allowing you to develope your skills at your own pace. Wonderful friendly, accepting atmosphere, lots of encouragement and feedback! At Baladi Beat, you are never just another face in the crowd, but an individual!

Classes start this Monday 8:00pm to 9:00pm

$20 a single class, $45 for 3 classes, $60 for 4.

Cash or check made out to "Tarik Sultan".  To find out more about Tarik visit www.tariksultan.net/Class_Schedule.html

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
Brooklyn Wildlife Summer Festival 2015 -  Day 3


Doors open at 8 pm - the show begins at 8:30

Nichole Acosta - poetry

Tangina Stone - Alternative Rock, Soul

Whole Music / j TheGodIs - Hip Hop/Poetry

TESHA - electronic/experimental

Blues Brovas 9000 - hip hop

Brent Butler - hip hop punk

Dynamic Equilibrium - hip hop

Thirst Vision - world bass, dancehall, trap, hip hop

Sistine Criminals - Electronic

The Freaky Baby Daddies - indie rock

DRMAGDN: - EDM, Dubstep, Complextro, Hard Electro, Prog House

ABOUT BWSF2015:

Brooklyn Wildlife Summer Festival is an annual diverse and synergistic, indoor and outdoor festival featuring some of the best Independent talent from New York and beyond. The goal of the event is to galvanize the Indie arts and music community and represent its flourishing cultural growth within Brooklyn, with a special focus on Bushwick. B WSF2015 caters to a new youth culture that is multi-faceted, variegated, ethnically ambiguous and racially interwoven. Black, white, red, brown, gay, straight, trans - whatever color or gender… everyone parties together.

The festival is created by artists and is 100% Independent. There is no corporate sponsorship or outside funding. BWSF is unique in that it is the only festival to offer such a large and varied selection of independent artists and musicians, active within the community, gathered in one space. 

BWSF focuses on performers in the Brooklyn arts and entertainment scene and due to the large presence of international artists in Brooklyn, the festival includes performers and participants from all around the world. There will be representation from UK, Germany, Denmark, Australia, Caribbean, Jamaica, Russia and more. 

BWSF2015 SEEKS TO REACH: 
Multicultural and Multiethnic people, ages 18-80

The festival attracts individuals who:
• Are seekers, social explorers, tastemakers and enjoy being ahead of the curve.
• Believe old-fashioned business models are outdated and traditional vehicles for communication (TV and Radio) are no longer in tune with the consumer of today.
• Have turned their backs on the status quo and crave progressive thought, art and culture.
• Artists, musicians, Brooklyn and New York dwellers and everyone who is part of or who appreciated the Indie scene.

results.description:
We're looking for creative new use-cases for digital currencies and blockchain tech.

We've all heard of recording land title-deeds on the blockchain as an amazing use-case for this tech, but what else is out there? How else can we connect the dots to see new ways of using these revolutionary technologies?

To do this, we're seeking experienced pros and students to join us in a two-day Makethon in New York, run according to 'venture design' principles, with special thanks to our sponsors Citi, KeepKey and Braintree and partners IDEO Futures and General Assembly New York City.

About the Makeathon
Makeathon participants will form teams on the first day to tackle briefs that we'll develop. The focus is on a multi-disciplinary approach to discover fresh use-cases.

Our briefs will be broadly focused on the themes at Consensus 2015: financial inclusion or 'financial plumbing' – the sometimes creaking structures that move money around the world. More details as we develop these.

We'll have a diverse group of mentors and coaches from IDEO Futures, World Vision, Citi Ventures and more. At the end of the second day, judges will look at what's been built. The winning team gets $5,000 in cash.

The Makeathon happens before our digital currency summit, Consensus 2015, so participants will also receive tickets to Consensus 2015 on 10th September.

The Makeathon itself is happening two days before the conference, on 8th and 9th September at General Assembly's awesome space in the Flatiron District.

Who should participate
You don't have to be an expert on blockchains, or a software developer, to participate.

If you're clued up on a particular area like compliance, financial needs of unbanked populations or the inner workings of the global asset-clearing and settlement system, you're who we're looking for. You could be a sector-expert, designer or developer; a current student or experienced pro in these areas.

APPLY HERE: http://www.coindesk.com/events/consensus-2015/makeathon/
results.name: Consensus 2015 Makeathon

I give a 'free', forever ongoing, astronomy class at the Senior Center.  You don't have to be a senior to join, but you must join the Senior Center for $72/year, which you can defer for at least a month, until you determine that you want to continue.

I never give the same lecture twice.  It would bore me.  My lectures are well prepared, and contain enormous resources from the live web, projected from my laptop to a flat screen TV.  It's all about gaining a perspective of your/my place in the universe.

==================

The class meets Tuesdays at 12:45pm.  Just come.  241 W 72st.  Ask for Laird.  (As of August, 2014, as well as for the last 5 years.)

To make sure the class isn't cancelled (it normally meets every week of the year), please email me at laird wh (one word) at aol dot com.  Make sure the word MEETUP does NOT appear anywhere in the email.  (It gets sorted away from my inbox.)
results.why: Astronomy is about EVERYTHING.  Or at least thats why I became interested in it in 2nd grade.  Now, 40 years post Ph.D. in Astronomy, Astronomy, and indeed all of science is still my passion.   My advisor was Carl Sagan.

results.description:
Ingrid Bergman: A Centennial Celebration

August 29 marks the 100th anniversary of Ingrid Bergman’s birth, an occasion MoMA will observe with a selection of films from her 50-year career—as chosen and, where possible, introduced by her children Pia Lindstrom, Roberto Rossellini, Jr., Isabella Rossellini, and Isotta Ingrid Rossellini.

The emotional transparency of Bergman’s performing style blended with her great natural beauty to create a different kind of movie star. When she arrived in America, in 1939, to star in a remake of her 1936 Swedish film Intermezzo, the producer David O. Selznick recognized in the 24-year-old a new freshness and accessibility—a radical break with the artificially elaborate notions of “glamor” that had been synonymous with female stars in Hollywood since the late silent era. In films like Casablanca (1942), Gaslight (1944) and Notorious (1946), Bergman seemed to speak directly to her public, cutting through melodramatic conventions.

Bergman’s search for authenticity eventually led to Italy, where she made five features with the pioneering Neorealist director Roberto Rossellini, a body of work now recognized as one of the foundations of modern cinema. After her relationship with Rossellini ended, Bergman continued to work with some of the medium’s most creative filmmakers. Her last theatrical film, Ingmar Bergman’s Autumn Sonata (1978), brought her back to her native Sweden.


 Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde

1941. USA. Directed by Victor Fleming. Screenplay by John Lee Mahin, Samuel Hoffenstein, from the novella by Robert Louis Stevenson. With Spencer Tracy, Ingrid Bergman, Lana Turner, Donald Crisp. Victor Fleming’s elaborate MGM adaptation of the Stevenson story has a distinctly Freudian tone, with Spencer Tracy’s repressed Victorian doctor discovering the thrill of unbridled sexuality (as kinky as the censors would allow) as he changes into the louche Mr. Hyde. Bergman plays the saucy barmaid who is brutalized into becoming Hyde’s mistress, while the good doctor remains loyal to his aristocratic fiancée, played by a prim Lana Turner. Courtesy Warner Bros. Selected by Ingrid Rossellini. 113 min.

For admissions and visitor information  click here: http://www.moma.org/visit/plan/index#filmticketing
results.name: Ingrid Bergman: A Centennial Celebration - Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde

results.description:
Fashion Shoot at Bethesda Terrace in Central Park

Please note:
Attendance is limited to myself and 4 photographers for quality time

Hello! I'm Laura. TheModel'sDen members have been loving my fashion shoots, so I'm hosting another one with a different look! If you check out past fashion shoot meetups you can see some photos taken by TMD members.

The Theme
The look will be a "Sex and the City" inspired pink tulle dress with a variety of accessories so each photographer can stylize as they wish (I'll help!) Check out the photos below to get a sense of the look.

The Shoot
We’ll shoot in the Bethesda Terrace area of Central Park, which includes a gorgeous arched passageway that leads to a stairway drenched in natural light, as well as the famous Bethesda Fountain and a view of the Boathouse. 

There will be plenty of options to get an array of shots staying in the same area. Photographers will shoot in 10 minute increments, with the option to use waiting photographer(s) as assistant(s). We will do three rounds of shooting. Exact end time depends on how many photographers are present.

The Fees: 

$105 per photographer

================== 


HOW TO PAY:

Payment for this meetup is done through TheModel'sDenPaypal account.  After you RSVP an invoice will be sent within a few hours for payment. 

 -- > $25  Non-refundable deposit is due when you RSVP.

Balance of $79 in cash is due the day of the meetup.  Please bring exact change to the meetup.  

==================== 

CANCELLATIONS: 

Please note!  -  Events are not cancelled because of inclement weather.  I will make the decision no less than 2 hours before the event.  You will be notified by all the following means:  posting on this event page; email; a text message and a call if no response is received from you.

ALWAYS Check this event page 2 hours before the event starts to be kept informed of the status.  

==================== 

ABOUT ME: 

I am a professional dancer, model and photographer. 

I’ve danced in musical theater, TV/film and commercials, I've modeled for magazines, book covers, students, instructors, and artists, and I've taken photos of hundred of actors, dancers, models and entrepreneurs in NYC as well as beautiful people and places around the globe.  

As a photographer I specialize in head shots and am a lover of natural light and finding the beauty in the everyday. To learn more about me visit

www.lauravolpacchio.com

and

<a>www.lvphotoanddesign.com.</a>

I view all of my photo shoots - regardless of which side of the lens I am on - as collaborative artistic processes. I believe both parties need to feel safe enough to be their authentic selves, take risks and work freely in order to create the most beautiful work. 

Although I have a lot of information to offer – from styling and posing to light and composition – I am always open to learning, even (and especially) when in the position of “instructor.”  Working with me will be collaborative, down to earth, silly (I’m a dork), and I have no doubt you will end up with images you are proud of. I encourage you to take the lead and make your visions happen, but I will be at your disposal to guide you through anything from location to framing. 

As a model, I take the lead and pose with the fluidity and variety of a dancer; I always welcome input from the photographers I'm working with, but they usually find they get better results if they just let me "do my thing" :)

REFERENCE IMAGES

THE LOOK (that's me!):

THE PLACE:

Let's shoot!

Laura

We have wonderful news! We have secured two amazing members of the New York Customer Service Meet-up Group to share their expertise on the evening of Tuesday, September 8th. It's a great way to re-start the year after Labor Day!

There will be light refreshments served during the networking portion of the meeting. This is the 3rd Meet-up and everyone in the group is welcoming, inclusive and eager to learn from each other. 

The two speakers are….

Nick Varney

Vice President, Experience Design & Transformation

Dow Jones & Company

Nick is a highly experienced consultant and portfolio lead working in the media sector, firstly in the Programme Leadership practice at Deloitte and most recently leading customer technology delivery programmes for News UK. For the last three months he has been selected to lead the customer experience design and transformation at Dow Jones. 



Ian Roncoroni

Co-Founder & COO 

Next Caller 

Next Caller is the world's largest database of customer profiles. The company links telephone number to personal information, like name, address, email, household income, and other demographic and social data. Ian is responsible for writing their industry-leading profile aggregation algorithm, and handles all compliance and business development.  He is a graduate of Princeton University, as well as the prestigious Y Combinator technology accelerator, and he has spoken at dozens of technology and customer experience events, including TechCrunch Disrupt and the IT Expo, where the company won an award for best presentation.

Please note: it's necessary to pre-register by noon on September 8th. The building security requires the attendees to be registered in advance.

results.description:
AWC NNJ invites you to join us on September 8th for the start of our[masked] Season dedicated to “Building Your Future - Building Your Network!”  


We have all heard the stories and strategies that show us the importance of Networking.  The quality and diversity of your network connections will make the difference when taking your career or business to the next level!

On Tuesday September 8th, David Deutsch, Founder and Chief Strategist at SynergiSocial, will be our featured speaker on Social Media strategies to generate business and career connections. He has successfully generated millions of dollars in warm leads for his clients and he will show you how to do the same.

You will learn:

• A working definition of social media

• Best (and worst!) practices using social media

• How to generate quality, warm leads using the most powerful social network in the world — yours!

• Find out why hedge fund manager Jack Killion says “David is the only social media professional I would use and recommend — I believe in sticking with the best.


David Deutsch, our speaker for the evening, is Founder and Chief Strategist of SynergiSocial, a New Jersey-based social media strategy firm. He is also Director of Social media and Online Strategy for Whitman Business Advisors, a CPA advisory and consulting firm. An early adopter of social media, he has been using social tools since 2003, long before the term existed. Since 2010 he has consulted with CPA practices, private firms, law offices, trade associations and non-profit organizations across the United States on effectively using social media to grow their businesses. He earned his Masters in Communication Management from the Annenberg School for Communication at the University of Southern California, and his BA in Economics and Philosophy from the University of Maryland, Baltimore County.

You can find out more on his web site @ SynergiSocial.com

Join us for a fun night of networking, and discussion!


 When: Tuesday, September 8, 2015

6:00 pm: Networking
6:30 pm: Hot Italian Buffet Dinner
7:30 pm: Presentation and Q&A

Cost: $10.00 (members).  $15 (non-members).

RSVP by Monday, September 7th via e-mail to: [masked].

You may make your payment when you arrive at the meeting, but please be aware that AWC-NNJ assumes that when you make a reservation, you are responsible for the cost whether or not you attend. Checks should be made out to "AWC-NNJ".  Price includes a hot Italian buffet dinner, salad, beverages, and a fun night of Networking.  

Come and learn about our programs and no-cost workshops for the upcoming year, and sign-up for AWC NNJ Chapter membership for $50.00.

25 Cook Avenue
Madison, NJ 07940
(proceed to large downstairs room)

Note: In the event the parking lot next to the Madison Community House is full, please use the adjacent municipal parking lot or street for free parking

After going under the train trestle bear right with the road onto Main Street. At the 3rd traffic light turn left onto Central Avenue. Make the first left (1 block) onto Cook Avenue. The Madison Community House is the red brick building, past the large parking lot on the left.

From 287 South: Take exit 35 (South Street). Turn left at the light at the end of the ramp onto Madison Avenue (124 E). Continue on Madison Avenue (124E) for approximately 3.5 miles toward Madison. After going under the train trestle bear right with the road onto Main Street. At the 3rd traffic light turn left onto Central Avenue. Make first the left (1 block) onto Cook Avenue. The Madison Community House is the red brick building, past the large parking lot, on the left.

From 287 North: Take exit 35 (Madison Ave). Turn left at the light at the end of the ramp. Make first right (follow signs for 124 East/Madison Avenue). At first stop sign make a right onto Madison Avenue. Pass the Morristown Hospital on the left. Continue on Madison Avenue (124E) for approximately 3.5 miles toward Madison. After going under the train trestle, bear right with the road onto Main Street. Turn left at the 3rd traffic light onto Central Avenue. Make the first left onto Cook Avenue. The Madison Community House is the red brick building, past the large parking lot, on the left.

From Garden State Parkway (North or South onto 78 West): Take Exit 142/ Route 78 West. (Coming from Parkway North get onto 78 East and take first exit for 78 West turnaround.) Take 78 West until you see signs for Route 24 West and move to local lanes on 78 West. Bear right onto Route 24 West. Take Exit 7a going toward Route 124 West/Chatham. Follow signs for Route 124 West/Chatham. Stay on 124 West and go through Chatham. Continue on Route 124 West for approximately 3.5 miles to the town of Madison. Turn right onto Central Avenue. Make the first left onto Cook Ave. The Madison Community House is the red brick building, past the large parking lot, on the left.

What To Do If You Are Arrested – A Practical Guide To Your Constitutional Rights


Innocent people DO get arrested, but there are things that you can do that will minimize the risks of a wrongful conviction.

In addition to his impressive legal experience, Mr. Parlatore is heavily influenced by his military experience, as a graduate of the U.S. Naval Academy and veteran of Operation Enduring Freedom. Topic:  Learn about Exchange Online Protection (EOP)


Meeting Abstract:  Introduction & Demo of EOP. Become familiar with EOP and how it ties into Office 365 and it's strengths. Agenda on main nyexug.com website.


Presenter: Prabhat Nigam, Microsoft Exchange MVP (he will be presenting via LiveMeeting). Streaming URL here for meeting. Meeting will include dinner for those attending.


Sponsor: Microsoft


Where:

New Microsoft office. 11 Times Square, between 42nd & 41st on 8th Avenue. Located across from Port Authority.

Doors Open 5:45pm and dinner arrives at 6pm.


Please visit the official NYExUG website posting for full meeting details such as Speaker BIO's, Product details, and more.

You can reserve your seat via the official NYExUG website's meeting (www.nyexug.com)or meetup if you show/email your FULL NAME by 10am day of meeting. FREE, Open to Public, and includes dinner.

Agenda

5:45pm - doors open/dinner arrives
6:30pm - main topic
8:30-9pm - raffle items

Folks attending will be able to win a various raffle items including Microsoft software. Free food, and open to all simply by RSVPing.

The meetings occur every 2nd Tuesday of every Month.

At our monthly meetings we have 1 or 2 main presentations covering various topics and discuss troubleshooting problems, adding new features and functionality, reviewing new products, and meeting/networking with other IT people (Exchange Admins, SysAdmins, IT Manager, IT Help Desk Support, CTOs, etc). Great way to learn about Microsoft Exchange Server in small, medium, and enterprise environments.

You can view past presentations on our website: nyexug.com

Past topics include: in-depth look at Microsoft's Redmond Dog-Food lab, live software replication demonstration, live hardware replication demonstration, Multi-site deployment recommendations, Configuring your firewall for Exchange 2003 and SP2 Changes (for the firewall), Moving your Exchange Server to a new Internet Connection, Groove, Exchange 2007, SAN Storage Solutions, Exchange Scaling Up, Server-side anti-spam solutions, Disaster Recovery, Outlook Direct Booking, Troubleshooting Exchange, Intro to Exchange and DNS, etc.

results.description:
***REGISTRATION OPEN***

On Tuesday September 8th @ 6 PM, you will have the opportunity to discover 4 innovative start ups at Atelier, the co-working space launched and housed by Belcham, the Belgian-American Chamber of Commerce in NYC. This first post holidays edition will feature the following companies: Seilenna, Sailo, Boomset and Jigsaw.

| Please note these changes! |

1) Each company will have 10 minutes to present followed by 5 minutes Q&A

2) A nominal charge of $10.00 will be requested when you register. (As we're typically at capacity, this will enable us to scale-up in terms of attendee quality, as well as cover part of our costs for staging and organizing the event - reminding you that we are a non-profit)

I'm happy to announce the new names of our participating startups:


- Seilenna


Seilenna is a swimwear line for dreamers. It combines the world’s most luxurious technical fabrics and innovative design to create silhouettes that flatter the natural contours of the body.

- Sailo


Launched in September of 2014 and based in New York and Florida, Sailo is a peer-to-peer boat rental marketplace that connects boat owners, captains, and renters on one easy to use platform. Whether you are experienced or new to boating, Sailo offers the possibility to view, compare and book yachts and captains in minutes. You choose from an hour, day or week, and at a variety of price points, we take care of all the rest. 

-Boomset


Event & Conference Check-in. Our technology is designed by event professionals and is always being perfected through years of experience and ongoing feedback we receive from clients like you. That’s why we can confidently say we deliver the perfect suite of the highest quality products.

- Jaswig


Our furniture is made to make you feel better; it gives you more freedom, it improves your health and productivity, and you know you've made a socially and environmentally responsible choice. We want to change the sitting norm by addressing all areas of society, including children. It is better to prevent a bad habit from being developed than to treat symptoms resulting from it. Decisions we make at Jaswig are based on what will increase human health and cause minimal harm to our environment by selecting the best possible materials.


I look forward to see you all again in big numbers for what is going to be another one of this memorable moments ! 

As always, beer for our MeetUps is sponsored by Duvel.

Be there or be square - and share the word.

Yvan De Munck

results.description:
To Attend Must Register Here: 

http://www.savorthesuccess.com/event/details/822

NYC LIVE Mastermind: The 3 P's of Communication Success - Presentations, Private Conversations, and Your (Sales) Pitch! New York City 

Free - Only for Premium Members

Location: In the Broadway Suite (2nd Fl.) at The Roosevelt Hotel, 45 E 45th street, NYC 

In order to grab someone's attention in less than 30 seconds, you need to be able to hook them with language that not only sparks their interest but leaves them wanting more. And if you want your presentation to bring in sales for your business, you'll need to communicate why it's a "no-brainer decision" to work with you or buy your product.


At this special LIVE Mastermind Presentation, we're featuring a trio of experts to share practical techniques for winning the room, reading any audience, and communicating to close the sale. Our Communications Experts include:

During this presentation, you will learn how to: Prepare for any given speaking engagementReap the profound benefits of public speaking, such as expanding your influence, becoming a thought leader, and increasing your bottom lineHow to use DiSC assessments to connect powerfully with othersHow to seamlessly integrate a sales pitch into your presentation3 clear-cut steps to close sales

Space is limited so RSVP now before we sell out!

Kelly Hadous is the CEO and founder of Win the Room a coaching and consulting company, and Emiisor an online education company. Kelly is a certified executive coach, public speaker, and a communication strategist. Kelly has spoken on many stages including at 3 TEDx events. She's coached executives, managers, entrepreneurs, politicians, and leaders across the country and internationally. Kelly has a background in finance, with degrees from New York and Columbia University, as well as acting in stage and film.​

Kerry Connelly is the founder and Executive Director of Vision to Mission, L.L.C. Kerry's personal mission is to empower women every day, and she lives this out in both her business, Vision to Mission, and her non-profit, She's ELEVATED. Kerry is The Network Marketing Coach, and through Vision to Mission, she offers Strategic Coaching, Power Consulting, and Massive Results. She coaches women in both the corporate and entrepreneurial arenas, with a special emphasis on the Direct Sales industry. She offers strategic and operational consulting as well.

Carolyn Herfurth is the founder of Biztruth, an activator and accelerator who has played a hand in the launch of over 100 businesses, and fiercely dedicated to helping entrepreneurs take charge of their lives through their ventures. Carolyn loves helping business owners create sustainable, successful businesses they love – by honoring their instincts to give – while developing the know-how to receive what they’re worth.

Give, Give, Get Mastermind Sessions
Our expert presentation will be followed by our signature "Give, Give, Get" Mastermind break-out sessions. Join with your Savor Sisters, other women entrepreneurs and business leaders to give, and receive, 7-8 minutes of the group "think-tanking" on YOUR behalf!

Be Our Guest
If you're new to Savor the Success and interested in attending this event, click here to redeem your trial membership and RSVP as our guest.

Savor Circle Sisters, don't miss this chance to connect! 
​This event is complimentary with your Premium Membership, so RSVP today!

• Kelly Hadous


• Kerry Connelly


•  Carolyn Herfurth


Savor Circle Sisters, don't miss this chance to connect! 
​This event is complimentary with your Premium Membership, so RSVP today!

results.description:
Algorithms that do not follow the market are very attractive to investors. We will discuss some approaches for reducing correlation to a benchmark and discuss why returns aren’t everything.

This is the first talk in Quantopian’s Lecture Series. You can view the cloneable notebook that goes along with this lecture on our newly launched Lectures page: https://www.quantopian.com/lectures.

Pizza and beer will be served. We hope you can join us!

Speaker Details

Delaney Granizo-Mackenzie will be presenting. Delaney is an engineer at Quantopian whose focus is on how Quantopian can be used as a teaching tool. After studying computer science at Princeton, Delaney joined Quantopian in 2014. Since then he has led successful course integrations at MIT Sloan and Stanford, and is planning on expanding to many more schools this fall. Delaney’s background includes 7 years of academic research at a bioinformatics lab, and a strong focus on statistics and machine learning. 

Want to learn more about Quantopian? Visit us at: www.quantopian.com.
results.name: Quantopian Lecture: The Art of Not Following the Market

results.description:
We can grab a bite nearby at 9 PM. If anyone wishes to leave earlier we can eat before 9. We could go to  Luzzo's around the corner which offers both pizza and a full menu.
****************************************************************

Photos from last year!

(About). 


For the past decade-plus there has been a gathering each September 8th at the Phoenix Bar - the former site of her devotion - where have been recounted stories, recited poetry, sketched drawings on the sidewalk, built an outdoor shrine, sung hymns and danced to the rhythms of pizzica and tarantella. In doing so, there has been created a new sense of the past and our connection to it, and ultimately a new sense of who we are. On this 12th anniversary, the festivities begin at 6 PM and continue until the last person decides to leave. 

Once again, the Phoenix Bar owner Brenda, the bartenders, and the patrons have graciously opened their space for this event.

447 East 13th Street, off of Avenue A, Manhattan

Photo of 13th Street, September 15th, 1915!

****************************************************************

Many of us lost a great friend, mentor and collaborator on July 2nd of this year. There is much to miss, but there is also much to celebrate.

Brian's great joy was in connecting people from different communities and walks of life, and seeing what they might do together.

In his honor, let's have a party. 

Join us September 8th, 2015 at the Michele Mariaud Gallery to celebrate the life and impact of Brian Clark

There will be light food and drink, however we ask that you please consider bringing a beverage/ snacks to pass to help ease the cost. 

This event has been planned by the community and we want to ensure that everyone has a chance to give Brian the NYC send off he deserves, so please if you know someone who knew Brian and hasn't received an invite to bring them along, the more the merrier. 

Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
We will be ascending the Major Welch, taking in the sunset and socializing at Perkins Tower, then descending on the AT. Bring a snack and beverage of choice to  enjoy during the break. We will be descending in the dark. Make sure you bring a working headlamp.

We will meet in the main large parking lot closest to the Inn. We will be leaving at 6:15 sharp in order to make the sunset. If you are running late, you are welcome to catch up with the group. This hike is a short distance however the hike up will get your heart pumping. It is a lot of elevation in a short distance.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water.  If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. Typically we meet at the parking lot and begin together. As we ascend, the group breaks off. We reconvene at the peak and begin our descent together.  You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of an evening event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. This is not mean, it is for your protection as well as the safety of the group. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain may cancel and would be determined that day if necessary.

Distance: about 4 miles round trip

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: approx 3 hours

This is a dog friendly hike. Park rule: on leash 6' or less. My rule: they must have current rabies and Lepto vaccines for our pups protection as well as our hikers.

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is free and all skill levels are welcome!

results.description:
Clearly, the concept of male privilege is not in question. However, gender stereotypes hinder men as well.

This group welcomes people of all genders. Tonight we want to talk about masculinity and the male experience - the ways in which men are limited by their gender and how liberating men from these expectations will free us all.

Because of the benefits that accompany much of the male experience, it becomes more difficult for all of us to talk about the ways in which men are bound by gender norms. 

This is a safe space to discuss these issues. 

Here is a list of articles that may be of interest:


1] "The Weaker Sex"


2] "Gender stereotypes hurt men too"

3] "The Riddle of the Brain Doctor: The Changing Roles of Men and Women in the 21st Century"

4] "Dads want more diaper changing tables"

5] "Masculinity in the Hearst Press"

6] "30 years of masculinity research"


7] "Why talking about ‘healthy masculinity’ is like talking about ‘healthy cancer’"

venue.name: NYC Data Science Academy

results.description:
Presented by NYC Data Science Academy students who just finished 12 weeks full time program, apply for Sept 2015 and Jan 2016 program to be a Data Scientist.

Preparation:

Please bring your laptop, we will show some trick and codes to get your on fast track!

Event schedule:

6:30-7:00  Visualization of Trading Strategy backtesting 

7:00-7:15    Q&A

7:15-7:45  Fastest subway in NYC (Data updates every 10seconds!)

7:45-8:00   Q&A

Speaker bio: 

Luke Lin is currently a Ph.D. candidate in Mathematics at Stony Brook University who is specialized in partial differential equations. As a lifelong learner of mathematics, he is extremely efficient in quantitative analysis and also skilled at communicating abstract concepts. With proficiency in R and Python, Luke is primed to be a major asset to any analytic force.

Xavier Capdepon (MSc Urban Engineering & Master in Corporate Finance)
Xavier has more than 12 years experience in analytical modeling. In a career ranging from transportation research to insurance securitization trading and esoteric securities banking, Xavier has deep roots in Data Science. From C and VBA, to SQL, R and Python, Xavier believes in knowing the best-in-breed toolkits. An experienced instructor and consultant in the field of finance, Xavier continues to deepen his abiding interest in prediction through taking the ASA/CAS actuarial exams (first two completed) and experimenting with machine learning models using Hadoop and Spark. Previously at Guggenheim Partners, he is currently a Fellow at the NYC Data Science Academy. 

Agenda/Content: 

Demonstration of a Shiny App for building strategy from technical indicators and visualizing the return. In this Shiny App, Luke implemented a trading strategy generated by Bollinger Band, visualized the return and eventually modified the strategy by MACD. Bollinger Band is an elementary volatility indicator and the strategy is generated based on the belief that the price bounce back whenever it hits the edge of Bollinger Band. This is an one of the simplest strategies and personally I believe it reflects humans' most naive feeling about the stock prices. The visualization builds up the connection between the market data and our strategy, because we can actually see how market react to it. Once the return can be seen, it is straightforward to understand why a strategy fail in certain period. In our case, we see that strategy fails when the trend price is very strong--which makes sense because when trend is strong the assumption that the price bounce back is no longer valid. Here we need to impose another popular indicator, MACD. MACD reveals momentum of the price change. The backend algorithm basically suspends buying signal from Bollinger Band and encourages selling to stop loss when MACD shows very negative momentum. It does the opposite when MACD indicates positive momentum. This simple modification reduce the risk or improve the return in several different stocks.The importance of his method lies in the fact that concept behind the modification is simple and the math I used is basic yet the improvement is obvious. This suggests to a reasonable extent our trading result can be improved with better tool and understanding.

Demonstration of a Shiny App for processing subways traveling time calculations and visualizing the subways movements in real time using a Python script.
In his Shiny app, Xavier explored the MTA data by redrawing a map of New York using the paths of both buses and subways, implemented a script to compare and visualize the travel times of the lines 4 Express train and 1 local train from the bronx to lower manhattan and to create a real time map of the 1 train.
The idea for the app is based on a comment from his sister in law who mentionned several times that, in her experience, the subways, 1 local trains and 4 express trains, were not running with the same punctuality from the Bronx to Lower Manhattan during the early morning peak. In order to investigate, Xavier used the static and real time data available on the MTA.info website.
At first, in an attempt to make sense of the numerous files and data available, he used the data to redraw the map of new york city using the paths used every day by the buses and the subways. The visualization is a map with a particularity: the transparency of the drawing package ggplot2 allows to highlight the streets used by several bus lines around new york city.Then, Xavier wrote a script to gather the data and calculate the travel time for the 1 and 4 trains from the Bronx to lower Manhattan given a depart time along the day. The visualization some trends over the day with two peaks at rush hours and lower difference in travel time between the 1 and 4 trains than expected.
Finally, using the work described previously, the Shiny app also presents a real time map of the 1 train using real time data gathered every 10 second from the MTA API using Python script.



Reference:

Visualization of Trading Strategy backtesting 

blogpost: http://nycdatascience.com/visualization-strategy-back-testing/

App: http://216.230.228.88/Bootcamp2-Project/Shiny-Project/Luke/


Redrawing NY City Map using Public Transportation Data


blogpost: http://nycdatascience.com/fastest-subway-in-nyc/

App:http://216.230.228.88:3838/Bootcamp2-Project/Shiny-Project/Xavier/

results.name: R Shiny demo: Trading Strategy backtesting and Find Fastest subway in NYC

results.description:
Time and time again when I talk to group members after sessions, I hear that folks are interested in real customer stories. Based on that feedback, we're going to take the meetup to the AWS NYC Loft on Tuesday, September 8th for a talk by an awesome AWS customer, Hudl. In this session Hudl will take us though a deep dive into their architecture and deployment processes. 

Behind the Scenes with Hudl: Development in the Multiverse

Hudl powers coaching and analysis for over one hundred thousand sports teams worldwide, primarily through video. Over the past seven years Hudl has grown on AWS from a large monolithic app to a broad set of microservices. In building these services Hudl has developed a novel platform, collectively called Multiverse, that enables developers to switch testing environments rapidly during dev/test, and streamlines deployment. This talk will focus on Hudl's path from monolith to multiverse, share lessons learned, and discuss some of our unique approaches to microservices.

Logistics:

Snacks and beverages will be available. Event check ins will begin at 6:30pm and the talk will begin at 6:45pm.
results.name: Microservices - One customer's unique approach.

Want to make comics but you're feeling stuck? Need supportive comics artists to hold you accountable for your progress? You did InkTober or 30 Days of Comics and realized you need that extra push to crank pages out? Want to draw in the company of other human beings?

THIS IS THE MEETUP FOR YOU. We'll be tackling questions like: Are you drawing comics? When are you going to draw comics? Why aren't you drawing comics right this moment? And so on and so forth. The answer to all these questions is: SHUT UP AND DRAW COMICS.

Drop on by, bring a friend, grab a beer or coffee, say hello, chat if you want, but DRAW COMICS.

We have a monthly meet and greet hangout meetup, and we also schedule drawing days, sketch days, convention visits, museum trips, whatever. If you have an idea for a meetup or a location you'd like to suggest, let me know!

For everyone who's been coming regularly, THANK YOU!! And newcomers - please feel free to come and join. Our group is diverse, energizing, and judgment-free. Finally, we would like to humbly ask that you consider pitching in $1 or $2 (only if you come a second+ time - not for newcomers) - it helps leverage the monthly Meetup website payment.

If you RSVP to a meetup but something comes up and you can't make it (and these things happen), please update your RSVP.

results.description:
Surprisingly, there are only a few places to enjoy dinner and hear great jazz at the same time. If you would like the itinerary to include a jazz supper club, let us know and we'll contact you ahead of time to make those arrangements.

The tour starts relatively early, so you'll be shocked to find out how much great jazz is being performed by masters and innovators in this neighborhood's below-the-radar scene. No lines, no crowds, just amazing live music - up close and personal.

This is a jam-packed walking tour dedicated to discovering this infamous neighborhood’s swinging hidden jazz joints and speakeasies at a relaxed pace. Your expert guide will point out defunct legendary clubs like Cafe Society, where Billie Holiday made her downtown debut; and other long gone clubs like Sweet Basil's, The Village Gate, and the hard-bopping Cafe Bohemia where Charles Mingus, Art Blakey and Miles Davis chose to introduce their latest compositions. 

Date: September 8th 
Time: 6:30 PM 
Price: $100 / Person

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't open our door from 6:30 - 7 pm while meditation is in progress. Kindly refrain from ringing our buzzer during this time.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003
[masked]
www.crsny.org
results.name: ACIM-Based Guided Meditation

He can help YOU, too.

There are new rules and <a>regulations</a> concerning the Tuesday <a>night</a> games. Please scroll down and read them all before signing up for the event.


There may not be space for you if you don't.


<a>Table</a> Top Role <a>Playing</a> Game Night!


 

This is the official <a>RPG game</a> night of the NY SciFi/Fan Meetup Group.

 

Every Tuesday night we get together to indulge in <a>Table Top RPGs</a>. There are <a>multiple games</a> going on at once, so getting involved in a game is <a>easy</a>.


For those of you unfamiliar with the term, a Table Top RPG (Role <a>Playing</a> Game) is a type of game where the players create characters based on the  story/system available and one person acts as a storyteller. Everyone interacts and works together to <a>create a story</a> and have a few laughs as well.


New Rules for Signing Up:


How to <a>sign up</a>: There will be at leas two <a>games running</a> each week.  You will be able to see who is running, what games are being <a>played</a>, and who is <a>playing</a> below. There will be a total of six spots <a>open</a> in each game, so if a game has filled up you will not be able to join that game. 


When you <a>sign up</a>, leave a comment stating which game you would like to participate in and your name will be added to the roster. If you would like to leave a game or switch over to another game in <a>progress</a>, simply speak to Justin or Cat. They will let you know if there is <a>open</a> space to do so.


If it is your first time <a>attending</a> a game, we have pre-made characters for you to <a>select</a> from. Beginning on your third RPG event, you may choose to make an original character for whatever game you're currently participating in.


Can I run my own game?: If you would like to run your own game, please contact Justin or Cat to reserve a slot.


Need Dice?: Please bring yours if you have some if you need extra I will provide some.

Games Currently Running:

Jutin: Full Steam Ahead 

A new steampunk-inspired RPG by Justin.

Cat: Monster of the Week

A game of investigating and fighting the things that go bump in the night. This campaign is set in a fictional California city a few years after WWII

Current Roster:

Liz

Joseph

Mike

Alden

This event is being hosted by <a>Dave Cervini's New York Social Network </a>and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions contact the event organizer [masked].

See the Highline in a totally different way as the sun sets and with the spring cutback which exposes a lot of what is covered during the summer.  You will also have a chance to check out the planets and stars through the telescopes of the Amateur Astronomers Association!  Our tours are designed for fun and friendly members of NYSN and our partner social networking groups.  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day!  The Highline is New York’s most popular attraction! The Highline is an elevated freight train trestle that operated in NYC from the 1930’s to the 1980’s. After years of neglect The Friends of The Highline have saved the structure and transformed it into a beautiful park featuring many of the elements from its’ rich history! Your tour guide will share the history of the highline and the surrounding neighborhoods and show you amazing photo’s from before the trestle was built, while it was in operation and what it looked like while abandoned.

Join us for a fun evening socializing and learning.  Following the tour the group will go out for food and drinks. $15 includes the tour only.

What to Wear: Dress casual/business casual. Wear comfortable shoes

What to Bring: A camera, a bottle of water for the walk and your sense of adventure!

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will come on their own.

What to Expect: 10-20 fun and friendly people who are looking to make new friends and learn a little about the city.

The group will meet at the bar at The Death Avenue Cafe on 10th and 28th from 6:30-7pm (Come closer to 6:30pm if you wish to have a pre-tour cocktail or nosh) we will end at Gansevoort street. Following the tour the group will likely go out for food and drink. Tour duration approx: 90 minutes.

Please bring exact change if possible: $15

In case of poor weather we will send updates prior to the tour
results.name: NY Tours For New Yorker's Sunset Stargazing Highline History Tour

results.description:
Dear Enneagram group -

The NY Enneagram group will resume monthly meetings after Labor Day, ending a six-month hiatus.  We'll go back to our usual first-Tuesday-of-the-month schedule and NYTS location, except for September, when we'll be meeting on the second Tuesday.

We'll have a brief planning meeting for our next series of interactive meetings - "The Musical Enneagram" - some details on this series are listed below.  We'll also have a mini-reading (this month only), showcasing a few sample short pieces of fictional writing from the breakout group (Douglas, Tom, Nicholas), who have been meeting in recent months to explore fiction-writing specifically from the point-of-view of given Enneagram types.

Please consider coming out joining us.  This meeting will be a unique opportunity to help shape our next series, as well as catching up on recent activities.

Regards,

Nicholas (Organizer)

New Series: The Musical Enneagram

Exploring the musical expressions of each of the types of the Enneagram can be a fascinating exercise that may add breadth and color to our understanding of the nature of the types.  While it is certainly not simple or easy to say that a given composer's music clearly exhibits type-specific attributes, it turns out that some interesting generalizations based on the creator's type seem just possible.  With considerably less of a stretch, it is certainly also fair game to listen into music, given knowledge of the creator's type, and to discern new meanings, or at least new interpretations of the music, using that knowledge.

The goal of this series will be to assemble a medley of great music created by - or at least somehow representative of (see more below) - each of the types of the Enneagram.  I (Nicholas, Organizer) have spent a good deal of time over the past year making a start at such a medley.  I do not claim that my selections represent a cross-section of music in its totality - my choices naturally begin with personal favorites of mine - but I've tried to expand these into a broadly representative spectrum of historically-important music of many genres, created by individuals for whom I have pretty good type diagnosis, and have also included specific pieces that capture - as nearly as anything I could find - something of the essence of each Enneagram Type.

Given the breadth of the topic area, a medley like this can never really be considered finished.  In the series I have in mind, I'll present something of what I've collected, but it will also be your turn to participate and to add some more music as well.  We'll discuss to get to some clarity on typing musical creators according to the Enneagram, and also to looking at music itself through an Enneagram lens, which may be necessary if we don't have enough information to be sure about the creator's type (or, if there are many creators, or very strong cultural factors at work, etc.)

How can a piece of music "express" the attribute of an Ennegram type?  There are many possible ways - perhaps the most obvious (and the most trivial) is the lyrics included in many songs and other musical forms.  Think for example of the penchant of Type Two for idealizing one's experience of important one-to-one personal relationships or hoped-for relationships - and the innumerable pop songs that express similar sentiments.  ("All of My Love," "You Are the Sunshine of My Life,"  "I Just Want to be Your Everything," ....)

To go a bit deeper, we might also inquire into the "texture" of a given piece of music - do the harmonies, the orchestration, the basic structure of the musical elements capture something of the composer's emotional "tone"?  Clearly, there will be significant issues of interpretation involved, but perhaps we can (mostly?) agree on some things after some immersion in the topic and some listening together.

Lastly, in those cases when we really *know* the type of the ultimate creator, we may be able to interpret a little deeper or differently than if we didn't have this knowledge.  Looking into a composer's biographies adds somehow to our experience of the music.  Just what or how may be difficult to say, but we will do our best to explore together the specific effect of knowing the composer's Enneagram type.

No specific preparation is asked for the September organization meeting that will begin this series.  We'll just do some planning - possibly listen to a few sample tracks of the collection I've already gathered - and discuss how group members can best contribute.  Please feel free to consider in advance the various genres, sub-genres and specific pieces of music you enjoy, and how examples within each might relate to its creators' type(s), if you know them.
results.name: Org Meeting for Music Series + Mini-Reading

results.description:
This running group is for anyone who just wants to go for a run and make new friends. If you're looking to get into better shape or become a better runner we can help you with that. But our main focus is to enjoy the run around Central Park.

We run anywhere from 3-6 miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. We will meet at Columbus Circle behind the Gold statue (The Maine Monument)to warm up stretch and have a chance to meet everyone and coordinate the run.

The New York Running company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has changing rooms, and free bag check also has lockers but you have to bring your own lock and closes at 9pm.

We can start off as a group and run as a group if everyone wants to run at the same pace but others are more than welcome to break up into smaller groups for those of you who might want to run a little faster.

After each run we head to our local bar DJ Reynolds to grab a drink or two and get something to eat and it gives us a chance to get to know each other.

I will post what I'll be wearing and my number in the comments section the day of the run.

results.description:
Sensors are all around you, and they're gathering more data about you by the second.

Sounds pretty freaky when I put it like that, right?

Well, there's a lot of work to be done on the privacy legislation front. There's no question that data security and privacy is going to be one of the primary debates of the next decade (or two).

But what if we were able to slap the equivalent of a "fair trade" label on data in the same way we do with coffee or organic produce?


Hmmmm..... (<<that's what I said too. And I have something to share at the meetup on just this topic.)

Speaking of which, the agenda for this meetup is going to focus on brainstorming the future of data ownership, encryption, and data sharing. We'll touch on various technologies like IoT, crowdsourcing, and more - all to tackle this enormous challenge. 

You up for it? RSVP and save your spot! We're in a smaller and more intimate venue, so spots will go fast.

Cheers! See you soon.

-Dan

results.description:
Working with Andela With Ilya Katz.
Ilya is a senior developer and Ruby enthusiast at ExecOnline. He has spent over a decade in the New York software industry in companies ranging from financial services to wellness and education technology startups. Andela and ExecOnline are two education companies based in NYC using technology and innovation to transform higher education systems. ExecOnline partners with universities to provide online MBA education programing to corporate executives around the world. They have partnered with Andela, which trains web and mobile developers in Africa through a self-funding education model. The partnership is helping ExecOnline build out their Ruby-based technology platform and continue their expansion into new markets. They will be talking about the new platform that they have built together, and different ways technologists can engage with them. Continuous Debilitation: A Story of Intermittent Capybara Failures and How One Team Fought Back - Travis Vander Hoop The situation was grim. Half of the builds on our continuous integration service were failing, but in different places and for seemingly disconnected reasons. We couldn’t deploy in full faith, and reproducing the test failures locally proved an olympic test of patience. This talk focuses on how we solved our flickering spec problem and returned to place of peace and happiness. Travis Vander Hoop is a software developer for Stride Consulting, an NYC-based agile consultancy.

Understanding Web Development with Rack with Max Cantor - Rails is the de facto standard for Ruby web development, but what's really going on in an HTTP-based application when you look under the hood? In this talk, we'll take a ground-up approach to understanding Rack, Ruby's ubiquitous HTTP application development library. We'll talk about what Rails buys us over a simple tool like Rack, and learn to write simple applications without the overhead. Learning about Rack will give you valuable perspective to debug and develop Rails apps, empower you to create small and targeted apps, and it will provide a great foundation for thinking about where modern web development is headed. Max has been doing professional web development for ten years; he spent 2014 teaching the three-month Web Development Immersive course at General Assembly, and now works at lean startup studio Neo Innovation. He also paints, fences competitively, and loves independent game dev.
results.name: Debugging Feature Tests and A Deep Dive on Rack

results.description:
Flower essences are natural elixirs that work energetically to restore mental and emotional balance. As each flower essence addresses a different psycho-emotional constitution, they can help support the strengths and mollify the challenges associated with the unique archetypal processes of the astrological signs and planets. In this talk, Stephanie will give a brief overview of flower essences and how to use them, review those that accord with each of the twelve signs, and also discuss those that may be supportive during a range of planetary transits. 

SPEAKER

Stephanie Gailing, M.S., is an astrologer, wellness consultant, and flower essence practitioner. Author of the book Planetary Apothecary: An Astrological Approach to Health and Wellness and her new Stellar LookBook series, Stephanie offers astrology-inspired wellness counseling and coaching for individuals, couples, and businesses. Stephanie has written about wellness astrology for MindBodyGreen, MySign, Astrology.com, and American Spa, and has given presentations on the subject at NORWAC, Everything Under the Sun (NCGR 2013 Conference), NCGR-NYC, and San Francisco's International Astrology Day. Actively involved in the national astrology community, Stephanie currently calls Seattle and the NYC area home.



A suggested donation is $5 very much appreciated. Please know whatever you can afford is acceptable.

Donations collected pay our rent, Meetup.com fees, beverages and snacks, and speaker! 

PS: If you show up a little early, the Quest Bookshop is an excellent source of many metaphysical books and items, and well worth a browse. They close at 7pm. 


DIRECTIONS & OUTLINE

The meetup takes place at the Theosophical Society, which is next door to Quest Bookshop. You may enter through the bookshop before 7 pm (when it closes) or to the left of the bookshop after 7 pm. A sign will be posted on the door you can enter. The following is a rough outline. The meetup will start at 7 pm SHARP. 

7:00 - 7:20 - Short talk sharing some astrological fundamentals, especially for beginners 
7:20 - 7:40 - Brief intros from attendees, announcements 
7:40 - 8:40 - Main presentation 
8:40 - 9:15 - Socializing (while putting away chairs)
results.how_to_find_us: We are the door on the right (once you enter through the gate); look for the Meetup signs
results.name: September 2015: Stellar Elixirs: An Exploration of Astrology & Flower Essences

results.description:
Hey ya'all. Guess what? We've been invited by our 'special friends' again to see a pre-release screaming of the new M. Night Shyamalan film 'THE VISIT', which officially opens in theaters on September 11th. The movie starts promptly at 7pm. You'll need to be to the theater No Later Than 6:15pm. If you are late you'll just have to wait as we'll be going in together at exactly 6:15.

FILM SYNOPSIS


Life appears normal for two siblings until they discover that Grandma and Grandpa's behavior has suddenly become deeply disturbing after being left to stay at their grandparents' house while their mother is on vacation. They are warned not to come out of their room past 9:30 at night, but, after curiosity gets the better of them, they realize that there is something terribly wrong taking place. After failing to convince their mother to come to their rescue, they are left on their own to face the untold horrors surrounding the two now seemingly evil elders.

https://youtu.be/YfQnRjkuvaY
results.name: Free Pre-Release Sreaming of 'THE VISIT'!!
