results.description:
The Weekly Dharma Gathering is a perfect introduction to the Shambhala teachings and mindfulness meditation, as well as an opportunity to connect with other practitioners. It consists of group meditation practice, a talk by one of our senior teachers, discussion, and a light reception. Meditation instruction is also provided.

This open house is an opportunity to meditate in a supportive group setting, to learn about how to apply the principles of meditation to everyday life, and to meet and mingle with fellow New Yorkers interested in mindfulness. Bring your friends!

$10 suggested donation

More at http://ny.shambhala.org/weeklydharmagathering

Ethan Nichtern is a Shastri, a senior teacher, in the Shambhala tradition. He is the senior teacher in residence for the NY Shambhala community. He is the author of The Road Home: A Contemporary Exploration of the Buddhist Path, Your Emoticons Won't Save You, and One City: A Declaration of Interdependence. He is also the founder of The Interdependence Project, an organization dedicated to Buddhist-inspired meditation and psychology, transformational activism, mindful arts, and meaningful media. He teaches and lectures around the world and is based in New York City. See more info at www.ethannichtern.com #weeklydharmagathering #shambhala
results.name: Open House Dharma Gathering, Ethan Nichtern: Having a Practice vs. Having a Path

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

When you RSVP, please post your pace time and/or training run distance for the day.
results.name: Central Park Training Run

EVERY Tuesday Night!

NYC's hottest variety showcase at Karma Lounge produced by Hampton Blu™ Entertainment!!

results.description:
We will be meeting at Info Commons room # 5.

PLEASE NOTE that we limit attendance to better insure that all get a chance to have their writing critiqued.  If our maximum for the week is reached, you have the option of being notified when someone changes their RSVP to no.  PLEASE DO NOT RSVP YES UNLESS YOU ARE AS SURE AS IS HUMANLY POSSIBLE THAT YOU WILL BE ABLE TO ATTEND AND CHANGE YOUR RSVP TO NO IMMEDIATELY if your situation does change, for the sake of those waiting for a spot.  


Join us for a weekly get together of sometimes frank and hopefully always constructive criticism of your literary work. There is no restriction on the type of genre and only a few rules:

1. Bring up to 6 double spaced typed pages of your work for reading. Additional copies would be helpful in order to allow others in the group to follow along.

2. The author is not allowed to speak while feedback is being provided.

3. The same piece should not be reread at a future workshop.

We will meet every Tuesday at 7 PM on the first floor of the Central Library, unless a meetup is not scheduled for that date due to a holiday or other event. A floor plan link is available at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/sites/default/files/files/pdf/central/floorplan.pdf.

More information about the Brooklyn Central Library, including available public transportation options, can be found at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/locations/central.

Hope to see all of you there.

Danny

results.description:
Let's get together for some game night shenanigans! Our hope is you will get to know some interesting people all the while having fun playing games!


At 7:00pm we're going to kick things off with some open "quirk starters" as everyone is arriving, and at 7:30pm we'll split off into groups and play some games! 

The Uncommons is what happens when you combine board games with a cafe. It's only $5 per person (they take cash or card) for literally walls of games - as many as you want for as long as you want! They also have a menu with food and drinks of all sorts if desired.


Cards Against Humanity is always a group favorite at some point, and I'm probably going to try out a new game never before played just to spice things up. So whether, you're looking to make a ruckus with a classic or shake things up with something new, there's a game for all styles of interest!

I can't wait for us to get together and play  :-)

results.description:
presents
Rajan Khanna
Michael Swanwick
Tuesday, Sept. 8th -- doors open 6:30 p.m.
$7 suggested donation
The Commons Cafe | 388 Atlantic Avenue
(directions & links below)
This is another landmark season for the NYRSF Readings series, and with it we bring some remarkable changes. Not in the quality of our readers -- we daresay that's too high a bar to set -- but in our venue and our media.

To begin with, we are now settled in at our fabulous new venue, the Brooklyn Commons Cafe. The Commons holds many more people than we could before, and serves serves gourmet coffees, teas, beers both draft and bottled and good natural wine by the glass, as well as six sandwiches (portabello, mozzarella, smoked salmon, smoked whitefish, fava bean puree with olive tapenade, salami) and a couple salads (avocado, mixed greens). Plus empanadas, nuts, pastries... So the traditional event of going out with the writers after the reading will be on-site!

And if you caught our three readings in April and early May, you will know that we are now streaming these events live via Livestream, where they will remain archived for a period of time. (Right now you can still catch those events by going to Livestream.com and searching for NYRSF.) This is largely made possible by the facilities at the Commons, including three robotic cameras and wireless mics -- and the professional skills of Terence Taylor, sf/f writer and video producer. The result: Nothing less than a fully professional webcast. (Note: This doesn't let you off the hook from attending live if you're within 100 miles of the event, of course...)

Add to that the fact that we are beginning our 25th Season! We have great wonders for you this year -- but with this expansion come an expansion of our costs. Our price remains the same -- FREE! -- and our suggested donation policy of $7 remains. But we need to work much harder to hustle donations, both on-site and off. So this December, look our for our first Kickstarter campaign and think good thoughts about donating (and perhaps snagging a holiday gift for a loved one. This will not only shore up the losses we take most every event, but will allow us to pay our rent, provide a (nice) stipend to the talent and staff, and perhaps even to fly a special guest now and then. Details forthcoming.

And what better way to start the season with two wonderful writers -- one established and the other a new talent with his second novel.

---
Rajan Khanna is an author, blogger, reviewer and narrator. His first novel, Falling Sky, a post-apocalyptic adventure with airships, was released in October 2014. A sequel, Rising Tide, is due out in October 2015. His short fiction has appeared in Lightspeed Magazine, Beneath Ceaseless Skies, and several anthologies. His articles and reviews have appeared at Tor.com and LitReactor.com, and his podcast narrations can be heard at Podcastle, Escape Pod, PseudoPod, Beneath Ceaseless Skies, and Lightspeed Magazine. Rajan lives in New York where he's a member of the Altered Fluid writing group. His personal website is http://rajankhanna.com and he tweets as @rajanyk. Michael Swanwick has received the Hugo, Nebula, Theodore Sturgeon, and World Fantasy Awards for his work Stations of the Tide, which was also honored with the Nebula Award and was also nominated for the Hugo and Arthur C. Clarke Awards. "The Edge of the World," was awarded the Theodore Sturgeon Memorial Award in 1989, and nominated for both the Hugo and World Fantasy Awards. "Radio Waves" received the World Fantasy Award in 1996. "The Very Pulse of the Machine" received the Hugo Award in 1999, as did "Scherzo with Tyrannosaur" in 2000. His stories have appeared in Omni, Penthouse, Amazing, Asimov's, High Times, New Dimensions, Starlight, Universe, Full Spectrum, Triquarterly and elsewhere. Many have been reprinted in Best of the Year anthologies, and translated for Japanese, Dutch, German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, Swedish, French and Croatian publications.

His latest novel, Chasing the Phoenix, is just out from Tor Books, and continues the adventures of Darger & Surplus as they continue evr-East -- this time passing through China. Other books include In the Drift, an Ace Special; Vacuum Flowers; Griffin's Egg; Stations of the Tide; The Iron Dragon's Daughter, a New York Times Notable Book, The Dragons of Babel, and Jack Faust; his short fiction has been collected in Gravity's Angels, A Geography of Unknown Lands, Moon Dogs, Tales of Old Earth, and a collection of short-shorts, Cigar-Box Faust and Other Miniatures.

He lives in Philadelphia with his wife, Marianne Porter, and their son, Sean. --
The Brooklyn Commons Cafe at 388 Atlantic Avenue is an open and collaborative movement building space, only minutes away from the Hoyt-Schermerhorn and Atlantic Avenue subway stops in downtown Brooklyn. The Commons provides resources to the progressive community including affordable office and meeting spaces as well as an event venue that can host anything from parties and benefits to forums, performances, films and workshops. If you are interested in meeting or event space, please contact them at [masked].

---
WHEN:
Tuesday, September 8th
Doors open at 6:30 -- event begins at 7

WHERE:
The Brooklyn Commons
388 Atlantic Avenue (between Hoyt & Bond St.)
https://www.google.com/maps/place/388+Atlantic+Ave,+Brooklyn,+NY+11217

HOW:
Hoyt-Schermerhorn subway stop (A,C,G); Nevins St. (2,3,4,5); and the Barclay Center (B,D,N,R,Q,2,3,4,5, and LIRR). Try the interactive map with the link above.

LINKS:
http://hourwolf.com/nyrsf
Go to Facebook and search for NYRSF Readings

Subscribe or submit articles to the magazine!

results.description:
Join Be Social Change on Tuesday, September 8th from 7 PM to 9PM for Online Marketing Fundamentals - How to Get More Customers and Supporters Online with Shane Rasnak, Founder of Shane Rasnak Consulting.

If you want your organization to grow, succeed, and make an impact, you need a way to consistently attract new customers and supporters. Whether you’re building an organization or working in one, reaching the people you want to serve and growing your market will always be a top priority for your team.

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/OnlineMktSept8

===========================================

Online marketing offers a powerful and cost-effective way to reach your audience, but the number of channels, strategies, and tactics out there can be overwhelming.

Where do you start? What are the options? What actually gets results instead of wasting your time?

These are the questions we’ll explore in this workshop, helping you to craft an effective online marketing strategy that will get your organization greater recognition, a broader reach, more customers, and higher sales.

* Doors open at 6:45, class starts at 7:00 sharp *


WHAT YOU’LL LEARN: 

• A holistic model that enables you to think strategically and makes online marketing simple and approachable

• The most commonly used and profitable methods for reaching your audience

• How to prioritize marketing channels and focus on what’s best for your unique situation

• How to build a stronger presence online so people who need your products/services can find out about you

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR: 

• Entrepreneurs and leaders who want to learn how to attract more customers and supporters to their organization

• Professionals who want to learn to create more value for their organization by studying one of the most fundamental challenges faced by all organizations: getting more customers

INSTRUCTOR BIO:

Shane Rasnak (@shanerasnak) is a marketing consultant who specializes in advising leaders of impact-driven organizations, helping them to grow by improving their websites and online marketing.

Prior to launching his consulting business, Shane was a founding member and the Director of Marketing at ReWork, a company that recruits exceptional people for organizations addressing social, environmental, and cultural issues. It has been featured on Harvard Business Review, Inc, Fast Company, and Wall Street Journal, and its clients include Acumen, Echoing Green, and GOOD/Corps.

You can learn more about his work at www.shanerasnak.com www.shanerasnak.com, and you can connect with him at his LinkedIn page.  

SPACE PARTNER 

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/KPL4uynCqIoMu2deyfpUIP59J1-rk9uZwr8AQMeHBdGbJTw9YsL_JSkKxTZucHnuclxQsW120aO4HFk4uK8rilV2ZxPHbeyg-sLyxfzjQdMmcjLV-29EequKqpboQGQlLg

The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:50 pm, Thu. 11 am – 12 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

 

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

Functional Game Engine Design

Alex Kehayias will be exploring the challenges of building a game engine using a (mostly!) functional style in Clojure/ClojureScript.

https://github.com/alexkehayias/chocolatier.

He has been actively working on it for over a year and has experimented with numerous approaches that have revealed many benefits and tradeoffs. We'll be seeing how to use data and functions to build a game and how to play nice with the imperative world.

About the Presenter

Alex Kehayias is the CTO at Shareablee and works on biggish data problems to help brands and publishers win the social web. Clojure and Python are his weapons of choice by day and by night. He is an active musician, tech community organizer (ClojureNYC), and helps mentor people learning to code.

Twitter: @alexkehayias

GitHub:

http://github.com/alexkehayias

results.description:
Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: iHeartRadio (http://jobs.iheart.com/)


Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!
results.name: Tuesday Office Hours

results.description:
Microservices are pioneering a new era of software development, and with Node.JS you can build out your own microservice architecture using pure JavaScript.

With microservice development comes the need for complex architecture and infrastructure. From key-val stores for session data to proxys for routing. Configuring this infrastructure during development acts as a massive barrier to entry.

In this talk, William Blankenship will demonstrate how you can harness the docker tool chain to cut through the complexity of developing microservices locally allowing you to focus on what really matters: shipping code.
results.name: September Talk: Rapidly developing microservices using Node.JS and Docker

results.description:
Join Be Social Change & Kristina Drury, founder of TYTHEdesign, on Tuesday, September 8th from 7PM to 9PM for Design Thinking Fundamentals - Problem Solving for Impact.

Curious about design thinking and how you can adapt it for your work? Design thinking is a problem-solving, idea generating, decision making mindset that is applicable and useful in all disciplines, not just the design field! After years of integrating the design thinking process into their daily work, TYTHEdesign has tailored a class focused on how their theories translate across fields and sectors into real world, real work experience.

===========================================

LIMITED TICKETS AVAILABLE! This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: bit.ly/DesignThinkSept8

**BSC Unlimited pass holders get a 50% discount on this workshop**

===========================================

* Doors open at 6:45, class starts at 7:00 sharp *


Design thinking is a user-centered methodology that helps you to empathize with your clients or community, design to their needs, and experiment with solutions. In this class you will not only learn the tenets of design thinking, but how they can translate into your day-to-day work and interactions with your team. Through activities, case studies and interactive modeling, this class will demystify design thinking and translate it into adaptable strategies to help you innovate within your team, enhance new and existing services, and better connect with your community. This class will help you take design thinking from theory to practice.

==================

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

• An interactive introduction to design thinking

• A process for generating new ideas and ways to efficiently brainstorm

• How to build the capacity for user-centered empathy

• Strategies and resources that can be easily customized to your work and community

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Individuals from all professional or educational backgrounds interested in learning about the design thinking process

• Managers looking for tools to activate collaboration within their teams

• Early stage entrepreneurs or those considering starting a socially-minded venture

• Professionals who have an idea for a project, organization or business that will drive social changeIndividuals looking to add creative thinking methodology to their work


 INSTRUCTOR BIO

Kristina Drury (@TYTHEdesign) founder of TYTHEdesign, is a social entrepreneur, designer and educator. TYTHE, a social impact firm, uses the lens of design and strategy to support organizations build their capacity in the social good community. Under her leadership TYTHE has increased the community impact of over 75 local and global social good organizations including the NYC Dept. of Education, Citi Community Development, Public Policy Lab and California State Library System. Recently, Kristina has been named a UNDP Innovation Expert. Prior to starting TYTHE, Kristina co-led the nonprofit Project H and worked in corporate social responsibility consulting. As an educator she has taught classes, workshops and training to build the capacity of over 600 change-makers, leaders, and entrepreneurs. Her teaching and speaking experience includes engagements at the Clinton Global Initiative University, Cooper-Hewitt Museum and New Museum’s Ideas City Festival.

You can learn about Kristina’s current work here and find out more about her background here.

SPACE PARTNER


The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.
results.name: BSC Partner Workshop: Design Thinking Fundamentals - Problem Solving for Impact

This will be a workshop that will go into the very basics of learning Unity 3D for virtual reality apps and 360 photography. Speaker is pending and open to suggestions.

The speaker, Nick Fox-Gieg, is an animator and developer based in New York and Toronto. His film "The Orange" won the jury prize for Best Animated Short at SXSW 2010; his films have also screened at the Ottawa, Rotterdam, and TIFF film festivals, at the Centre Pompidou, and on CBC TV.

Fox-Gieg was awarded an Eyebeam Fellowship in 2012, a Fulbright Fellowship in 2006, and has received media arts grants from Bravo!FACT, the Canada Council for the Arts, and the arts councils of Ontario, Pennsylvania, Toronto, and West Virginia. He holds an MFA from the California Institute of the Arts and a BFA from Carnegie Mellon University. Most recently, he's been working on real-time puppetry, virtual reality, 3D sound, and motion capture applications at Framestore's VR Studio.


Please RSVP on Eventbrite and feel free to recommend a speaker https://www.eventbrite.com/e/unity-3d-programming-for-vr-tickets-17964573523

Join us for our weekly Boardgaming Meetup at Cobblestone's pub. We're a friendly group of gamers that play everything from Monopoly to Ticket to Ride to Zombicide! Everyone is welcome - all ages (must be over 21) but must be young at heart!

If you don't recognize the games, don't worry, everyone is happy to teach new players the rules.

We usually go for about 3-4 hours but people drop in any time and leave when they need to. If you're looking for a chill, fun way to spend a Tuesday night - come!

To support our awesome, not-too-loud, well-lit venue, please purchase a bite to eat or a few drinks (soda is fine!).  Cobblestones informed us that there is a $15 minimum per person.

If anyone has a specific game they wish to play,  feel free to ask.  I am sure between us all, we should have it.

We also have a Facebook group.  Everyone in the Meetup is welcome.  Just click the link and ask to join.  Someone will add you once they can.

Forest Hills Board Gamers Facebook Group

results.description:
This will be a workshop that will go into the very basics of learning Unity 3D for virtual reality apps and 360 photography. 

The speaker, Nick Fox-Gieg, is an animator and developer based in New York and Toronto. His film "The Orange" won the jury prize for Best Animated Short at SXSW 2010; his films have also screened at the Ottawa, Rotterdam, and TIFF film festivals, at the Centre Pompidou, and on CBC TV.

Fox-Gieg was awarded an Eyebeam Fellowship in 2012, a Fulbright Fellowship in 2006, and has received media arts grants from Bravo!FACT, the Canada Council for the Arts, and the arts councils of Ontario, Pennsylvania, Toronto, and West Virginia. He holds an MFA from the California Institute of the Arts and a BFA from Carnegie Mellon University. Most recently, he's been working on real-time puppetry, virtual reality, 3D sound, and motion capture applications at Framestore's VR Studio.


Also we will have a presentation about: Design for VR: best practices for comfortable immersive virtual reality experiences

This will be a brief presentation about creating great experiences for virtual reality introduces substantial new challenges for developers used to designing for 2D form factors. In addition to the technical challenges associated with creating good content, building good VR requires attention to creating comfortable experiences. In this talk, presenter Eric Greenbaum, will discuss best practices for VR design with a particular focus on principles that will avoid motion sickness, eye strain, after effects, and tips for creating 'presence'.

Bio: Eric Greenbaum is a neuroscientist, patent attorney, and VR developer. Eric has worked on VR projects in a variety of fields including exercise, data visualization, and media environments. Eric is also the founder of the NYVR Meetup, one of the largest and most active virtual reality groups in the world.

Please RSVP on Eventbrite and feel free to recommend a speaker https://www.eventbrite.com/e/unity-3d-programming-for-vr-tickets-17964573523

results.description:
Please Join us on September, 8th

Guest Teacher

Daiken Nelson, Sensei

Rev. Daiken Nelson, Sensei began Zen Practice 28 years ago in Iowa, where he was born.

Since that time, he has practiced with several Teachers within the White Plum Zen Lineage of Taizan Maezumi Roshi and The Zen Peacemaker Order of Roshi Bernie Glassman.

For the past 6 years, Daiken had studied with Sensei Paco Genkoji Lugoviña, a Successor to Roshi Bernie Glassman. In October, 2013, Daiken received Shiho (Dharma Transmission) from Sensei Genkoji.

Prior to focusing on Zen, Daiken was a Social Worker; working with the homeless plus those with Chronic Mental Illness & Substance Abuse issues.

Currently, Daiken has Founded The Mandala Café, a Nonprofit which provides Culinary Training to those needing job training & placement. www. mandalacafe.org

In addition to Zen, Daiken is a Reiki Master, Yoga Instructor, Photographer & Writer.

Please join us!

results.description:
You are a creative being, you're just not a consistent one. Schedules and deadlines sap your inspiration, and it really bums you out that most creative success requires consistency! 

Join together with fellow creatives that feel your pain. 

Come to Barcade, just off the Lorimer stop on the L train to chat, drink craft beers, and play classic arcade games. 

We can share about our work and happily commiserate over our inability to be creative inside of structures and deadlines! 

We'll also have the opportunity to form some low-pressure accountability groups around the creative projects you're working on. (aka we will share where we're at and explore what kind of accountability even works for creatives like us)

This event will be hosted by Michelle and Alison, two Brooklyn gals who met online and decided to jump into this joint venture on a whim!
results.name: Drinks, hangs, and classic arcade games with fellow creatives!

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.

What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.

Meditation & breathing techniques are simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.

Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

“Benefits Reported by participants: - Reduced Stress & Increased Productivity - Increased Joy & Happiness - Enhanced Focus & Concentration - Improved Relationships”
results.name: Happiness through an effortless meditation

results.description:
Come join your peers from Westchester County and the surrounding areas (hello Bronx, Connecticut, Orange and Putnam Counties) for our long-running lively, friendly facilitated discussion group. 

Our group is for ALL people (cisgender, transgender/gender non-conforming, and not-quite-sure people) as well as people who fall on different places along the monogamous to polyamorous dimension. As long as you inhabit the space between totally straight and totally gay somewhere (i.e., bisexual/non-monosexual queer, same-gender-loving, bicurious, questioning and bi-friendly). 

People who wish to understand their bisexual loved ones are also welcome.

This group is for people over 18. It is NOT a hook-up group. As the name says, we meet to talk about bisexual issues. People whose behavior makes other group members uncomfortable will be asked to leave. 

The group meets at The LOFT LGBT Community Center​ in White Plains, Westchester County, New York at 7:30 PM on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of every month. 

Even if you can't always make it to the group meetings in person, please join us on line, ask questions, chat, make some "net-friends" and keep up with what is happening in the Westchester County and surrounding bisexual community.
results.name: 2nd Tuesday Westchester Bisexual Discussion & Support Group

results.description:
The Morris County Ski Club meets on the 2nd and 4th Tuesday of the month (the 2nd Tuesday only in June, July, August and December). Although our name says ski club, we are a year round activities and social club.

Our membership meetings and happy hours (AAF) are free to attend, and are always fun filled. Joining our club is very inexpensive; $50 for the first year and $35 per year afterwards.

The benefits of joining our club include access to members only events and trips, and discounts at most of the ski resorts in NY, PA, & VT, and local ski shops.

We foster an environment to meet new people, partake in various activities.  You can even suggest and/or run new events. If you come to one of our meetings you'll see how everyone is having a good time while learning about our events.

results.description:
***Note: This event is for experienced players only (NTRP rating 3.5 and above)***


Join us for Summer Tennis at Lincoln Park under lights from till 11 pm.

Upon arrival, check in at the Clubhouse before proceeding to the courts.

Please follow these GUIDELINES for an enjoyable tennis session:

1. Members shall meet outside the Clubhouse at the scheduled time.

2. First two to arrive shall reserve a court with the Clubhouse staff.

3. Post the details (court #, names of players) on meetup comments, and then start playing.

4. As more members arrive, they may join in on the posted court# if space is available (max. 4 players per court), while continuing to update the player count on the comments.

5. If the posted court is full, wait till at least one other player arrives, and then reserve a new court. Then repeat from step 3. :-)

Important Information Regarding Court Reservations:

• Reservation is free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as guests of the residents to avoid a possible $10 fee.

• Minimum two players must be present to reserve a court.

RSVP Etiquette:

• Please keep your RSVP updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

• No shows may be bumped from future events.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

results.description:
SALSA, BACHATA, MERENGUE, CHA CHA

Here's a great workout blast that will burn away that unwanted fat and tone your body. Do you like to dance? This class will improve your body movement, styling and balance. Skills and steps that you can use at clubs, weddings or dancing with your friends at outdoor events. 

Learn how to dance with style and confidence. Dance to the music of James Brown, Victor Manuel, Tito Puente, Piazolla, Aretha Franklin, Chico O’ Farril and many others. Shape your body while dancing to Salsa, Cha Cha, Merengue, Tango, and Bachata music. Build your stamina gracefully while working on your turns, styling, and Cuban motion!

This class incorporates the finest techniques from each of the varieties of dance disciplines that Mayte has spent her life studying: Ballet, Jazz, Latin, Ballroom, Flamenco, and Tango.  Intergrated in a way that no matter if you are a street dancer, you have two left feet, or a professional dancer, these classes give you the tools that you need to master your dancing skills. Control balance, improve rapidly on your turns, pivots and spins, and find your own movement. You will be able to easily adapt and dance with style to all types of music.

Price: single class $20

8 classes $100  (That is 3 classes for free!)                                                             YOU SAVE: $60 !!!

ABOUT BWSF2015:

Brooklyn Wildlife Summer Festival is an annual diverse and synergistic, indoor and outdoor festival featuring some of the best Independent talent from New York and beyond. The goal of the event is to galvanize the Indie arts and music community and represent its flourishing cultural growth within Brooklyn, with a special focus on Bushwick. BWSF2015 caters to a new youth culture that is multi-faceted, variegated, ethnically ambiguous and racially interwoven. Black, white, red, brown, gay, straight, trans - whatever color or gender… everyone parties together.

The festival is created by artists and is 100% Independent. There is no corporate sponsorship or outside funding. BWSF is unique in that it is the only festival to offer such a large and varied selection of independent artists and musicians, active within the community, gathered in one space.

results.description:
This is an absentee / distant / remote meetup where members can receive therapeutic energy from the comfort of their own home.

INVITATION & INFO

This note invites you and reminds previous participants to our weekly Energy Flux group on Tuesday nights.  Some of you may wish to include a friend or situation that you have a concern about to this group  as well (see instructions below).

You can participate wherever you happen to be at 9 pm.  PLEASE RSVP BY 8:30 PM EDT TUESDAY, IF YOU'D LIKE TO JOIN OR REMAIN.  Your response means you're aware of facilitating a growth and/or healing issue.  You may also participate for enjoyment, relaxation and general therapeutic effect.  You can request to participate for a longer period, e.g., an entire season or number of months.

If you can not reply until after 8:30 please join in anyhow and tell me afterwards.  This group is organized on weekly basis with reminders.

If you stop RSVP-ing you will not be included on the Energy Flux after a month (something good may have happened when we forget)!  Either way feedback is welcome (many fascinating and  wonderful accounts of our activity).

Besides Tuesday night, I may tune into this list as guided during various other times, some of which may be announced.  The therapeutic energy is universal and multi-modal (synthesizing a personal energy based modality, Reiki, TT, etc.).

INSTRUCTIONS

Short and simple intructions will be emailed to you after an RSVP is received.

$12 suggested donation.  Participants may contribute more or less based on their lifestyle.  Larger donations naturally support those with less financial resources and the continuation of Unu's activities.

                           Apollo Theater & Historic Harlem Tours


                                 Wednesday, September 9, 2015

                Cost: $61 Per Person-Includes Bus Driver's Gratuity

                                         Lunch Not Included

                        Registration Begins Thursday, July 9, 2015

                     Bus Departure (Uniondale Public Library)-8:15am

                             Bus Returns at Approximately-7:00pm

The day begins with a tour of the Apollo Theater. The Apollo Historic Tours connects the past, the present and the future, revealing the significant contributions of African Americans and Latinos to the birth of a global popular culture. The next part of the trip includes a guided tour that will provide information on the historic 125th Street. Next, we will travel to The City College of New York and along the way see sites such as the Duke Ellington statue and Striver's Row.

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc.

Hello,

7v7 game, 90min+, bring a white & black tee-shirt.


Game starts promptly at 11:30. If you are late you might lose your spot.

This long running pick-up plays in Chinatown and has a long & storied history. The game has been going 12+ years, and was born by a group of Irish, English, Scottish and German expats who needed a mid-week footballing outlet. The group has now expanded to include players from around a dozen countries.

The group is looking for additional players to complement the game. The match is played in a sporting yet competitive spirit. This is for seasoned players - NO beginners please.

A good attitude, positional sense and a preference for passing is a must. We usually play for 1.5 hours year round.


Someone usually brings pinnies, but bring a white and black top just in case.

Note: RSVP is required to attend the game. There are a number of regulars who attend each week in addition to the meetup list - not all players are listed on the meetup.

See you there.

results.description:
In this course students learn the first chapter of Tai Chi Yang form, also known as Cheng Man-ching’s 37 movement (or Yang style short form).  

Students will be methodically led through portions of the form on a weekly basis, with attention given to principles (rooting, posture, movement) and applications. 

The entire course sequentially graduates through three chapters, or stages of the form, and after completing Yang Form 1 with proficiency, students may progress to Yang Form 2 and then 3. 

Certificates of completion will be issued to students who have completed all sections of the entire course, after reviews and successful demonstrations. From then on students may participate in Yang Form 4 (ongoing intermediate-advanced). 

Students already having Tai Chi form experience and wishing to join may contact Inoshi to assess equivalency and placement.

There are many benefits from learning Tai Chi form.  One advantage of Man-ching's form is that it is relatively short and can be done in plus or minus 10 minutes.  Once embodied (learned well and practiced regularly) it can assist you in maintaining optimum health. For more on health aspects of Tai Chi see here: NIH.


Please contact us to schedule an intro and to learn about our program: [masked]-9218. Please note: we do not offer regular classes for free.

Dress comfortably and bring/wear a pair of clean shoes: tennis shoes, cotton or leather soled shoes (Tai Chi slippers fine), changing area available. Practice in socks or bare feet fine too. Notebooks welcome.  If class is cancelled make-ups will be provided, if missed private instruction can be had at additional cost.

Class led by principle instructor and longtime practitioner, Inoshi.


Note: NYTS does not have much of a waiting area, however there are two public atriums very near with lots of amenities:

875 3rd Ave (between 52 & 53rd)

153 E 53rd (between Lexington & 3rd)

results.description:
"where toddlers blossom"

Poppyseed Pre-Nursery offers classes for babies, toddlers & two's (accompanied by parent or caregiver.) There is a free OPEN HOUSE on Wednesday, September 9th, from 3:30-6:00, offering the opportunity to experience the flavor of this program, which has been a staple on the upper west-side since 1986. For more information about Poppyseed, go to: poppyseedprenursery.com 

Poppyseed is perfect for your child. First there is a social, exploration play time, followed by singing, accompanied by guitar, with lots of instruments for the toddlers and adults, then snack and story-time (also with coffee and tea for grown-ups), then a great assortment of arts & crafts activities, painting, collage-making, play-doh, etc., then dancing with scarves and instruments, and lots of socializing and play, with many toys, stuffed animals & puppets, etc., and there is a mini-gym with a ball pitt, slides, mini-trampoline and foam 'magic mountain'.
It is very interactive, personalized and a great socialization experience for toddlers (as well as the adults.) 

"Having fun while prepping for nursery school? It’s easy as ABC. Poppyseed has it all -amazing art projects, musical collaboration with instruments, story circles, dancing, tumbling, and more! Meeting 2-3 times a week, tots and moms boogie and bond -forging new friendships for life. Poppyseed-the perfect bridge between home and nursery school." (babies, toddlers, two’s- grouped by age, accompanied by adult) 

[masked] or [masked] 

In 1986, Poppyseed Pre-Nursery was established to meet the demands of parents yearning for more consistent social contact for themselves and their child. Grouped according to age, classes of babies, toddlers, two's or 3's, accompanied by a parent or caregiver, meet 2 or 3 times a week, providing individual attention and the continuity and consistency needed for forming special friendships.    Poppyseed’s beautiful facility, which has the warmth of the home, the participation of a parent or caregiver, and the frequency of contact, add to the child's sense of security and self-confidence. The nursery becomes an extension of the familiar family environment, providing the perfect bridge between the home and future nursery school experience. Age appropriate activities which foster self- assurance and creativity include singing and dancing with instruments, accompanied by guitar or piano, exploration of the sensory world of art, snack and story-time and interactive play with a variety of toys and mini-gym. A professional, highly educated staff helps children learn at their own pace in a perfect setting for each child's growth. 

 
Located at: 424 West End Avenue (bet. 80th & 81st)
results.name: POPPYSEED PRE-NURSERY ~ OPEN HOUSE ~ for babies, toddlers, 2's (with parent)

results.description:
If you want lots of excitement and something to do to get you through the week, come race with us Wednesday nights.   About 30 boats in 4 classes race around the buoys in Raritan Bay.   Boats range from J109s to J24's, Shields, Beneteaus.   Many of the captains are international racers and very competitive.

Races start at 6:30, but you have to get on the boat, get it ready,  and out to the race area, so plan to be there, if you have RSVP, by 4:30-5pm.  

Often, regular crew is on vacation during the summer and substitutes are needed.  Some of the larger boats can always use an extra hand and crewing is a great way to learn how to sail.  

Afterwards, join us at the bar and for supper.

If you want to come crew, let me know in advance with a direct email with contact info: cell# and email so I can find you a boat. 

Sail fast, live slow.
results.name: Crewing Opportunities

results.description:
<a>(This is a free workshop but you must register.) </a> 

"Read My Thoughts: How to Use Mind-Mapping Tool "The Brain" To Get Smarter

Register: https://www.squadup.com/events/read-my-thoughts

For the last 17 years, Jerry Michalski has been taking notes on things worth remembering and putting them into an app called The Brain. Join Jerry as he shares the process he uses to keep adding to his brain, and offer tips on how you can use mind-mapping tools to better organize your thoughts and keep track of what is important to you.

Get the app: https://www.thebrain.com/   #JerrysBrain 

"Event Description

For the last seventeen years, Jerry Michalski has been taking notes on things worth remembering and putting them into an app called The Brain. People, ideas, events, articles and how they're related; he's put more than 250,000 "thoughts" into the tool, connected by more than 440,000 links.

The result is more than one person's life diary or list of favorite bookmarks. It's also a fantastic, searchable resource that anyone can tap into, either for free at JerrysBrain.com or via a 99 cent mobile app. Even better, because Jerry has long been at the heart of the tech scene (he was the managing editor of Release 1.0, Esther Dyson's invaluable newsletter, for many years, before starting his own consulting work), his brain is full of deep connections of value to everyone concerned with civic innovation.

At this interactive session, hosted by Micah Sifry (also a user of The Brain), Jerry will share the process he uses to keep adding to his brain, and offer tips on how you can use mind-mapping tools like The Brain to better organize your thoughts and keep track of what is important to you."

https://youtu.be/GFqLUBKCFdA


CIVIC HALL ENTRANCE

results.description: For all of you Magic the Gathering players (or those who want to learn how to play) that spend a good chunk of your time in the south-central reaches of The Five Boroughs (i.e. South Brooklyn), we now have a meetup for you! Every other Wednesday, come join new and old MtG players alike for a some chill cafe gaming and socializing. All formats and MtG cards will be allowed, but do remember this is CASUAL and we are playing for the fun of the game, not trouncing the competition. As with all of our events, there is no charge to attend, but we do encourage chipping in what you can in order to pay our bi-annual Meetup dues so we can keep the group going. Happy spellslinging!

results.description:
CLICK LEARN MORE FOR AGENDA

The Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) is a 501(c)(3) worldwide not-for-profit charitable organization focused on improving the security of software.  Our mission is to make software security visible, so that individuals and organizations worldwide can make informed decisions about true software security risks.  OWASP does not endorse or recommend commercial products or services, allowing our community to remain vendor neutral with the collective wisdom of the best minds in software security worldwide. 

To access thousands of hours of video content, hundreds of projects, visit  www.owasp.org today.

===AGENDA===

6:00pm - 6:15pm - Check-In, 50/50 Social Networking

6:15pm - 7:00pm - Session 1 

Agile Security, Jon Rose 

Over the past few months, we have adopted Agile practices within the security teams at Dun and Bradstreet. This talk covers the tools, techniques, and results of this transformation and specifically focuses on how it has been applied to an enterprise application security team. 

Jon Rose Bio:  Jon Rose is relentlessly curious and focuses his time and energy on building and breaking IT Security.  He has worked in a wide range of technology roles, including consulting, security training, product management, as well as running his own security business.  Currently he is responsible for Security for Dun & Bradstreet.  Jon enjoys working on his house, exploring NYC with his wife Kate, and playing with his dog Bailey.

7:00pm - 7:15pm - Session 2

New Jersey Chapter Global and Local Updates

+ Demo OWASP Virtual Village

7:30pm - 8:15pm - Session 3

Growing Up: A Maturity Model for Threat & Vulnerability Management, Bobby Kuzma

By moving though the five-step Threat and Vulnerability Management Maturity Model, organizations can 1) reduce risk exposure 2) gain ongoing visibility into true business risk 3) align IT, infosec, and the rest of the organization in the direction of strategic business goals and 4) significantly increase operational efficiency.

OWASP members will be able to identify where their respective organizations stand on the TVM Model, and we’ll outline the steps necessary to advance through each level, ensuring attendees leave with clear action items for maturing their TVM programs.

8:15pm - 9:00pm - Session 4

Android Security Tools for Auditing, Pentesting and Securing your device, Peter Thermos 

This talk will discuss techniques to perform security testing on Android devices. 

A few 0-day exploits will be covered as part of the demonstration along with the release of two tools that community experts can leverage in their arsenal for testing Android vulnerabilities. 

==============================================

Special thanks to our venue host Dun & Bradstreet and all of our local chapter supporters. If you enjoy this community projects, events and activities  click here to join our membership today.
results.name: Chapter Meeting at Dun & Bradstreet

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/sX5hcf783iFAfUYC2cvk0A6OEz8636XdmiXuu6axJeVhph7RwJe744GrjkaEVL3QrEpkL-4gR5PvnLyTYX9EqB1rP4Lh5U3rOw81OTH9MTLoJrQgKpFBmRBKdCvBnRAV3SWRO1Y

E-Myth \ 'e-,'mith\ n 1: the entrepreneurial myth: the myth that most people who start small businesses are entrepreneurs 2: the fatal assumption that an individual who understands the technical work of a business can successfully run a business that does that technical work

So it’s been 30 days since we started reading Michael Gerber’s “The eMyth Revisited” as a group and we’re getting together to share the lessons we’ve learned. Some possibilities:

Most new businesses are started by technicians -- people who are skilled at what they enjoy doing.

Technicians assume they understand how a technical business works. In reality, they never do.

Building a business takes three skill sets:

The entrepreneur

The manager

The technician

Three phases of business growth:

Infancy -- when the technician is to the fore.

Expansion -- when better management skills are required.

Maturity -- where an entrepreneurial perspective is needed.

The Turn-Key or Franchise Perspective (even if your business is not a franchise)

The E-Myth Principle Based Business Development Process

results.description:
If you've been wondering how to add some humor to your presentations, whether formal or informal, come to a meeting of Humorous Toastmasters.  This is a "specialty" club - open to anyone interested in joining, but which specializes in encouraging experimentation with humor in every aspect of the meeting, from introductions to prepared speeches.  As our club president used to say, we're not funny people, we're people trying to become funnier.

The 2nd Wednesday each month we meet here at Jimmy's - a lovely bar where we have a backroom with mini stage, cafe tables, and a lower east side atmosphere.  The 4th Wednesday of each month we meet in a corporate environment midtown (watch for those announcements too!)

For more information about the international Toastmasters program, go to www.Toastmasters.org
results.how_to_find_us: This is between 7th and 8th Avenues - club meets in the room down the stairs in the back of the bar.
results.name: Come to Humorous Toastmasters!

***You must RSVP via Eventbrite. RSVPs on Meetup.com will not grant you access to our event. Please purchase your ticket at Eventbrite.*** 

Conversations is a series of events focused on open discussions on the changing new media landscape. Our events will feature panels with insights from the most respected news organizations, the newest disruptive publishers, and tech and media thought leaders. Through conversations, let’s work to transform media together.


For our September event, "Inside Twitter's News Strategy," join Twitter's News team for a discussion on how Twitter is working with publishers, how the company is investing in new forms of discovery, and how Twitter will impact the 2016 elections. Our panelists will discuss and debate their thoughts on what lies ahead for them and for the industry as a whole with moderator Jay Rosen.

PANELISTS


* Adam Sharp (Head of News, Government and Elections, Twitter) 
* Naketa Patel (News Partnerships Manager, Twitter) 
 * Moderator: Jay Rosen (Author, PressThink.org; Professor of Journalism, NYU) 

SCHEDULE 

6:00-6:30: Registration / Networking Reception 
6:30-7:30: Panel discussion and Q&A 
7:30-8:30: Networking Reception 

RSVP for the event here: http://www.nydn.us/convos

For 25% off of the admission price, members of this Meetup group may use the discount code: MEETUPFRIEND 

Presented by the Daily News Innovation Lab (http://www.nydn.us/lab).

results.description:
WORKSHOP CAPACITY IS LIMITED TO 20 PEOPLE 


According to Forbes, 8 out of 10 small businesses fail in the first year! Having a good brand, great skills and special knowledge about your industry are not enough. In order to succeed, you need to learn how to improve your business skills.  

With careful planning, starting and running your own business successfully is entirely possible - even in challenging times. Many companies lack capital at the outset, yet find success by following smart business management strategies. These workshops focus on what is required to start your own business, and how you can make a little money go a long way by planning carefully and using proven strategies for achieving success. 


Topics covered in this session: Starting from scratch, finding your niche, looking at your skills, explore various ways to help you select your business, looking at your motivators, the principles to start a business and succeed, options to start a business (moonlighting, part time, spin off, etc..), setting up your business, equipping your business, legal issues, your business format (partnership, Corp. etc..), market research, networking

Please note that this workshop is part of a 2 session workshop series that may be taken individually. The subsequent lecture will compliment this one.

Topics covered in the next session: Sales and marketing, getting to know your customers, who is your competition, managing your business, your professional business image, time management, how much to charge/setting prices, keeping books, mistakes to avoid, dealing with failure, startup business plan, web presence, internet surfing and Q & A

Do NOT miss this workshop designed to give you access to an unprecedented amount of knowledge and insights shared by Roger Kuperways, Ph.D., an industry insider, life-long entrepreneur, investor, mentor, business coach and adjunct professor of entrepreneurship -- He built a multi-million dollar empire from scratch and has many years of experience in a variety of businesses and industries. He also lectures at trade shows and corporate events on Business issues. The workshop is based on lectures given by Dr. Kuperways at New York University for more than 25 years.

WORKSHOP CAPACITY IS LIMITED TO 20 PEOPLE - THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

MUST PREPAY FOR RSVP TO BE VALID!
Prepaid registration is: $25
$40 cash at the door, without a ticket (if not sold out)

</a><a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/essentials-for-starting-your-business-workshop-tickets-18386565713">https://www.eventbrite.com/e/essentials-for-starting-your-business-workshop-tickets-18386565713</a>

Remember to bring your ticket. 

Our past workshops have all sold out so don't wait to get tickets! Tickets must be purchased in advance.

COMMENTS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

I very much enjoyed the workshop. I think you gave a very simple and clear overview of what one needs to do when venturing into a start-up. The side benefit, of course, is the input from those attending. You never know what unexpected tips you might get!  Thank you for giving your time to do this.  -- JB Manton

Loved this meetup! Definitely appreciated all of the members' different insight on each other's ideas. Very informative class. Dr. Kuperways was engaging and funny, and I even came out of this meetup with a new venture idea :) Looking forward to seeing the members in another meetup. -- Paloma Garcia

I just wanted to say thanks for throwing such a great networking shindig. -- Marc Rosenberg

Hello Roger. Thank you for a very interesting meeting.  The environment and the participants were very welcoming. Lots of good topics, insights, experiences shared. It was really great. Of course I look forward to attending the next meetup. -- Lucy Torres

I very much enjoyed the workshop and would be interested in attending the one regarding creating a business plan.

Thanks so much. -- JB Manton

I thought you handled the group well last evening. I liked your equation about when you can quit your job. I didn't do that this time, and paying the price. -- Tom Graham

Hi Professor,  It was a pleasure meeting you this evening and I really enjoyed the meetup. I'm just starting out in the NYC startup ecosystem -- Suzanne Sinatra

Thank you for your invitation to attend this evenings meeting

As usual it was very interesting and I gleaned some valuable insights as well as meeting some great people

Please let me know of any other meetings you have planned -- Fay Julia Meyer

Awesome! -- GabiLovve

Thank you for a very informative session tonight! Lots of good topics discussed and I look forward to attending this Thursday’s  meetup! -- Eddie Gomez

A knowledgeable host and curious participants and a very welcoming environment ! -- Ify E

“ This Meetup was sooooo informative. I walked away with a lot of tips, information and was able to network with other interesting participants. Looking forward to the August 12th Meetup for more of the same!! ” -- Linda Dixon

The startup meeting, I thought was great! Guidance - tips - references - take action - exercises - general layout of meeting -  jam packed full of great concepts --- Aideen Sinnott

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

REIA NYC General Meeting & Relaunch Networking Celebration


Wednesday, September 9, 2015

From 6:00 PM to 9:30 PM

TRYP By Wyndham Hotel, 345 West 35th Street. New York, NY 10001

Your Investment:

Members:  $20 / Guests: $30 (Onsite Registration More)

Register Here: https://reianycrelaunch.eventbrite.com


A lot of things have changed since last year.

Come out on Wednesday, September 9 to help us celebrate! It’s your chance to get your hands our new free and discounted tools, mingle with industry professionals and enjoy some wine & cheese!

Come join us for the exclusive relaunch of REIA NYC as we celebrate our new partnership with the most celebrated names in the real estate industry including Home Depot,  Realeflow, Real Estate Investment and Funding Association (REIFA), RealProtect Insurance, ISC Tenant Screening, Local Market Monitor and many more! Special event includes a look at the new products, services and benefits and a keynote by Home Depot,  the world’s largest home improvement specialty retailer center stage!

REIA NYC’s first year at the new location has been amazing. Now it's time to expand and grow even more…

ANNOUNCING REIA NYC'S EXPANSION INTO LONG ISLAND!

CONNECTwith like-minded people who are passionate about building a successful real estate business.

CREATE, grow, and evolve your business through the use of our education and mentorship opportunities.

COLLABORATEwith our community of real estate professionals to take your business to the next level.

We will have presentations, a keynote speaker, networking, wine and cheese sponsored by our local vendor sponsors.

Join us this Wednesday September 9th for our Website Re-launch and Networking Event!

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
WORKSHOP CAPACITY IS LIMITED TO 20 PEOPLE 

According to Forbes, 8 out of 10 small businesses fail in the first year! Having a good brand, great skills and special knowledge about your industry are not enough. 

With careful planning, starting and running your own business successfully is entirely possible - even in challenging times. Many companies lack capital at the outset, yet find success by following smart business management strategies. These workshops focus on what is required to start your own business and how you can make a little money go a long way by planning carefully and using proven strategies for achieving success. 


Topics covered in this session: Starting from scratch, finding your niche, looking at your skills, explore various ways to help you select your business, looking at your motivators, the principles to start a business and succeed, options to start a business (moonlighting, part time, spin off, etc..), setting up your business, equipping your business, legal issues, your business format (partnership, Corp. etc..), market research, networking

Please note that this workshop is part of a 2 session workshop series (not mandatory). The subsequent lecture will compliment this one.

Topics covered in the next session: Sales and marketing, getting to know your customers, who is your competition, managing your business, your professional business image, time management, how much to charge/setting prices, keeping books, mistakes to avoid, dealing with failure, startup business plan, web presence, internet surfing and Q & A

Do NOT miss this workshop designed to give you access to an unprecedented amount of knowledge and insights shared by Roger Kuperways, Ph.D., an industry insider, life-long entrepreneur, investor, mentor, business coach and adjunct professor of entrepreneurship -- He built a multi-million dollar empire from scratch and has many years of experience in a variety of businesses and industries. He also lectures at trade shows and corporate events on Business issues. The workshop is based on lectures given by Dr. Kuperways at New York University for more than 25 years.

WORKSHOP CAPACITY IS LIMITED TO ONLY 20 PEOPLE - THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

MUST PREPAY FOR RSVP TO BE VALID!
Prepaid registration is: $25
$40 cash at the door, without a ticket (if not sold out)

Click here to purchase and print your ticket:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/essentials-for-starting-your-business-workshop-tickets-18386565713

Remember to bring your ticket. 

Our past workshops have all sold out so don't wait! 
Tickets should be purchased in advance.

Comments from last event:

I very much enjoyed the workshop. I think you gave a very simple and clear overview of what one needs to do when venturing into a start-up. The side benefit, of course, is the input from those attending. You never know what unexpected tips you might get!  Thank you for giving your time to do this.  -- JB Manton

Loved this meetup! Definitely appreciated all of the members' different insight on each other's ideas. Very informative class. Dr. Kuperways was engaging and funny, and I even came out of this meetup with a new venture idea :) Looking forward to seeing the members in another meetup. -- Paloma Garcia

I just wanted to say thanks for throwing such a great networking shindig. -- Marc Rosenberg

Hello Roger. Thank you for a very interesting meeting.  The environment and the participants were very welcoming. Lots of good topics, insights, experiences shared. It was really great. Of course I look forward to attending the next meetup. -- Lucy Torres

I very much enjoyed the workshop and would be interested in attending the one regarding creating a business plan.

Thanks so much. -- JB Manton

I thought you handled the group well last evening. I liked your equation about when you can quit your job. I didn't do that this time, and paying the price. -- Tom Graham

Hi Professor,  It was a pleasure meeting you this evening and I really enjoyed the meetup. I'm just starting out in the NYC startup ecosystem -- Suzanne Sinatra

Thank you for your invitation to attend this evenings meeting

As usual it was very interesting and I gleaned some valuable insights as well as meeting some great people

Please let me know of any other meetings you have planned -- Fay Julia Meyer

Awesome! -- GabiLovve

Thank you for a very informative session tonight! Lots of good topics discussed and I look forward to attending this Thursday’s  meetup! -- Eddie Gomez

A knowledgeable host and curious participants and a very welcoming environment ! -- Ify E

“ This Meetup was sooooo informative. I walked away with a lot of tips, information and was able to network with other interesting participants. Looking forward to the August 12th Meetup for more of the same!! ” -- Linda Dixon

The startup meeting, I thought was great! Guidance - tips - references - take action - exercises - general layout of meeting -  jam packed full of great concepts --- Aideen Sinnott

VOLUNTEERING: As always, with such big events, we will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me.

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group

==============================

We provide furnished, equipped, and staffed Manhattan office space featuring amenities and services to support your business in vibrant Midtown New York. NYC Office Suites is committed to delivering service excellence and flexible office contract terms. Our contracts carry a term length of as little as 3 months. Our flexibility allows companies to match their New York office requirements with their professional needs.

We offer many New York office space sublease configurations, including executive offices, multi-person offices, coworking, shared office space for rent, flexible workspace, team / project offices and cubicles.


==============================

results.description:
WPNYC HELP DESK

Looking for some help with a stubborn issue you can’t figure out? Join us for an informal Help Desk night and learn by sharing WordPress techniques and best practices with others. All experience levels welcome.  This is a give and get meetup, get some help and your are sure to give back to others.

WHAT TO BRING: If you need help with your site, bring your laptop and login info to access your website.

** If you are seeking help, arrive early so we can get to everyone if time allows **

SEEKING:  More Happiness! Want to contribute by helping someone else? We can always use the help and encourage everyone to join us.


When:  9/9/15
Time: 6-8pm

Meet Bold, Generous Innovators.

Next Meeting Wednesday, September 9th


We're a group of bold innovators willing to do something new, generously support each other, and build community well beyond the meeting walls!

If you are a practitioner who wants to create a financially sustainable and rewarding practice while increase satisfaction for both yourself and your clients, go to
