results.description:
WORKSHOP CAPACITY IS LIMITED TO 20 PEOPLE 

According to Forbes, 8 out of 10 small businesses fail in the first year! Having a good brand, great skills and special knowledge about your industry are not enough. 

With careful planning, starting and running your own business successfully is entirely possible - even in challenging times. Many companies lack capital at the outset, yet find success by following smart business management strategies. These workshops focus on what is required to start your own business and how you can make a little money go a long way by planning carefully and using proven strategies for achieving success. 


Topics covered in this session: Starting from scratch, finding your niche, looking at your skills, explore various ways to help you select your business, looking at your motivators, the principles to start a business and succeed, options to start a business (moonlighting, part time, spin off, etc..), setting up your business, equipping your business, legal issues, your business format (partnership, Corp. etc..), market research, networking

Please note that this workshop is part of a 2 session workshop series that may be taken individually. The subsequent lecture will compliment this one.

Topics covered in the next session: Sales and marketing, getting to know your customers, who is your competition, managing your business, your professional business image, time management, how much to charge/setting prices, keeping books, mistakes to avoid, dealing with failure, startup business plan, web presence, internet surfing and Q & A

Do NOT miss this workshop designed to give you access to an unprecedented amount of knowledge and insights shared by Roger Kuperways, Ph.D., an industry insider, life-long entrepreneur, investor, mentor, business coach and adjunct professor of entrepreneurship -- He built a multi-million dollar empire from scratch and has many years of experience in a variety of businesses and industries. He also lectures at trade shows and corporate events on Business issues. The workshop is based on lectures given by Dr. Kuperways at New York University for more than 25 years.

WORKSHOP CAPACITY IS LIMITED TO ONLY 20 PEOPLE - THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

MUST PREPAY FOR RSVP TO BE VALID!
Prepaid registration is: $25
$40 cash at the door, without a ticket (if not sold out)

Click here to purchase and print your ticket:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/essentials-for-starting-your-business-workshop-tickets-18386565713

Remember to bring your ticket. 

Our past workshops have all sold out so don't wait! 
Tickets should be purchased in advance.

Comments from last event:

I very much enjoyed the workshop. I think you gave a very simple and clear overview of what one needs to do when venturing into a start-up. The side benefit, of course, is the input from those attending. You never know what unexpected tips you might get!  Thank you for giving your time to do this.  -- JB Manton

Loved this meetup! Definitely appreciated all of the members' different insight on each other's ideas. Very informative class. Dr. Kuperways was engaging and funny, and I even came out of this meetup with a new venture idea :) Looking forward to seeing the members in another meetup. -- Paloma Garcia

I just wanted to say thanks for throwing such a great networking shindig. -- Marc Rosenberg

Hello Roger. Thank you for a very interesting meeting.  The environment and the participants were very welcoming. Lots of good topics, insights, experiences shared. It was really great. Of course I look forward to attending the next meetup. -- Lucy Torres

I very much enjoyed the workshop and would be interested in attending the one regarding creating a business plan.

Thanks so much. -- JB Manton

I thought you handled the group well last evening. I liked your equation about when you can quit your job. I didn't do that this time, and paying the price. -- Tom Graham

Hi Professor,  It was a pleasure meeting you this evening and I really enjoyed the meetup. I'm just starting out in the NYC startup ecosystem -- Suzanne Sinatra

Thank you for your invitation to attend this evenings meeting

As usual it was very interesting and I gleaned some valuable insights as well as meeting some great people

Please let me know of any other meetings you have planned -- Fay Julia Meyer

Awesome! -- GabiLovve

Thank you for a very informative session tonight! Lots of good topics discussed and I look forward to attending this Thursday’s  meetup! -- Eddie Gomez

A knowledgeable host and curious participants and a very welcoming environment ! -- Ify E

“ This Meetup was sooooo informative. I walked away with a lot of tips, information and was able to network with other interesting participants. Looking forward to the August 12th Meetup for more of the same!! ” -- Linda Dixon

The startup meeting, I thought was great! Guidance - tips - references - take action - exercises - general layout of meeting -  jam packed full of great concepts --- Aideen Sinnott

VOLUNTEERING: As always, with such big events, we will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me.

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group

============================== 
EVENT SPONSOR: New York Office Suites

We provide furnished, equipped, and staffed Manhattan office space featuring amenities and services to support your business in vibrant Midtown New York. NYC Office Suites is committed to delivering service excellence and flexible office contract terms. Our contracts carry a term length of as little as 3 months. Our flexibility allows companies to match their New York office requirements with their professional needs.

We offer many New York office space sublease configurations, including executive offices, multi-person offices, coworking, shared office space for rent, flexible workspace, team / project offices and cubicles.

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...


-Drink specials until 8pm


-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission


-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

</a> Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and <a href="http://www.newyorksocialnetwork.com">www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
This meetup group is in association with the DaniWeb Queens & Long Island Techie Meetup.

We are a very informal group consisting mostly of web developers and IT consultants, with the occasional application developer thrown into the mix. We talk about the latest projects we're working on and get help and feedback from each other.

The meetup starts at 6 pm but running as late as 10 or 11 pm (sometimes even later!) is the norm. People typically arrive anytime between 6 pm and 9 pm, so don't miss out just because you can't get there by 6. There's usually an early crowd and a late crowd.

results.name: Pizza Party - Learn, Network, Eat, Hang Out

results.description:
"I'm gonna make him an offer he can't refuse" -Don Corleone

For the September workshop, join the family for a chat about THE GODFATHER.  

The Godfather screenplay at the link below.

http://www.screenwrite.in/Screenplays/Godfather.pdf

Whether you're a casual movie fan or seasoned cinephile, this workshop is a fun opportunity to learn more about what goes into the craft of moviemaking.

Meet and greet at 5:30pm: Arrive early for the meet and greet, when we break into small groups to explore instructor-provided movie discussion questions.

Workshop at 6pm: During the lecture, we take a look under the cinematic hood and see how the motion picture engine runs by discussing how the following crafts are woven together to create the power of movies:

Screenwriting - Blueprint for a Movie
Acting - Breathing Life into Characters
Production Design - Sets, Costumes, Props
Camera & Lighting - Directing Visual Stories
Editing - Putting the Puzzle Together

Everyone should watch the preselected movie in advance. During the workshop, the group watches various selected scenes from the chosen flick and we dissect and discuss each scene.

The Movie Appreciation Workshop is held in the screening room of the always fun Videology Bar and Cinema in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Drinking and eating during the workshop are encouraged.

Several trivia questions about the selected movie are asked throughout each workshop. The winner gets a FREE drink ticket!

Explore movies you love, learn terminology and gain insight into the creative filmmaking process. Join other cinema enthusiasts for an entertaining and enlightening lecture/ conversation about the magic that is the movies!
results.name: Movie Appreciation Workshop:  The Craft Behind Movie Magic in The Godfather

results.description:

Expect a beautiful sunset  and  Sweeping views  of the hudson  and if your so inclined we can go to get a frozen  sweet treat  or coffee at bazar and sit on the picnic tables and enjoy the last few summer nights  before winters chill keeps us indoors  ..

results.name: Pizza and Go at Pie By the Pound
Before The Leaves Begin To Fall

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!

results.description:
iMakr will be offering free 3D printing training at the iMakr Store in New York.

This training is best suited for people who are looking at purchasing a 3D printer, or are just interested in the technology, and want to learn more about the machines and software.  

The iMakr Store is located at 152 Allen Street, Lower East Side.

The following points will be covered during the training session:

• Intro to 3D Printing - What to look for in a Printer?

• Intro to the printer - Ultimaker 2

• Intro to the Software (slicer)

• Ongoing maintenance 


• Common troubles

• Workflow, tips and tricks

If you have any question, please email us at [masked]

We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: How to 3D print with HyVision Cubicon

If you are looking to be a sponsor, you can give me a call at <a></a><a>[masked]</a>, or email me at [masked], and I can I've you details on our sponsorship packages which would be of great value to your business.   


I look forward to seeing you all very soon, take care.

results.description:
This meetup group was started by the founder of the DaniWeb.com IT Discussion Community who was getting frustrated that all of the meetups she was interested in attending were based in NYC, and it was nearly impossible to get to them on weeknights for people who work out on Long Island.

Join a group of people who work in the tech industry throughout Long Island.

We are a very informal group consisting mostly of web developers and IT consultants, with the occasional application developer thrown into the mix. We talk about the latest projects we're working on and get help and feedback from each other.

The meetup starts at 6 pm but running as late as 10 or 11 pm (sometimes even later!) is the norm. People typically arrive anytime between 6 pm and 9 pm, so don't miss out just because you can't get there by 6. There's usually an early crowd and a late crowd.
results.how_to_find_us: Parking on Bell Blvd. is not metered after 7 pm. We are located in office space above Clifford Optical and the Allergy and Asthma Family Care Center. We have our own door leading upstairs to the right of the medical office.

Please bring $4 cash to the game.

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

results.description:
Who: Joel and Moshe will be the hosts of the meetup. Please find them if you need belay partners.


Where: Brooklyn Boulders 575 Degraw St, Brooklyn, NY 11217

When: We usually climb between 6pm and 9pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers try their best to be there around 5pm. If you are new, please feel free to warm up on an easy bouldering wall and find us later if you need a belay partner.

Transportation: By subway: Take the 2, 3, 4, 5, N, Q, R, B, or D to Atlantic-Pacific, transfer to the R for one stop to Union St. Walk 2 blocks north, turn left on Degraw, we are the last door on the right side of the street.

Cost/Discount: get a meetup discount if you sign up with our group which gives you $19 entrance + FREE gear rentals. You can bring your friends and they will get the same discount from us. Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount and free rentals.

How to meet us: If you need a belay partner, come find the organizer(s). Come say hi even if you don't need a partner. Sometimes we grab drinks/food apres-climb.

Notice to beginners: if you have never ever climbed or belayed before you will need to take a class - it takes place every night at 7pm. There is a nominal fee for this. What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. I usually get to the gym around 6pm, and either boulder at the entrance wall or top-rope in the main room. I post a comment what I'm wearing that day the afternoon of.

Here is the link to BKB: </a><a target="_blank"><a target="_blank"></a><a target="_blank">http://www.brooklynboulders.com</a>;;

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.
results.how_to_find_us: hi, just ask at the front desk for location of rock & ice meetup group when checking in :)
results.name: Midweek Climbing at Brooklyn Boulders (Group Discount)

results.description:
This special event is only for those of you who are genuinely interested in the German History of New York. You are in for a treat. Everyone else, skip right over this event.

Kathy Jolowicz is a native born Yorkvilleite and Yorkville Historian and is proud to share her knowledge and experience with those that are interested in the history of Germans and their culture in New York City.


This lecture & exhibit (panels and artifacts will be on display) will mainly cover the era from the 1930s to the 1960s.

The event is NOT exclusive to our group, some people are expected to wear Dirndl or Lederhosen so  if you own a set, proudly put it on display :)

Space is limited, and you need to RSVP not only here on meetup, but also personally with the host, Kathy Jolowicz in order to attend the event. You will receive her contact info after you RSVP in the group.

There will be a $10 donation expected at the door to gain entrance, which goes toward the Steuben Parade, this is NOT a charge from our group.

Schaller & Weber will host a reception after the lecture, the entire event is expected to wrap up around 9pm.

Once again, this is a History Exhibit & Lecture, not one of our social hang-outs. Please be on time to get in, it is a private event and doors will close if you do not show up on time.

Have a great Labor Day weekend everyone!

Thomas

[masked]

[masked]
results.name: Kleindeutschland, The History of Yorkville - Exhibit & Lecture by Kathy Jolowicz

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description: Does our education system make us ripe for exploitation by mass media? What would Henry George (“I ask no one to accept my views, I ask him to think for himself”) make of Common Core and other standardized tests? John Bredin reviews the decline of critical thinking skills and considers the influence of corporations on the education system and the mass media. Professor John Bredin teaches literature and is the author of 10 books, most recently The Magic of Everyday Life. John is a community leader and social activist. His current project, “Public Voice Salon”, is a video program featuring critical, ethical, and humane education on a wide variety of issues.
results.name: Education – Teaching to the Test or Teaching to Think?

We have permission from the restaurant owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consumes something. At least a soda. The restaurant also has a bakery attached with treats.

We play in the restaurant; to get there, you enter the bakery walk to the back, then make a right. There you'll find the restaurant, we are located by the front windows.

• The bakery is located across the street from Mitchell's restaurant. There is a lighted OPEN sign on the window.

• Be aware this group has an age limit, those who come to game must be adults under 40**

**Due to popular demand we will now be having a 3 no show rule. If you RSVP but can't make it please take the time to take yourself off. Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.

results.description:
Our next guest speaker is Colin Charles from MariaDB. He will be talking about the improvements in MariaDB on MySQL security and encryption features that are so important in today's data landscape.

Agenda:

6:15pm  Meet and Greet with Pizza

6:30pm Better encryption & security  presentation

7:30pm Q&A

8:00pm Wrapup

Colin Charles works on MariaDB Server at MariaDB Corporation. He has been the Chief Evangelist for MariaDB since 2009, work ranging from speaking engagements to consultancy and engineering works around MariaDB. He lives to call Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia home (but has a travel schedule that says otherwise). He has worked on MySQL & its variants for over a decade. Before MySQL AB, he worked actively on the Fedora and OpenOffice.org projects. He's well known on the conference track having spoken at many of them over the course of his career.

results.name: Better Encryption & Security with MariaDB 10.1

results.description:
All of us ... Bisexual/Non-Monosexual, Multisexual, Queer, Questioning, Label-less and just plain old Bi-friendly ...

We need a community that is social and safe and fun. We need a circle of couches in the "cafeteria of life" where we can hang out with people who are like ourselves and be free from judgment and social stigma.

That's what this meetup is all about: creating our own community.

•           ~~~~~~

Starting Jan 2014 we inaugurate a low pressure meeting for our community.


It's been happen on the 2nd Wednesday of every month. We are holding court, downstairs, all the way back at Madame X.

This is a buy your own drinks event... if we are hungry we might get round a paper menu or someone cell phone and order delivery from some place nearby.

•           ~~~~~~

Madame X is in Manhattan, on the north side of West Houston Street .. a short walk from Spring Street subway stop on the C, or any subways stopping at Broadway-Lafayette or West 4th Street.

Questions? Nudge Paul ...

results.description:
NOTE: In order to accommodate our large group this meetup will take place in the FDU Mansion (NOT the library).  The Mansion is just beyond the library - see all the details and map below.  

Seth exited Switch2Health to Fitbit.  In addition he exited PlasmaSol Corp to Stryker Corp and is now working with entrepreneurs VIA Yahoo labs.   Join us as he tells us what he learned along the way!

Seth is an experienced entrepreneur and instrumental in initiating, launching, operating, and exiting several startup ventures. As founder & CEO of a social-based wellness platform (Switch2Health) using social influence and game mechanics to increase user engagement and impact user behavior towards lifestyle changes; Seth exited Switch2Health to a leading device and activity tracking company, Fitbit. Prior to Switch2Health, he was a founding partner of high-tech startup, PlasmaSol, acquired by Fortune 100 medical device maker Stryker Corp.

He also worked with several universities in various venture development roles to commercialize technology via licensing or startup ventures; and earlier in his career as an engineer and manager for AT&T Business Services and IBM Global Services.

Seth has twenty years experience in management of research, development, engineering and operations of technology organizations from concept to advanced product/service development through product support. Seth’s career includes government and commercial business development; strategic planning, intellectual property management, technology transfer, social media/networking, finance and capitalization.

He is active in several local and national organizations; advisor for operational and strategic planning for small and early-stage companies; and an invited speaker on subjects ranging from entrepreneurship to “doing business with the government”. He holds an Executive Masters of Technology Management degree from Stevens Institute of Technology and dual undergraduate degrees in Computer Science and Applied Statistics from St. John’s University.

Seth is an advisor/mentor to the Lang Center for Entrepreneurship at Columbia University; advisor to the University City Science Center in Philadelphia; TechLaunch, TechX Foundry, NYC ASCENT, and others; and has held several Board positions to include Director of the New Jersey Technology Council; and Technical Advisory Board to NJ Economic Development Authority. 


Agenda for the evening is as follows:


6:30 to 7:00 Pizza & Networking


7:00 to 7:10 Updates

7:10 to 7:20 Audience/Member Announcements and Requests

7:20 to 7:30 Startup presentation 1

7:30 to 7:40 Startup presentation 2 

7:40 to 8:10 Keynote speaker:  Entrepreneur Seth Tropper


8:10 to 9:00 Networking

After 9:00   Drinks at Vanderbilt's in the Hamilton Park Hotel https://maps.google.com/maps?expflags%3Denable_star_based_justifications:true%26ie%3DUTF8%26cid%3D16356950445471689601%26q%3DHamilton%2BPark%2BHotel%2B%2526%2BConference%2BCenter%26iwloc%3DA%26gl%3DUS%26hl%3Den">175 Park Ave Florham Park, NJ 07932 - Just exit through the Florham Road / Park Ave exit of FDU and you will see the Hotel on the left before you reach Park Ave. 

Directions - Complete directions to the FDU library are available here - http://view.fdu.edu/files/directionstolibrarymonningercenterandorangerie.pdf

Parking - Parking for the Mansion is basically the same as for the library.  Be prepared to walk a little bit.  You will enjoy it the campus is beautiful.  Park behind the library, across from of the dorms or in one of the larger (but further) lots. See the parking map below.  Once you enter the Mansion make a right and we will be in Lenfell Hall at the end of the hall.
results.how_to_find_us: Make a right as soon as you enter the mansion and you will see us in Lenfell Hall at the end of the hall.
results.name: FDU Event with Yahoo Labs, Entrepreneur Seth Tropper

results.description:
You are invited to take part in an exclusive fashion event to kick off New York Fashion Week inspired by and featuring luxurious new lines of creation from LAUTREC.

Eventsy has collaborated with Rene Lautrec, exclusive designer for LAUTREC, to bring you an evening of luxurious fashion and a thoughtful charitable cause to contribute to.

Preview LAUTREC's latest designs, and have the exclusive chance to purchase a select number of pieces on-site. 15% of proceeds from the evening will be dedicated to the Tigger House Foundation.

EVENT DETAILS

Date: Wednesday, September 9th
Time: 6:30pm-9:30pm
Where: Beautique - 8 W 58th St
Admission: FREE with Invitation - $20 General Admission 
Dress code: Dress to Impress – our photographers will be taking your picture!

About Maison Lautrec

LAUTREC embodies commitment to perfection and the desire to masterfully integrate art, fashion, style, elegance, quality and statement with the finest materials. The guiding principle was to provide head to toe luxury for the woman who is sophisticated, elegant, strong yet feminine, who knows what she wants and is not afraid to show it, who loves to stand out and be very unique.

Each LAUTREC design is conceived as wearable art, a classic yet modern creation as well as a timeless heirloom investment.

About Rene C Lautrec

Rene C Lautrec, the exclusive designer for Lautrec, has a multifaceted background inspired by the pillars of aestheticism. Among his clients one can find royalty, diplomats, celebrities and socialites from all over the world.

Lautrec’s unique background from haute couture & Haute Joaillerie to architecture gracefully unites impeccable taste, shape, color, form, and texture. He masterfully and beautifully integrates art, fashion, architecture, style, elegance and statement with the finest materials in various capacities ranging from bejeweled metal in fine jewelry, magnificent rich fabrics in couture, to exquisite hardware and exotic skins in handbags and accessories creating the ravishing luxurious collections of Lautrec.

About Tigger House Foundation

Tigger House Foundation is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization created by a passionate Mother & Father who lost their son “Tigger” at 25 years old in 2013.

In addition to rehabilitation, Tigger House sees changing public attitudes as crucial in addressing the illicit opiates problem.

What might be accomplished if the death tolls, arrests, incarcerations and broken lives caused by illicit opiate usage were more evident to everyone? This possibility may well become reality as Tigger House, develops strategies to bring the effects into public view using technology.
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.eventsy.com/events/fashion-charity-event-ft-rene-lautrec/
results.name: New York Fashion Week Meets Charity Event Ft. Rene Lautrec

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.

results.description:
Come and join us to the first Latin America Tech Meetup in partnership with General Assembly. We will have a panel discussion with very special guests from San Francisco and NYC. The goal of the Latin America Tech Meetup is to connect the tech ecosystems of Latin America with the US and vice versa.

Special Guest:

Bruce Taragin (Blumberg Capital) - Bruce is Managing Director of Blumberg Capital in SF. Bruce has 23 years experience as a venture capital investor, entrepreneur, technology investment banker and corporate attorney.  Prior to joining Blumberg Capital in 1998, Bruce co-founded and held several senior management positions within technology companies including Charles River Computers. Bruce also serves as a member or observer on the Board of Directors of Appboy, Arcadia Data, Coverhound, Lenddo, Revionics

Sergio Fernandez (SDG-FUND at United Nations) - Sergio is a member of the Private Sector Advisory Group for the United Nations Sustainable Development Fund, UNDP, and member of the United Nations Foundation's Global Entrepreneurs Council. In 2012 he co-founded, as Chairman, PVBLIC Foundation, which focuses on repurposing media space to non-profits. Sergio co-founded Fuel Outdoor in 2003, growing the company to over 4,000 outdoor advertising locations in nine markets nationwide


Agenda 

6:30 Drinks & Food 7:00 Sergio Fernandez, and Bruce Taragin 8:00 Networking


Hosts

Adrian Avendano, founder of the Latin America Tech Meetup in NYC, SF and Miami and CEO of LanguageHunt. Adrian was born in Mexico City, raised in New York City, and has lived in Chile, Ireland, Germany, Netherlands, Denmark, UK, and San Francisco. His obsession is making things that change the world. He started his fist company in Ireland in 2008. Since then he has been startingtech companies that connect people face to face.Yahoo bio press http://yhoo.it/1kx3yqc

Felipe Saenz, from Colombia, based in New York. Founder & CEO of a startup to hire musicians through a website. The musician connects his Youtube and Soundcloud channels; 

We look for his pictures and videos on Instagram, put all his content together into a portfolio, and allow for anyone to hire the musician for gigs! 

Co-organizer of Latam Tech.

Partners

General Assembly is a global educational institution that is building a community of individuals empowered to pursue work they love, through instruction and opportunity in technology, business and design. GA offers classes, workshops, full-time immersive programs and online educational programming, including web development, user experience design, digital marketing and data science. Visit https://generalassemb.ly

results.description:
Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

https://vimeo.com/82163219

https://vimeo.com/87729077

Regular single meetup is $20

Rewards Cards available - get your card and start earning free classes!

See you on the dance floor! :-)

results.description:
The Beginner Buddhist Book Circle is for anyone interested in or new to Buddhism. In this biweekly series, we’ll explore classic introductory Buddhist books. Although we have “reading assignments”, the meetings focus more on basic Buddhist teachings rather than strict discussions of the books. Our meetings are casual and informal; all levels of interest and experience are welcome. When possible, we’ll have copies of the current book available at no cost.

*** Right Now We’re Reading: “The Dhammapada” translated by Gil Fronsdal***

The Dhammpada (Teachings of the Dharma) is one of the most popular, widely read, and most accessible of all Buddhist texts. The clear and direct teachings on key topics like meditation, mindfulness, ethics, and compassion are especially well-suited for anyone exploring basic Buddhist teachings.

While there are many translations of the Dhammapada, we’ve chosen to read the version by Gil Fronsdal, frequently cited as the best English version to date. The book is readily available in bookstores and libraries. Furthermore, there are audio versions of all chapters freely available from the Insight Meditation Center.

For the Sept. 9th meeting, please read chapter 25 and 26, the last two chapters in the book!

Discussion points include:

-What are some ways to live a mindful/skillful/wholesome life?


-What exactly is a "good person" according to Buddhist teachings?

***

Happy reading and we hope to see you soon!
results.name: Beginner Buddhist Book Circle

results.description: Come hang out and watch puppies play - what could be better? Socialization is THE most important thing you can do for your puppy. It will help him or her learn valuable social skills and to not be afraid of novel or potentially scary things he or she will have to encounter on a daily basis. Often, people think their puppies are fine because they seem to love everything already, and when problems occur later down the line, it's a much bigger issue than it would have been if addressed in puppyhood. Take a professional's advice... make sure you socialize your puppy! Zen Dog Training Owner and Behavior Consultant Alexis Toriello supervises all play dates, answers training and behavior questions, and discusses topics like proper socialization and appropriate play.
results.name: Puppy Playdate

results.description:
BEREAVEMENT GROUP: SUPPORT FOR ADULTS GRIEVING A LOSS

FIND THE TOOLS YOU NEED TO GROW AND HEAL FOLLOWING THE

                                                 LOSS OF A  LOVED ONE

*******************************************************************************

Restructuring your life following a loss is enhanced by doing it deliberately.  It requires thought patience, a willingness to be honest with oneself, and the courage to change. One way to begin is to study one's talents, resources, and options, as well as blocks to self -fulfilment. Support groups and counseling can contribute to self-discovery and needed connection with others.  

*Share your experiences, thoughts and feelings

*Talk with others in the same situation

*Learn more what to expect from your grief

*Develop new rituals to organize your grief 

                   "The best   memorial to a loved one is a full and growing life "
results.how_to_find_us: Take the elevator bank near the chapel to the 8th Floor, rm820
results.name: BEREAVEMENT GROUP Support for Adults Grieving a Loss

results.description: The Little Garden is a beginners study group dedicated to recognizing our relationship with god through one another. Our format is structured to introduce and apply the principles and methods of A Course In Miracles in our daily lives. To uncover the principles, we study portions of the text. To apply them, we practice workbook lessons. Each week, we meditate using a workbook lesson, and then study a principle or a workbook lesson, alternating between text and lessons. We also invite students to speak on their experience with a lesson or principle, focusing on a Miracle or Miracles they have experienced. There is no fee to attend; however, a contribution to support the cost of the group is appreciated.
results.name: Little Garden Study Group

results.description:
Join fellow technologists, entrepreneurs, and investors for the NY Enterprise Technology Meetup's (NYETM) September meetup on Wednesday 9/9/15 from 6:30pm-9:00pm!

[Note the location: We're now hosting the meetup at Work-Bench]

For our September meetup we have some exciting companies demoing their technologies as well as a panel on "Demystifying Corp Dev for Startups." 

• Verilume - Verilume creates a public cloud experience for the enterprise by transforming idle, disparate resources found in every data center into self service clouds. Enterprise developers and technical users access these clouds through a SaaS experience and are empowered to do work. For the IT administrator, Verilume software delivers push button creation of open source based clouds using existing or new computing resources. The company, founded in 2013, is led by a team of former executives from Goldman Sachs, EMC Corporation, and Rackspace.


• Starmind - At Starmind, we believe that every single problem can be solved, if you only knew whom to ask. Coined as "Brain Technology" Starmind bundles employee know-how resulting in a “corporate brain”. The technology originates from the field of brain research and brings back humans into the game, making company knowledge and experience directly accessible to employees and management in real time. Founded by Pascal Kaufmann and Marc Vontobel, Starmind is currently used in 45 countries by over 20 blue chip companies including UBS and Bayer.

• Panel: "Demystifying Corp Dev for Startups" with panelists:


• Debra Danielson (CA Technologies)


• Andrew Stern (F5 Networks)


• Helder Antunes (Cisco) 


Sign up today, and if you have any questions, please contact Jon Lehr at [masked]. 


Looking forward to seeing you all soon!

Yours in collaboration, 
Jon  
www.nyetm.com

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=te_U1nIvc_E


“The Lessons of Hayti” is a 1-hour documentary that examines the unique history of Black self-sufficiency and political power in the United States from it’s origins just following President Lincoln’s Emancipation Proclamation in 1863 up to the second inauguration of America’s first Black President, Barack Obama, 150 years later, and how that power has eroded since the Civil Rights era, leaving Black America in a current state of economic turmoil.

As told by prominent historians, scholars, former Hayti residents, and a survivor of the Tulsa Riots of 1921, “The Lessons of Hayti ” details a history of Black success in America, including the creation of over 100 independent Black communities, nearly 100 Black Colleges and Universities, and wielding massive political power in the former Confederate States, all within 50 years of the end of slavery.

“The Lessons of Hayti” also examines the demise of these historic Black communities over the last 100 years due to both racial violence and political backstabbing triggered by pivotal historic events including the landmark case “Plessy vs. Ferguson” in 1898, the end of of World War 1 in 1918, and the civil rights movement of the 1950’s and 60’s.

- See more at: http://www.alvapictures.com/Lessons-Of-Hayti.shtml#sthash.AVLOqpZv.dpuf
results.name: $10 Movie Night Documentary: Lessons of Hayti

results.description:
I know a lot of you out there have wanted to try a Reiki treatment but private sessions are cost prohibitive to most so I have been trying to figure out how to bring you a group session. I finally found someone to work with me to bring in enough energy to benefit everyone. I am teaming up with Kris from Integrated Healing Therapies so that we can work together and do several people at once.

For those who don't know what Reiki is here is a good article on it: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiki

Also check out:  16-things-you-didnt-know-about-reiki.html

It is a technique for channeling energy to individuals and to things to bring healing and to set intentions too. Maybe you suffer from headaches, or joint pain, perhaps depression or anxiety or stress from the job? Maybe you need more courage to find a better job, or you've been feeling sad lately. Reiki can virtually work on ANYTHING to improve your mind, body and soul!

So here's the plan, come to my house by 7pm (we will meet in the basement just go around back) and bring $15 cash exact change please, wear something comfortable and if you want bring a light blanket to cover yourself with. We will get you comfortable and do some sharing and then do a guided meditation to relax you and then she and I will go around to each of you for a few minutes of focused energy to each of you to get you truly connected to the light.

I so look forward to sharing this with you!      Love, Cassie

If you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!
results.how_to_find_us: white house, black trim (GPS may say you are here 2 blocks too soon)
results.name: Group Reiki Session

results.description:
Who are we?

We are Muslims of varying degrees of religiousness:
Some of us are practicing Muslims who simply want to take a more objective look at out teachings.
Some of us want to discuss certain tenets of our faith that don’t sit well with us.
Some of us have come to the realization that organized religion isn’t for us and want to discuss why.

What do we want?

We want to find the truth, no matter what it is, and fight for our right to follow it.
We want to create a safe place for people to exchange thoughts and ideas that we were taught not to talk about.We want to support each other and help each other deal with family questions and formulate answers.
We want to give others the chance to choose what they want for themselves, without fear of death, imprisonment, or persecution.

Is it safe to attend?

We will invite people to our meetings publicly but the meeting location will only be known to people who have attended a meeting in the past. So there are only two ways for a new member, or observer, to attend the meeting.
1- By coming with an existing member.
2- By replying to one of the ads and the volunteer group leader, Ibrahim, will personally talk to them to make sure they are either Muslim-ish or moderate enough Muslims that they would not harm members or reveal their identity. Please send inquiries to [masked]


And as this group is still in its infancy, we would like to keep it limited to people from Muslim backgrounds, as this will help us talk freely and comfortably knowing that we all come from the same place.


We will be meeting every two weeks, on Wednesdays, at 7PM, somewhere in Manhattan.
results.how_to_find_us: Please email muslimishnyc@gmail.com for our meeting location.
results.name: Muslim-ish: searching for truth, rejecting false idols, and fighting for freedom

results.description:
EVERY Wednesday Night!

New York City's hottest open mic in the heart of Queens' cultural mecca and in the homiest underground spot around - one level downstairs in the Q4 Hotel in Long Island City.

Produced by the long-running independent performance series, The Inspired Word (http://inspiredwordnyc.com), which has featured Grammy winners, American Idol finalists, Golden Globe Award winners, Emmy nominated actors, and HBO Def Poetry stars, this open mic is open to ALL types of performing artists - musicians, comedians, poets, fiction/nonfiction writers, playwrights, spoken word artists, storytellers, performance artists, dancers, etc.

20 performance slots, 6-minute time limit for anything spoken, 7 minutes for anything musical. **Note to musicians: If you have backing tracks, bring them on an mp3 player or smartphone. Note to piano/keyboard players: You must bring your own keyboard.**

We are dedicated to celebrating the best of Queens' performing arts and developing a warm local artistic community. 

NO AGE RESTRICTIONS.

*****

When: Every Wednesday Night

Where: Q4 Hotel
http://www.q4hotel.com/

29-09 Queens Plaza N.
Long Island City, NYC

Time: 7pm sharp

Admission: $7 online for solo performer or audience member, $10 at the door

This is a very popular open mic. You can pay online or at the door, but we STRONGLY suggest you purchase a ticket in advance to guarantee a performance slot.

*****

By subway, take the E to Queens Plaza, N/Q/7 to Queensboro Plaza.

*****

Produced by Mike Geffner Presents The Inspired Word

http://inspiredwordnyc.com

"It's not just a series...It's a movement."

#SupportLiveArtsNYC

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
We've got a brand new series called "Made for Mondays" that will be about our calling to be salt and light during the rest of the week, not just on Sundays.  That could mean in the workplace or wherever you may find yourself during the week.

This is a four-week series, divided into two parts. We will have a message on Sundays from 10:30am - 11:30am and supplement that with a weekly Wednesday night life class from 7pm - 9pm. 

You're welcome anytime.  Feel free to jump in on the series if you can't make the first week.  There's no obligation to be there on both Sunday and Wednesday.  You can attend either or, although we recommend joining both the Sunday message and Wednesday discussion to get the most out of the entire series :)

Let's be honest…does anybody really like Mondays?  Check out this funny promo video about the upcoming series:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FCcxw15GFbQ&feature=youtu.be

"Made For Monday" schedule:

- Sun, Sept 6th (Message #1)

- Wed, Sept 9th (Discussion #1)

- Sun, Sept 13th (Message #2)

- Wed, Sept 16th (Discussion #2)

- Sun, Sept 20th (Message #3)

- Wed, Sept 23rd (Discussion #3)

- Sun, Sept 27th (Message #4)

- Wed, Sept 30th (Discussion #4)

Please note: While we hold our weekly Wednesday life classes and Sunday services at the New York Society of Ethical Culture, we are not associated with their beliefs and values.

results.description:
Making Sense of Men - Free Seminar for Women
 9/9/15 Wed 7:00-9:45pm NYC

Private Location: Columbus Circle Area

Introduction for The Queen's Code (Formerly Celebrating Men, Satisfying Women) on OCT 17 & 18, 2015

In only 2.5 hours, you could unlock the door to an entirely new way of relating to men. And, we’ll hand you the key!
Are you ever frustrated by men?
Are you ever confused by men?
Do you have trouble with “mixed messages?”
Making Sense of Men is for women who want to understand men better. Women of all ages, who are in a relationship or want a relationship, will see the source of the changes and fluctuations in a man’s behavior.

This seminar is for women only.

In Making Sense of Men You Will Learn:
1. Unsuspected ways that men are responding to you. When you know what they are responding to, you can create the response you want!
2. Why relationships can start out great… You’re confident and expressive, he adores you, you’re having a great time… And then it assumes a downward spiral, inevitably leading to a dramatic crash and burn. Why does this happen? How do you stop it? How do you turn it around?
3. How to tell when a man is attracted to you in the most important ways. When does he have feelings for you? What does he do? What do you need to do to fan the fire?
4. What makes a man fall in love.
Attend this fun, enlightening and entertaining seminar and leave feeling better about yourself and more confident with all men.

Discover the qualities in you that attract men, and learn how to use them to your best advantage.
 Men are attracted to women – no news there. But, did you know there are two types of attraction? One type will have a man want to cherish you, adore you, and take care of you. The other type of attraction will have him thinking only of how to get you into bed. In Making Sense of Men you’ll discover that women are the source of both types of attraction.

Learn how to listen for the words that a man says when he cares about you.
 In Making Sense of Men you’ll learn that, while men and women might use the same words, the meaning they give to those words can be very different. Phrases that women speak casually can have deep and significant meaning when spoken by a man. Misunderstand the communication and you could miss a critical signal that indicates a shift in your relationship.

You’ll be able to immediately apply everything that you learn.
 Making Sense of Men delivers loads of valuable information you can put to use right away. You’ll also be introduced to a sampling of the exciting and life-changing content available only in PAX’s weekend workshops.
At the end of the class, you’ll have the opportunity to register into The Queen's Code (Formerly Celebrating Men, Satisfying Women) on OCT 17 & 18 and take advantage of substantial discounts offered only to women who attend Making Sense of Men.

WHEN: Wed Sept 9, 2015
TIME: 7:00pm Check-in   Class is 7:15-9:45pm

NOTES:
-Seating is limited to please update your RSVP if something comes up
- This seminar is for women only
- Please feel free to bring any women who are interested in developing a better understanding of men.
- Please bring paper & pen to take notes and something hard to write on.
- Any questions, please email: [masked]

Location: Pearl Studio Room 403. 500 8th Ave, 4th Floor, New York, NY
results.name: Making Sense of Men - Free Class for Women

Rainbow Tango promises a welcoming place to explore the dance of sensuality and acceptance. We invite all levels of dancers; from the totally beginner to the very experienced. No partner necessary, but wear comfortable shoes. 

Place: Asura Bistro, 235 W. 35th Str.  between 7th and 8th Ave

Time: Wednesday September 9th,  7pm until 10 pm


Join us Wednesday evening for open role classes and dancing. Whether you're straight, gay, lesbian, bisexual or transgender, you can explore tango without traditional gender fixed roles. 

Never danced tango? We'll start you up with a quick intro!

SCHEDULE: 

7 pm- Intro Class / Technique Class 
8 pm- Beginners Cycle / Open role Tango Salon (smooth dance in close embrace) 
9 pm- Eat, Drink and DANCE at Asura Asian Bistro--235 W. 35th Str, until 10 pm 

PRICING 

First time Day Pass: $15 (two hours of classes, plus one hour dancing) 


Regular Day Pass: $30 

Monthly Pass: (every Wednesday for 4 weeks): $90 

Students with ID (up to 25 y/o) and Senior citizen (+ 65 y/o) may receive a 25% discount. Must show proof of age. Private classes are also available. 

Follow us on Facebook:
Page: https://www.facebook.com/rainbowtangonyc 
Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/rainbowtangonyc

www.rainbowtangonyc.com

Friends from 12 networking groups will be attending this event. 


Name tags will be handed out to each guest during the start of the event. Please be on time.

We have taught this class many times over the last 4 years. Dancing for more than one hour non-stop is a really fun way to workout and meet many new friends.

Really nice Salsa music will be playing on the quality BOSE sound system, over the last 5 years we have created a collection of 1000 Salsa songs. Salsa dancing is a fun way to exercise and burn off all the calories. We will rotate dance partners every five minutes, so that each person will make many new friends.

7:30pm to 9:00pm: Salsa dance class for beginners, rotate partners every 5 minutes, you will make many new friends at this event.

James and Natalia

results.description:
Breaking Bad Habits & Addictions with Meditation

with Steve Krantz

Unhappiness.  Cravings.  Bad habits.  Addictions.  We are all caught up in a never-ending cycle of trying to make ourselves happy.  We get into patterns of relying on small hits of happiness and sometimes these can turn into negative habits.  This eternal quest keeps us trapped and will never really give us the happiness or satisfaction that we are looking for. How do we get out of this cycle of suffering? Buddha gave practical steps to help us find true happiness within.  So we will not have to depend on objects that are ultimately unreliable.

This ongoing series is designed for those who wish to use Buddhist meditation practice as a means for transforming recovery into authentic spiritual growth. The teachings can also be of benefit to those with friends or family who are grappling with addiction issues.  Each class will consist of guided meditations, a talk and discussion.

Sept 9      Understanding Ourselves: Why We Develop Bad Habits

Sept 16      Uprooting the Psychology of Addiction

Sept 23      Freedom from Compulsion

Sept 30      Forgiving Yourself and Others

Wednesdays, 7:00 – 8:30pm
$15 | Free for Supporting Members
Each class is self contained, pre-registration not required.


http://meditationinnewyork.org/wednesday-evening-meditation/
results.name: Breaking Bad Habits & Addictions with Meditation

venue.address_1: 81 Lexington Ave. (Corner of Lexington Ave. & 26th Street)
venue.name: Saravana Bhavan

results.description:
***There is one seating only for this event. Please arrive promptly at 7:00pm. Thank you.***

Saravana Bhavan is a pure vegetarian restaurant that is highly unusual for a New York Indian restaurant -- in that it serves cuisine exclusively from (vegetarian) South India. Their chefs come directly from India. They are run by the prestigious Hotel Saravana Bhavan, which is the most popular vegetarian chain in India. You can find more information on their website: http://www.saravanabhavan.com

David (Greene) says, "This restaurant is exquisitely delicious and way out of the ordinary. With its idlies, vadas, many varieties of dosa, spicy rasam soup, and other South Indian specialties, you will experience delectable South Indian vegetarian cuisine that is absent from 95% of other New York Indian restaurants. And Saravana Bhavan is the popular favorite and the critics' favorite of the few South Indian restaurants that do exist in New York."

They serve traditional South Indian fare including many chutneys, lots of rice dishes, and specialized breads. "South Indian chutneys are made of tamarind, coconut, peanuts, lentil, fenugreek seeds, and cilantro. These chutneys are light, more flavored and aromatic, and are the perfect complement to the food they accompany."

Zagat gives Saravana Bhavan a super-high food rating of 25 -- unheard of for a restaurant this inexpensive. Their review: “Heavenly dosas and other cheap, wonderful vegetarian dishes elevate this unassuming Murray Hill South Indian miles above your usual curry joint; regimented service and cafeteria-like decor don’t deter the crowds, so be prepared to stand in line.” (Note: Saravana Bhavan has renovated and expanded -- to keep up with demand! We have a large reservation -- in their lovely new second dining room -- so there will be no problem with seating.)

Here is a quick look at their menu:  http://www.menupages.com/restaurants/saravanaas/menu

For those of you who have never attended one of our Meetup events, this is an incredibly friendly and welcoming group. Where to find us: our group will occupy their entire, large second dining room. It will be easy to find our group, or you can just ask any restaurant staff member for the "meetup". Everyone pays for their own meal. Easy!

For the vegans in our group: many of the dairy-seeming dishes are made with coconut milk, which is vegan. But some dishes are made with dairy. If you are vegan, please check with your waitperson to make sure that the dish you wish to order is vegan or can be made vegan.

***Note: there will be only one seating. Please arrive promptly at 7:00pm. Thank you.***

Train Directions: Take the 6 Train to 28th St. or the N or R Trains to 23rd St. You can also take the B, D, F, M, or Q Trains to 34th St. and walk a bit.  Saravana Bhavan is on the corner of Lexington Ave. & E. 26th St.

Where to find us: our group will occupy their entire, large second dining room.


Looking forward to sharing this delicious meal with you!

David
results.how_to_find_us: How to find us: Our group will occupy their entire, large second dining room. It will be easy to find our group, or you can just ask any restaurant staff member for the "meetup".
results.name: Dinner at Saravana Bhavan - South Indian Vegetarian Restaurant

results.description:
Interested in real estate investing but do not know where to begin?  Want to learn more and network with like minded individuals looking to tackle the market by storm?  Come on out to O'Malley's Restaurant and Bar in Nyack, NY on Wednesday September 9th at 7PM! 

This month, Mortgage Loan Originator Dan Moschetti will be presenting to our group!  For the past eleven years, Dan has worked in the corporate lending/management environment for Wells Fargo.  This past February Dan decided to join the Mortgage Masters team and is helping open a new branch locally in New City.  Mortgage Masters is the nations 2nd largest non-banking lender and affords their clients the best of both worlds.  Dan's company lends their own money just like a bank, can correspond with banks if need be, and lends money for complex and unique situations.  Mortgage Masters prides themselves on having competitive rates, impeccable service, and uses loan origination as their only profit center.  Dan will explain what Mortgage Masters has to offer and will focus on accommodations for investors.  We are extremely excited to have him join us!

This month marks our ONE YEAR ANNIVERSARY and to celebrate we will have some surprises!  We will also be giving out a survey to see how we can improve our meetings and topics presented.  A & C Home Buyers LLC is hitting the pavement hard and working toward having a deal under contract by next month... Stay tuned!

As always, this event is free.  Please consider enjoying some delicious food/drinks and enjoy the free cookies provided by Aunt Mia's Sweets.  See you then!
results.name: Come to O'Malley'­­s Bar and Restaurant in Nyack, NY on Wed.  Sept. 9th at 7PM!

results.description:
Second wednesday of every month, we're having our Bots and Brains Happy hour at House of Brews. Come catch up on the latest in AI, Robotics, and Neuroscience over some cocktails with friends. 

There are (2) House of Brews locations near each other, so make sure you go to the 51st street location. We're upstairs in the lounge.

We're also looking for a few 5 minute lightning presentations, so if you are doing some interesting research, just read an interesting book, or found some interesting news articles, please present! (Post your topic in the comments to grab a slot. Note: no projector is available but feel free to use an ipad or laptop if you want to show something off)
results.how_to_find_us: Upstairs in either the back room, or the lounge.

results.description:
Please join us for a fun Salsa dance class for beginners, this is a fun networking event to meet many new friends. Burn hundreds of calories, dancing for two hours, this is a fun way to loose weight while having fun meeting new friends.

Friends from 12 networking groups will be attending this event. 


Name tags will be handed out to each guest during the start of the event. Please be on time.

We will be start our Salsa dance class and rotate dance partners every 5 minutes. This is a quality 2 hours fun salsa lesson for beginners, we put in extra efforts to make this a fun event. We have taught this class many times over the last 4 years. Dancing for more than one hour non-stop is a really fun way to workout and meet many new friends.

Really nice Salsa music will be playing on the quality BOSE sound system, over the last 5 years we have created a collection of 1000 Salsa songs. Salsa dancing is a fun way to exercise and burn off all the calories. We will rotate dance partners every five minutes, so that each person will make many new friends.

Event Schedule: 

7:00PM to 7:30pm: open space networking session.

7:30pm to 9:00pm: Salsa dance class for beginners, rotate partners every 5 minutes, you will make many new friends at this event.

Friends from 12 networking groups will be attending this event. 

Please RSVP for this fun event now. Thank You
James and Natalia

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, September 2nd, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The September session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (September 2nd - 23rd):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (September 2nd - 23rd):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (September 1st) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily (also the MeetUp group organizer) is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR and a monthly contemplative writing workshop. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.
results.name: Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

results.description:
The long promised drawing class with instruction!
In this class, We'll be doing plenty of drawing from the model, as well as discussing some of the sticking points an artist has to deal with, with lots of individual attention.

My approach is to offer both general and individual suggestions and observations. Everyone has a different way of approaching, and understanding what they see, as well as their own unique style. I'll be approaching this class with your specific goals in mind. (Nothing more frustrating than a teacher who can only teach you his way to draw--we all have our own!)

We'll have a nude model doing both short and long poses, and we'll discuss some of the different materials and methods as well. Please bring your favorite art supplies, but a newsprint pad (approx 12"x14") and pressed charcoal or Conte crayon is recommended.


A little about me:
I'm a lifelong artist. I spent 20 years in advertising as a graphic designer. I'm also a life member of the Art Student's League and have studied with such luminaries as Gustav Rehberger, Nathan Cabot Hale, Thomas Fogarty Jr., Gary Fagin, Han He Ping and others.
For the last few years, I've pursued a practice in the personal development field helping clients find specific solutions to meet their needs, and it's with the same focus on each individual's needs and motivations that I'll be approaching this class.

results.description:
We'll meet at the Main Street School parking lot for a loop run to Tarrytown and back. 

Details about the run

Route: As the sun is setting at 7:14, we’ll leave promptly at 7 pm from the Main Street School parking lot. We'll head north on the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail, and turn left (west) at the Lyndhurst greenhouses to connect to the Riverwalk. At the Riverwalk we'll continue north to Van Wart Ave, before turning right (east) to return to Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A tentative route map is available here. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: Main Street School parking lot (101 Main St)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Tarrytown Loop
