results.description:
Watch The Wolfpack to Help us Rebuild a School for 600 children in Gorkha region of Nepal using eco-friendly and earthquake resistant Earthbag technology.

To learn more about this project and Earthbag technology watch this video we have produced:

https://vimeo.com/134576726

Suggested donation: $20 or more.
Your donation is tax deductible. The tax exempt Id is:[masked]

About The Wolfpack:
Locked away from society in an apartment on the Lower East Side of Manhattan, the Angulo brothers learn about the outside world through the films that they watch. Nicknamed the Wolfpack, the brothers spend their childhood re-enacting their favorite films using elaborate homemade props and costumes. With no friends and living on welfare, they feed their curiosity, creativity, and imagination with film, which allows them to escape from their feelings of isolation and loneliness. Everything changes when one of the brothers escapes, and the power dynamics in the house are transformed. The Wolfpack must learn how to integrate into society without disbanding the brotherhood.
Source: www.magpictures.com/thewolfpack/

Official Trailer: 

www.youtube.com/watch?v=rDbqcMfUdlI

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rDbqcMfUdlI


About our EARTHBAG school projects:
We have visited two schools that were turned to rubble after the earthquake. We are committed to rebuilding these schools using earthquake-resistant, cost-efficient and green Earthbag technology.

School #1: Tandrang school
Location: Tandrang village, near Aurghat in Gorkha. 600 children. 13 classrooms out of 15 have been destroyed. Children are currently studying in tents and makeshift shelters.

School #2: Dharapani school
Location: Arupokhari, near Arughat in Gorkha. 350 children now study in tents and makeshift shelters. The water supply is broken.

To learn more about this project and Earthbag technology watch this video we have produced:


https://vimeo.com/134576726


and visit our website:

www.goodearthnepal.org

Our work in Nepal:
We have been organizing trekking trips to Nepal for over 3 years and have developed strong relationships with local community leaders from Gorkha.

Immediately after the earthquake we collected $10,000 in emergency relief funds and traveled to Village Masel, in Nepal's hard-hit Gorkha Region.

In the village square Kateryna Zemskova met with the village elders and townspeople, and distributed money to 45 families (5 families from each of the village’s 9 wards), so they could build temporary shelters to protect them from the rain.

Our most recent project:
Kamala, a widow, has two daughters, Nabina and Rabina. We have completed building an Earthbag house for them. The official opening ceremony will be held soon.

The house we built looks just like a typical village house from the outside, but is made of earthbags instead of the traditional mud and stone. It will last many many years.

COME, WATCH THE WOLFPACK AND MAKE A DIFFERENCE FOR 600 CHILDREN!
results.how_to_find_us: Call Baris: 212-203-6200
results.name: The Wolfpack Movie Screening for Nepal

results.description:
Explore electronics, coding, and creative technology at our monthly Micro-controller night. We talk about Arduinos, Raspberry Pis, and the other tiny devices we love to use for embedded projects. A laptop with a usb port is recommended in case you want to get hands on with any of the devices.

This event is free for everyone. Please bring a computer with a USB port, ideally bring one or more micro-controllers that you want to work with, or at least a project idea. Please share your ideas in the comments below to inspire others.

Boards are available online, or PM the organizer and they can either get one for you or tell you where they're cheapest online.

MakerBar volunteers will be present to help you with your electronics project or work on their own.

You're welcome to come hack on whatever you'd like, even if it's totally unrelated to electronics entirely. There will be plenty of awesome hackers from our community for you to meet.

The Microcontroller Special Interest Group runs on the second Wednesday every month.


[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar

We'll meditate and re-commit to our practice, and discuss our upcoming offerings. Then we'll take some time to socialize with tea and snacks!

results.description:
** Not many improv classes are this affordable in the city. Beginners and experienced improvisors are all welcome! **


Ever wondered what it might feel like to go with your GUT and create a situation from NOTHING right on the spot? The feeling is extraordinary. From beginning to end, building a moment either that tells a story and engages the audience is a powerful achievement, indeed. And honing this skill will make you a better public speaker as well!

Work with professional comedian and improvisor, Dewey Chaffee, on the basic tools required to start making bold choices right off the top of your head!

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of TV production. 

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show, "The Lady Winifred and Didi Show."

More details here: www.PlayWithDewey.com

Join us on Wednesday, September 9 to support and celebrate Kings County Tennis League! We have an amazing party planned for all of you, to enjoy a great time with great friends all while benefiting a fantastic cause.

The Party

WHAT: A fun-filled night of tennis, jazz, and beverages. Come partake in our open bar, refreshments spread, and raffle, and dance the night away to live jazz from the Austin Walker Trio. Dancing isn’t your style? Come for the conversation, the step-and-repeat photos, and live streaming of the U.S. Open. WHEN: Wednesday, September 9, 2015, from 7PM to 10PM

WHERE: M1-5 Lounge in TriBeCa, Manhattan
M1-5 Lounge is located at 52 Walker Street, accessible via the Canal Street A, C, E, N, Q, R, 6, J and Z train station and the Franklin Street 1 train station.

Dress is cocktail or business formal attire. Dress to impress!

Tickets
  
All tickets include one complimentary raffle ticket.

Discounted Early Bird Pre-Sale Tickets for $50 are available through July 31 at midnight.

Regular online ticket sales are available from August 1 through September 9 (day of event) at 3PM for $55.

Tickets at the door are available for $65.

Raffle Prizes

Ranging from restaurant gift certificates, to access to unique NYC attractions, gym memberships, sports memorabilia and more, our raffle is loaded with items for everyone! Be sure to check out our Facebook page for ongoing prize updates.

Raffle tickets purchased at the event are $5 each, or $20 for five tickets. One complimentary ticket is automatically included with an online event ticket purchase.

Online event ticket purchases include the option to participate in a special raffle ticket discount: 10 tickets for $20! 

Join the Conversation

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons

results.description:
Join us for Summer Tennis.

Check in at Clubhouse for court assignment upon arrival, then play under the lights 'til 10:00pm at this beautiful wooded park*.

Please remember to check in with the clubhouse to reserve a court. Players need to reserve a court with at least one other player present and should be a Hudson County resident with ID.

Mention to the court staff that you are with the Meetup group and ask that they keep us together if possible (3 courts).

Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game. And remember to bring plenty of water!

You can find each other in the waiting area outside clubhouse and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending. I will provide my cell # for RSVP's so we can find each other. Please also bear in mind that we are usually on more than one court - they are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. You should locate other players and grab a court when you arrive.

Although we won't enforce attendance, please keep your rsvp updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

*Free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as a guest of the resident players to avoid a possible $10 fee to play.

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 7-9pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 12 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.how_to_find_us: 39th street between 7th and 8th ave (closer to 8th ave).  Go to 257 West 39th street, and take the elevator to the 14th floor.

results.description:
Help us support the efforts of StoryForward co-founder, Steve Peters and his team of amazing storytellers, as they begin production on Season 2 of Dark Detour: Al That Glitters.

This is an Indiegogo campaign and all we are asking is that you spread the word and perhaps donate to get this year's Dark Detour finished in time for our Halloween Themed StoryForward NYC event (hint, hint). Learn more about this project and the creative minds behind it in the details below.

Short Summary

A young wedding photographer decides to get out of London and head West for a week to clear his mind, after a particularly frustrating Bridezilla event. Along the way, he meets a stunning barmaid, and as they fall in love, their whirlwind romance unexpectedly spins them to a place of absolute, sheer terror.

Dark Detour Season 2: All That Glitters is a Free-to-Play Halloween horror story told in real-time through social media and more. Happening in the days leading up to Halloween night (Oct. 28-31), you’ll virtually travel in real-time with our hapless victims as they descend deeper and deeper into a place from which there seems no escape.

But How Is It Different?

Dark Detour

 is a Halloween story for the digital age, putting you right at the center of the macabre and creepy.  In the same way you keep close to all your online friends, Dark Detour is more an experience than mere story, and will play out in your day-to-day digital life, at times feeling like it's reaching out and pulling you right back in when you least expect it. This interactive horror story will inject itself into your life for four days on the run up to Halloween.*

*But don’t worry, if it gets too intense you can chicken out opt-out at any time.

How Will It Work?

Very simply, all you'll need to do in order to take part is to "FRIEND" our two lead characters (to be announced) on the social media channel or channels of your choice, and watch the story unfold in real time.


But for those who like to dig a little, we're sure you'll be able to find other people to follow, and other possible things like websites, etc. These will just make the story that much richer...and will reward those who like to explore!

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking for $3,031 to cover some scouting and hard production costs, execution (no, not that kind of execution) and seeding.  We've actually cut this down from last year, as we've tightened up the production process based on what we learned last time around.

However, if we exceed our goal, we'll just make the experience even better by investing in additional media resources, etc. Believe us, we've got plans in place in case we're able to pull out all the stops!

Either way, in return, you'll get to be part of the team! Together, we'll bring Dark Detour Season 2: All That Glitters to the world! Plus, you'll be able to get some cool perks as our way of saying thank you (see below).

Who We Are

Brought to you by </a><a href="http://www.stevepeters.org/">Steve Peters (No Mimes Media), Alison Norrington (storycentral), and Jenni Powell (Discourse Productions), Dark Detour is becoming an annual passion project for us.

Steve is an Emmy-winning Experience Designer, having worked on projects such as Dirty Work, and for the film Watchmen, as well as over a dozen Alternate Reality Games.

Alison is known for audience-focused experiences, digital storytelling and bringing mischief to her work with Disney Imagineering R&D, FOX, Harlequin's 'Chatsfield', Sweden's Musikhjalpen and the Eurovision Academy.

Jenni is an Emmy-winning producer, most known for her awesome work on the recent popular interactive series The Lizzie Bennet Diaries and The New Adventures of Peter and Wendy.
results.name: Support Dark Detour Season 2: All That Glitters

results.description:
The Bible Scholar Series is an exciting one-semester Bible study class that is taught on Wall Street in Manhattan. Amazing Christian and Jewish believers like you will gather to receive in-depth biblical and theological training. Those who complete this course will be equipped to actively fulfill the personal life calling that God has placed on their lives. This will truly be a life-changing course! Interfaith and irreligious learners are also warmly invited to enroll in this program, and they will find the curriculum enjoyable and informative. 

COMMITMENT LEVEL:


• This program will consist of a two-hour class that meets each week, with a total of 12 classes during the semester (for a total of 24 hours of class time). 

COST & RSVP

This is a FREE CLASS, just RSVP on Facebook to reserve your seat. 

AT A GLANCE:

• BIBLE KNOWLEDGE. To obtain a thorough understanding of the whole timeline of the Bible - from beginning to end. This will greatly increase you ability to see and explain God's great plan for world history.
• CULTURAL CONTEXT. To better understand the Jewishness and cultural context in which the Old and New Testaments were written. This will help you to see many important points that God was making that often elude those who do not understand the culture that the prophets, apostles, and other biblical figures lived in.
• FAITH-OUT-OF-THE-BOX. To develop your ability to clearly communicate the saving message of Jesus to others. You will even get equipped with several high-impact Bible verses that aid greatly in sharing the message.
• ANSWERS. To search for answers to many of the theological and philosophical questions you may have. This will strengthen your faith and confidence in talking about your faith, and it will help you to answer questions for your friends, family members, co-workers, etc.
• TRAINING TO TEACH. For those who may feel called teach the Bible in some capacity, whether in a formal or informal setting, this class will be a very helpful path of preparation.
• MENTORING/DISCIPLESHIP. Believers who develop in spiritual maturity should eventually be able to mentor new believers. This is an important part of spiritual growth. This course will prepare you to effectively train new believers in the Judeo-Christian faith.
• TRAINING IN LEADERSHIP. To ready yourself to lead or co-lead successful small group Bible studies.
• PREPPING FOR INTERNATIONAL TRIPS. To prepare yourself for high-impact world outreach and aid trips, for sharing the faith in unreached areas, and training spiritual leaders in third world nations
• AN ALTERNATIVE TO SEMINARY. To gain some of the important knowledge that you would gain in an accredited seminary degree in Theological and Biblical Studies - but without having to commit to a massive program.

More information and course descriptions on the <a>website</a>.
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor Conference Room.  Text 347-703-7800 if you need help.
results.name: Bible Scholar Series: A High-Growth Bible Study Class

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

• MENTORING/DISCIPLESHIP. Believers who develop in spiritual maturity should eventually be able to mentor new believers. This is an important part of spiritual growth. This course will prepare you to effectively train new believers in the Judeo-Christian faith.
• TRAINING IN LEADERSHIP. To ready yourself to lead or co-lead successful small group Bible studies.
• PREPPING FOR INTERNATIONAL TRIPS. To prepare yourself for high-impact world outreach and aid trips, for sharing the faith in unreached areas, and training spiritual leaders in third world nations
• AN ALTERNATIVE TO SEMINARY. To gain some of the important knowledge that you would gain in an accredited seminary degree in Theological and Biblical Studies - but without having to commit to a massive program.

More information and course descriptions on the <a>website</a>.

results.description:
The Bible Scholar Series is an exciting one-semester Bible study class that is taught on Wall Street in Manhattan. Amazing Christian and Jewish believers like you will gather to receive in-depth biblical and theological training. Those who complete this course will be equipped to actively fulfill the personal life calling that God has placed on their lives. This will truly be a life-changing course! Interfaith and irreligious learners are also warmly invited to enroll in this program, and they will find the curriculum enjoyable and informative. 

COMMITMENT LEVEL:

• This program will consist of a two-hour class that meets each week, with a total of 11 classes during the semester (for a total of 22 hours of class time). 

COST & RSVP

• This is a FREE CLASS, just RSVP on Facebook to reserve your seat. 

AT A GLANCE:


• BIBLE KNOWLEDGE. To obtain a thorough understanding of the whole timeline of the Bible - from beginning to end. This will greatly increase you ability to see and explain God's great plan for world history.
• CULTURAL CONTEXT. To better understand the Jewishness and cultural context in which the Old and New Testaments were written. This will help you to see many important points that God was making that often elude those who do not understand the culture that the prophets, apostles, and other biblical figures lived in.
• FAITH-OUT-OF-THE-BOX. To develop your ability to clearly communicate the saving message of Jesus to others. You will even get equipped with several high-impact Bible verses that aid greatly in sharing the message.
• ANSWERS. To search for answers to many of the theological and philosophical questions you may have. This will strengthen your faith and confidence in talking about your faith, and it will help you to answer questions for your friends, family members, co-workers, etc.
• TRAINING TO TEACH. For those who may feel called teach the Bible in some capacity, whether in a formal or informal setting, this class will be a very helpful path of preparation.
• MENTORING/DISCIPLESHIP. Believers who develop in spiritual maturity should eventually be able to mentor new believers. This is an important part of spiritual growth. This course will prepare you to effectively train new believers in the Judeo-Christian faith.
• TRAINING IN LEADERSHIP. To ready yourself to lead or co-lead successful small group Bible studies.
• PREPPING FOR INTERNATIONAL TRIPS. To prepare yourself for high-impact world outreach and aid trips, for sharing the faith in unreached areas, and training spiritual leaders in third world nations
• AN ALTERNATIVE TO SEMINARY. To gain some of the important knowledge that you would gain in an accredited seminary degree in Theological and Biblical Studies - but without having to commit to a massive program.

Class taught by Beau Lee, the Director of the Brooklyn Ark. More information and course descriptions on the website.

results.description:
What you need to know in 2015

The future of film is thriving for independent filmmakers and content creators due in large part to the explosion of self-distribution platforms like Vimeo On Demand. However, with endless hours of content now available across various digital platforms, building your audience and converting them into purchasers of your film has become harder than ever. Learn about the most recent trends in online viewing, and see real-life examples of techniques and promotional strategies pulled from the most successful launches on Vimeo On Demand, which since its launch in 2013 has grown to more than 25,000 titles available for purchase globally. The session will also unveil new research from Vimeo that explores the various online viewing habits and purchasing behaviors that can help your next film be a financial win.

Participants: Peter Gerard –Director, VOD, Vimeo

Courtney Sanchez – VP, BI/Analytics, Vimeo

results.description:
Watch The Wolfpack to Help us Rebuild a School for 600 children in Gorkha region of Nepal using eco-friendly and earthquake resistant Earthbag technology.

To learn more about this project and Earthbag technology watch this video we have produced:

https://vimeo.com/134576726

Suggested donation: $20 or more. 
Your donation is tax deductible. The tax exempt Id is:[masked]

About The Wolfpack: 
Locked away from society in an apartment on the Lower East Side of Manhattan, the Angulo brothers learn about the outside world through the films that they watch. Nicknamed the Wolfpack, the brothers spend their childhood re-enacting their favorite films using elaborate homemade props and costumes. With no friends and living on welfare, they feed their curiosity, creativity, and imagination with film, which allows them to escape from their feelings of isolation and loneliness. Everything changes when one of the brothers escapes, and the power dynamics in the house are transformed. The Wolfpack must learn how to integrate into society without disbanding the brotherhood. 
Source: www.magpictures.com/thewolfpack/

Official Trailer: 

www.youtube.com/watch?v=rDbqcMfUdlI

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rDbqcMfUdlI


About our EARTHBAG school projects: 
We have visited two schools that were turned to rubble after the earthquake. We are committed to rebuilding these schools using earthquake-resistant, cost-efficient and green Earthbag technology.

School #1: Tandrang school 
Location: Tandrang village, near Aurghat in Gorkha. 600 children. 13 classrooms out of 15 have been destroyed. Children are currently studying in tents and makeshift shelters.

School #2: Dharapani school 
Location: Arupokhari, near Arughat in Gorkha. 350 children now study in tents and makeshift shelters. The water supply is broken.

To learn more about this project and Earthbag technology watch this video we have produced: 

https://vimeo.com/134576726


and visit our website:

www.goodearthnepal.org

Our work in Nepal: 
We have been organizing trekking trips to Nepal for over 3 years and have developed strong relationships with local community leaders from Gorkha.

Immediately after the earthquake we collected $10,000 in emergency relief funds and traveled to Village Masel, in Nepal's hard-hit Gorkha Region.

In the village square Kateryna Zemskova met with the village elders and townspeople, and distributed money to 45 families (5 families from each of the village’s 9 wards), so they could build temporary shelters to protect them from the rain.

Our most recent project: 
Kamala, a widow, has two daughters, Nabina and Rabina. We have completed building an Earthbag house for them. The official opening ceremony will be held soon.

The house we built looks just like a typical village house from the outside, but is made of earthbags instead of the traditional mud and stone. It will last many many years.

COME, WATCH THE WOLFPACK AND MAKE A DIFFERENCE FOR 600 CHILDREN!
results.name: The Wolfpack Movie Screening for Nepal

We are so delighted to invite you to join our first Conference call! And even more to introduce you to Shannon Garrett, if you don't already know her.


About Shannon

Shannon Garrett is a thyroid & autoimmune women’s wellness specialist, integrative registered nurse, holistic lifestyle & wellness coach, certified nurse-nutritionist and detox specialist.  She is passionate about guiding and supporting women to discovering optimum well being; mind, body, spirit, and emotions.  She offers a unique program and VIP days specific for autoimmune and thyroid issues and she works in tandem with your healthcare practitioner or wellness team. With a background in human development with nutrition and lifestyle as a focus, Shannon has expertise in a variety of dietary theories, behavioral therapy, societal therapy, anxiety, stress, and emotional well-being.
We will discuss more specifically “Low Dose Naltrexone (LDN) "

Fabienne | Pearl| Joseph

“…to be successful in life you need values, you need integrity, you need a vision, you need energy, and you need dynamism. And spirituality is the one thing that gives it all to you. If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 10 pgs (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Why are you doing this project? Why do you like this job? Why do you work in this industry? Where do you want to go next? The most interesting questions about our careers can be the hardest to answer articulately. 

Being conversant in the why behind your ways conveys self-awareness and confidence. More importantly, it helps you identify which skills you want to emphasize and build on, ensuring you have a useful edge in your field. 

In this meetup, we'll go through a series of exercises to help you conceive, write, and speak concisely about purpose. These storytelling skills can also be used in creating roles, hiring, or interviewing, to ensure everyone involved is clear on the "spirit" of the role—not just the bullet-point requirements.

This isn't about fluffing your cover letter or crafting a better Twitter bio, but those will certainly improve as a side effect. Instead, it's about introspection: understanding what you actually love about your work, and how to get more of that in your life. 

Come prepared to assess where you are today and where you want to be—then we'll figure out how to explain the difference to yourself and anyone else who might ask. That's the topic of the September meetup.

Once you can do all that honestly and openly, you're ready for the next step: humbly putting the word out so that people like you can find each other, maybe hire one another, collaborate on a project, or just have a beer. That's the topic of the October meetup: How to build an online presence that isn't try-hard and lame.

results.name: Skill 1: Finding (and explaining) purpose through good storytelling

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $9. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

results.description:
Be aware: There is no entry system at Mark's apartment, so knock on the door or a window to the left of the door, and if no one answers, call[masked]-3368.

This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending. Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group. Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday, eleven days prior to the Meetup. On that day, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order, with a link to the Google Drive folder where the stories live. That list will also appear under Discussions and will be edited as changes occur.

To submit, Email your submission to [masked]

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam

MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.

Send to [masked]

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.name: Brad's Novel Group

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we meditate together by chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of the gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we begin our meeting at 5 pm followed by an informal potluck social. If you are planning on staying for the potluck, be sure to visit www.perfectpotluck.com to enter your food selection. The website will help you decide what food to contribute to the potluck to make sure we have a healthy, balanced meal.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.   We never have only a few members at a meeting. A dozen or more usually attend each meeting. The special potluck meetings we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of two dozen people.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.
results.name: American Meditation Society - Weekly Wednesday Meetup in White Plains

results.description:
Experience a Spiritual Tool
That Can Help Transform Your Life!

 

No matter what your spiritual background or faith, you are invited to learn a simple technique that can help transform your life. Join us and others in your community to experience spiritual insights gained by singing HU—a love song to God.

Singing HU can:
• Expand your awareness
• Help you release mental and emotional stresses
• Heal a broken heart
• Offer solace during times of grief
• Help you experience divine love


We sing HU together for about 20 minutes followed by five minutes of quiet contemplation. Light refreshment and conversation follow. Please join us—your friends and family are invited, too. We hope to see you there.

Every Second Wednesday,  7:30 – 8:30 pm

ECKANKAR Center
11 Park Street, Montclair, NJ
There is on-street parking and two municipal parking lots in the area. Please pay particular attention to meters and parking signs. (Metered parking is free evenings after 7pm and on Sundays.)


For more information about HU check out www.HearHU.org and MiraclesinYourLife.org. For information on other events being held throughout the state, visit www.eckankar-nj.org.

 

Presented by the Satsang Society of New Jersey, Inc., a Chartered Affiliate of ECKANKAR, Religion of the Light and Sound of God and hosted by the Center for Spiritual Living North Jersey.

The terms ECKANKAR, ECK, EK, MAHANTA, SOUL TRAVEL and VAIRAGI, among others are trademarks of ECKANKAR. Copyright ©2012 ECKANKAR. All rights reserved. ECKANKAR PO Box 2000, Chanhassen, MN[masked] USA. Visit Eckankar’s Web site at www.eckankar.org.
results.how_to_find_us: Located north of Bloomfield Ave, right next to the municipal parking deck, next to the YMCA. Enter the glass door to the left of Villa Victoria Pizzeria and go upstairs to our room on the 2nd floor, directly across from the stairs.

results.description:
This five-week workshop training series is presented by your group coach and organizer. Please read the full description so that you fully understand what this is about, as well as your participation commitment. If you have questions, please message your organizer. Registration for this five-session series is open until Wednesday, September 9th at 7:30pm. 
-------- 

Please join us for a five-week gait correction workshop that will train you to run with a natural, neutral gait. When you graduate, you will be stronger, more flexible and more adaptable to the impact of running. And, you’ll do it very gradually under the close eye of an experienced, professional, certified running coach. 

--------------
Read more about your coach's philosophy, rationale and approach by following this link: 
https://goo.gl/iyzQp1 
--------------

This workshop series should have minimal impact on any race training plans in which you may be involved. We won’t be doing very much running as part of the series – most of our focus will be on discussions to better understand why we’re doing what we’re doing, exercises to strengthen our muscles, and drills to practice new techniques. You will likely find that the workshop complements your training comfortably.
Please note that you must be running a minimum of 10-15 miles per week for 2-3 weeks before the first session begins (and maintain this level throughout the five weeks) in order to participate. This is for your safety.

What you’ll get out of this series: 
- The ability to safely and comfortably run with a natural, “neutral” gait.
- Stronger calf and foot muscles that will reduce your risk of leg injuries (and potentially make you faster than you’ve ever been). 
- A training plan that carefully and safely guides you through the gait transition. 
- Careful review of your current biomechanics, plus basic coaching to correct any major issues that may be identified.
- An incredibly versatile TheraBand™ exercise band, for use with your exercises (a $5-15 value, depending upon where you look).
- A series of stretches and strengthening exercises that you can use to stay strong and healthy. 
- A better understanding of your body’s biomechanics and how everything works together when you run. 
- A new enjoyment of running because you’ll be doing it the way nature intended. 

Your commitment:  
- Registration for the five-session series is $100 per person, due before the first session begins. This works out to $20 per session, which is really a good deal for professional coaching. 
- You will be asked to sign a waiver of liability. In other words, you confirm that you are fit and already logging at least 10-15 miles per week, regularly, and take this workshop on with the knowledge that strenuous activity always has the potential to result in injury - obviously, we’ll take care to minimize that risk, but it’s always there. 
- You must attend all five consecutive sessions. This is for your safety and to ensure you meet the goals of the workshop. If you anticipate being unavailable for a single session, please speak with your coach who will bend over backwards to accommodate you. If you don’t make arrangements, and miss a session, you are out of the workshop. This is for your safety. We offer no refunds once you complete session #1, which is designed to be fair to your coach.
- You must adhere to the training plan and commit to diligently completing all homework assignments. Again, this is for your safety.
- You are required to tell your coach if you experience any pain, discomfort or are unsure of anything. Our primary goal is safety, if it’s not clear by now.

Schedule & summary of workshop sessions 
(You must attend every session):
> Session #1 [90 minutes]:  September 9th, 7:30 - 9:00pm
Introduction - identify workshop goals and flow of the series; review risks associated with change and your participation commitment; conduct a personal gait analysis.

> Session #2 [60 minutes]:  September 16th, 7:30 - 8:30pm
Discuss running cadence and foot strike; Go through homework exercises.

> Session #3 [60 minutes]:  September 23rd, 7:30 - 8:30pm
Discuss overall biomechanics and how everything works together; Review proper running form with practice drills; Go through homework exercises.

> Session #4 [60 minutes]:  September 30th, 7:30 - 8:30pm
Practice what we’ve learned with a short run, some drills and exercises.

> Session #5 [60 minutes]:  October 7th, 7:30 - 8:30pm
Workshop recap and discussion; Go for a 2ish mile run to practice what we’ve learned plus exercises and some drills.


NOTES:  
- If you have any persistent injuries, please bring them to the attention of your coach before the first session. 
- In the event of inclement weather or serious environmental issues, we may reschedule a session. We will figure out details if a situation presents itself. 
- In the event that you will not be able to make a session, please let your coach know asap. We will do everything possible to set up a one-on-one session to accommodate you, if scheduling permits. But, if you skip a week, you will not be permitted to return to the series. Again, this is for your safety. 
- You will be asked to walk, run, stretch, and move with bare feet at certain points during these sessions. If this scares you (a) this workshop might not be a good fit for you; and (b) get over it – we are all born with bare feet.

To Register:  
1. RSVP to this event. Registration will be closed when the first session starts. We would love for you to join us for a future workshop series if you miss this one! 
2. Please pay the registration fee in cash. If you absolutely cannot make your way to an ATM, please make other arrangements with the organizer. 
3. Please be sure that you have been consistently running at least 10-15 miles per week for at least 2-3 weeks before the first session, and that you plan to maintain this fitness level for the five weeks of the workshop. This is a requirement and is for intended to be for your safety. If you don't meet this requirement, please join us for a future workshop series.

results.description:
Mindfulness for Busy People

Meditation helps us find happiness within. Meditation can be done while you are walking, shopping, working, even while watching T.V.! In this series we explore simple but effective meditative practices for your busy life. These practices will increase the spiritual dimension to your day without demanding extra time from your schedule. Learn how the things you already do can become a path to contentment and meaning.

All Attendees MUST register on Eventbrite for Headcount Purposes: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/free-monthly-real-estate-crowdfunding-webinar-8-on-boston-real-estate-investing-tickets-17701468569

Welcome to the 8th installment of our real estate crowdfunding monthly webinar series on Boston Real Estate Investing!

You can watch this month's Free Patch of Land Webinar Here: https://patchofland.com/blog/?p=5586

The webinar will be held on Wednesday August 19th at 5:00 PST / 6:00 MST / 7:00 CST / 8:00 EST.

Webinars will be hosted by Doug Cochrane (SVP of Underwriting & Acquisitions at +Patch of Land)&+Manolis Sfinarolakis (Community Manager at +Patch of Land). They will be interviewing special guest (XinsernameX), (Xinsert title & companyX), to discuss the exciting opportunities that Boston is presenting to real estate investors and community redevelopers.

Download our FREE Boston Research Report Here:

By watching this webinar, you will learn:

1) Why Boston is a hotspot for real estate investing
2) First hand experiences from Boston investors on where the opportunities are
3) How crowdfunding platforms are fueling and accelerating the real estate community development process in Boston markets
4) An opportunity on August 20th to attend an event in Boston at the Boston AREIA Association where Patch of Land will be the keynote speaker
5) What the future holds for Boston real estate and real estate crowdfunding
6) A questions & answers session for our guest speaker and panelists

Every webinar will be very interactive. In fact, we welcome your participation and will be taking live questions throughout the hour, so please submit your questions and topic ideas before each webinar.  This will be a great opportunity to have your questions answered and learn from these two pros.  However, if you miss one don't worry. You can always view a replay, and of course, join us for the next month's webinar.

Related Video: Real Estate Crowdfunding 101: Introduction to Patch of Landhttps://plus.google.com/events/cvi5dc3f5sm7mtqaj6gqec05u3s

Please reach out with suggestions, questions and topic ideas that you'd like us to cover on the webinars.  We look forward to our Eigth 2015 installment on Wednesday August 19th.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

BWSF2015 - Max Cellar

Performance Schedule:

20:00   CallMe TK
20:20   Negros Americanos
20:40   Silverteeth
21:00   Nathaniel Mann
21:20   Starr Busby
21:45   Lady Moon & The Eclipse
22:30   RESONICA
22:50   Deuce Ellis
23:10   Ohene Cornelius
23:35   The Saturators

ABOUT BWSF2015:

Brooklyn Wildlife Summer Festival is an annual diverse and synergistic, indoor and outdoor festival featuring some of the best Independent talent from New York and beyond. The goal of the event is to galvanize the Indie arts and music community and represent its flourishing cultural growth within Brooklyn, with a special focus on Bushwick. BWSF2015 caters to a new youth culture that is multi-faceted, variegated, ethnically ambiguous and racially interwoven. Black, white, red, brown, gay, straight, trans - whatever color or gender… everyone parties together.

The festival is created by artists and is 100% Independent. There is no corporate sponsorship or outside funding. BWSF is unique in that it is the only festival to offer such a large and varied selection of independent artists and musicians, active within the community, gathered in one space. 

BWSF focuses on performers in the Brooklyn arts and entertainment scene and due to the large presence of international artists in Brooklyn, the festival includes performers and participants from all around the world. There will be representation from UK, Germany, Denmark, Australia, Caribbean, Jamaica, Russia and more. 

BWSF2015 SEEKS TO REACH: 
Multicultural and Multiethnic people, ages 18-80

The festival attracts individuals who:
• Are seekers, social explorers, tastemakers and enjoy being ahead of the curve.
• Believe old-fashioned business models are outdated and traditional vehicles for communication (TV and Radio) are no longer in tune with the consumer of today.
• Have turned their backs on the status quo and crave progressive thought, art and culture.
• Artists, musicians, Brooklyn and New York dwellers and everyone who is part of or who appreciated the Indie scene.
results.name: BWSF2015 @ Max Cellar

group.name: Brooklyn Wildlife: Art, Parties and Music

results.description:
Having trouble fully absorbing A Course in Miracles (ACIM) or another non-dualistic spiritual tradition? Then A COURSE OF LOVE may be just for you! Channeled by the same voice that authored ACIM but in more easy to understand language, Mari Perron's A COURSE OF LOVE speaks to the heart rather than the mind. Let's explore this important new text together and use it as a springboard to become peaceful miracle workers. 

Led by CRS co-founders and ACIM Teachers/Healers Yasuko Kasaki and Christopher Pelham, this class will begin at the beginning of the book and work its way through the text week by week, taking breaks whenever Yasuko is away teaching in Japan (usually November, March and July).

It may be astonishing to hear that there is a “continuation” of A Course in Miracles, but it is true. Forty years ago Jesus dictated ACIM to the scribe Helen Schucman. More recently, over three years, he similarly dictated A Course of Love. Jesus himself referred to what he was dictating as a “continuation of A Course in Miracles.” Students of ACIM will recognize the Voice. Students of truth, whatever their background, will find that ACOL resonates with the heart.

A COURSE OF LOVE builds upon the same non-dualistic thought system as ACIM, yet it is a course for the heart. ACOL and ACIM work hand-in-hand. Yet remarkably, ACOL bypasses the mind. It uses thought to go beyond thought. Those yearning to access the heart’s knowing will find help here. This is your invitation to live the purposeful, meaningful life of the new—the reality of heaven on earth.

Classes are $20 and class cards are available.
results.how_to_find_us: above Think Coffee (look for the brown door to the right/south of Think and ring the bottom buzzer)
results.name: Intro to A COURSE OF LOVE by Mari Perron

group.name: A Course in Miracles ongoing class

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
